clean_text: request for email data contribution â€“ research acknowledgment included dear student thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. we truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of our academic email classification model. as promised, your data will be used strictly for academic purposes, and only informational emails will be processed. your contribution will also be acknowledged in our final presentation/report. to make the process simple, weâ€™ve prepared a google drive folder containing: a script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox. a short instruction video explaining exactly how to run the script safely and securely. the video is inside the same folder, titled â€œemail extraction instructions.mp4â€. the link to provide the extracted emails is given below please go through the video before running the script. if you have any doubts or face any issues at any step, feel free to reach out to us â€” we're more than happy to help! once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research project. your support means a lot to us! warm

re: request for email data contribution â€“ research acknowledgment included i hope you're doing well. this is a final reminder to please complete and submit the email extraction process by end of day tomorrow, 26th june 2025, as previously communicated. we are scheduled to begin the next phase of our projectâ€”data cleaning and model trainingâ€”and your submission is a crucial part of that process. we completely understand that things can get busy, but if there's any issue or if youâ€™re facing difficulties with the script, please donâ€™t hesitate to let us knowâ€”weâ€™re more than happy to assist. thank you, james dhandhukiya. on fri, jun 13, 2025 at 11:08 am 24dce124 hetvi sardhara < 24dce124@charusat.edu.in> wrote: > what kind of help will you need from our side in this > >>

reg. activity planning for career readiness (a.y. 2025-26 (odd)) dear students, as part of our ongoing efforts to support students in preparing for professional opportunities, the *training and placement committee, depstar, *has planned various *career readiness activities* aimed at enhancing essential employability skills. this series of sessions will cover essential career readiness components, including *resume writing*, *email etiquette*, *verbal communication skills*, and *professional branding through platforms like linkedin and github*. activities such as *icebreaker sessions, role plays*, and *alumni-led profile reviews* are designed to help students build a confident and industry-ready professional identity. your active participation is highly encouraged, as these sessions will significantly enhance your preparation for campus placements and contribute to your overall career growth. the schedule of the activities is attached herewith for your kind perusal. ----------------- regards, khushi patel, assistant professor & training and placement representative, department of computer engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar), faculty of technology and engineering (fte), charotar university of science & technology (charusat), at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. --

internal & external guide allocation â€“ 5th and 7th semester projects *dear students,* please find attached the sheet containing the *internal and external guide allocation* for 5th and 7th semester students. *sheet link:* all students are *requested to contact their assigned internal and external guides* and begin the *implementation of their project from the very first day of the semester*. periodic reporting and documentation students are required to report *regularly* to both internal and external guides and maintain proper documentation of their progress in a *physical project file*, which must include: - *weekly reports* signed and dated by the internal guide (*format is attached here*) - *email copies* of communication with the external guide please ensure that documentation is maintained sincerely, as it is essential for your project evaluation. for any queries, contact your department project coordinator. -- *regards:* mr. pravin jadav, assistant professor, department of computer engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charotar university of science and technology (charusat), at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. --

before you know it, weâ€™ll be approaching the home stretch. by our count so far: - 105,000+ registered participants (and still climbing ( ) !) - 1,000+ projects already submitted - 57,000+ members in the bolt discord ( ) - 30+ mentors actively supporting the community - 40 official judges ready to judge your projects! whether youâ€™re running behind, ahead, or right on schedule, itâ€™s time to power through in these final 12 days of building. to keep your eye on the (literal) prize, weâ€™re happy to share: weâ€™ve got a little something planned for everyone who submits a project. more details soon. thereâ€™s also the casual $1,037,500 in prizes, including challenger prize categories: - make more money challenge (3 winners!) sponsored by revenuecat - custom domain challenge sponsored by entri - blockchain challenge sponsored by algorand foundation - conversational ai video challenge sponsored tavus - voice ai challenge sponsored by elevenlabs - deploy challenge sponsored by netlify - useless sh!t challenge sponsored by reddit - startup challenge sponsored by supabase ğŸ‘‰ check out alllll of the prize categories and dollar amounts ( ) say hi irl! important: leave rules sop for all students ğŸ“Œ sop highlights (as per official document) 1. *attendance requirements* - minimum *75% attendance* per semester is mandatory to be eligible for university exam form submission. - participation in *co-curricular/extra-curricular activities* will be counted within the *remaining 25% margin*. 2. *leave application rules* - leave must be applied *in advance* to the *batch counsellor*. - leave is considered *granted only after endorsement by the head of department (hod)*. - *prior approval is mandatory.* 3. *medical leave* - considered part of attendance only if: - leave application is submitted. - valid *medical certificate is submitted upon resuming* college. 4. *academic leave for activities* - leave for representing charusat/depstar in academic, co-curricular, or extra-curricular events is granted as *academic leave*. - this leave will count within the 25% margin of allowed absences. - flexibility in *submissions and evaluations* may be provided *with hod approval*. 5. *student responsibility* - students must *submit leave applications in advance*. - *no re-conduction* of missed internal evaluations will be allowed. - only *approved medical leave* may be used to meet the 75% attendance exemption clause. ------------------------------ best regards, chintal upendra raval, assistant professor, department of information technology devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology *email*: chintalraval.dit@charusat.ac.in *phone*: 9016156565 *intercom extension*: 5114 --

invitation to participate in online quiz on 11th international day of yoga â€“ organized by nss-pdpias unit dear all, warm greetings! on the occasion of the *11th international day of yoga*, the *nss unit of pdpias* is organising an *online quiz* to spread awareness about the ancient indian practice of yoga and its significance in our daily lives. we invite all students, faculties, staff and charusat family members to participate in this engaging and informative quiz enthusiastically. *date:* 17th june 2025 *mode:* online *quiz link:* *time: *10:00 am to 03:00 pm *e-certificates* will be provided to all participants on or before june 19, 2025, via email. the quiz aims to promote the importance of yoga for physical and mental well-being and to honour the spirit of this global celebration. let us come together and celebrate *yoga for harmony and peace*. for any queries, please contact: dr. rajesh v. savalia, m. 94292 22899 --

film your hackathon journey and be part of the ai gold rush story ğŸ“½ï¸ greg isenberg and an emmy award-winning crew are filming a documentary to explore the ai gold rush and they'll be featuring builders from the world's largest hackathon. the series will reach millions, making it an incredible opportunity to share your story, showcase your project, and maybe even land your first customer. happy friday builders! weâ€™ve partnered with our friends at entri ( ) to bring you this email full of exciting news and updates. first, we canâ€™t stress enough how inspiring itâ€™s been to see you all hackinâ€™ away this week, whether itâ€™s solo, as part of a team, or just collabing and co-working in the same spaces on discord together ( ) . you should feel proud of what youâ€™ve already accomplished, and weâ€™re cheering big for you as you approach the halfway mark. team rules clarification a lot of you had questions about submitting entries as a team, so weâ€™ve made it more clear in the official rules ( ) . tl;dr: a team or org must appoint and authorize one individual to represent, act, and enter a submission on their behalf, and all team members must meet the official eligibility requirements. builder pack update if you registered but havenâ€™t received your builder pack yet, weâ€™re on it. with nearly 100k builders, we ran out of bolt codes faster than expected. weâ€™re generating more and reaching out to sponsors for extra codes. as soon as weâ€™ve got everything, the rest of the packs will ship via email. we appreciate your patience! get featured in the hackathon docuseries greg isenberg and an emmy award-winning crew are filming a documentary ( ) to explore the ai gold rush and they'll be featuring builders from the world's largest hackathon. the series will reach millions, making it an incredible opportunity to share your story, showcase your project, and maybe even land your first customer. if youâ€™re interested in being considered in the documentary: - film yourself (and your team) working on your project, telling your story, and sharing your progress. content can include selfie or vlog-style videos, zoom and discord calls, and anything else you capture throughout your journey. - fill out the submission form ( ) , where you will also upload your footage. get featured ( ) entri challenger prize as a proud sponsor of the bolt hackathon, entri builds solutions that simplify domains for everyday users. hackathon participants can win $25,000 in the custom domain challenge ( ) . whether it's clever, bold or brilliantly simple, simply register your domain name via entri or ionos; the most creative domain name wins! be sure to peruse all of the additional challenger prizes ( ) to see which unique categories that your project qualifies for; thereâ€™s plenty of chances for your entry to shine! next week's livestreams we will be hosting even more helpful livestreams next week: - hackathon news live with ceo eric simons #1 ( ) - today at 3pm pt - making money on mobile with revenuecat ( ) - monday, june 16th at 9am pt - ai pricing models with paddle ( ) - tuesday, june 17th at 9am pt - dappier deep dive: build, monetize, repeat ( ) - thursday, june 19th at 9am pt - web3 for builders: live with algorand foundation ( ) -friday, june 20th at 9am pt congrats if you read this far, now go have a wonderful weekend building! eric simons ceo & co-founder, bolt.new ( ) stackblitz, inc., 2443 fillmore street #380-16814, san francisco, ca, 94115, united states. to opt out of future emails from stackblitz, click here to unsubscribe ( ) .

invitation to participate in 11th international yoga day - online debate competition organized by iiim nss cell dear students, greetings from iiim nss cell!!! to celebrate the *11th international yoga day,* indukaka ipcowala institute of management (iiim) - nss cell has organized an *online debate competition* on *june 20, 2025 (friday).* *online debate competition â€“ event details:* *date:* june 20, 2025 *time:* 10:30 am onward *theme:* yoga for one earth, one health* (topics to be provided one hour prior to the scheduled start of the competition)* *registration process:* interested participants are requested to register latest by *june 19, 2025* *till 12 pm* using the following link: *online debate format:* *the structure and flow of the debate will be determined based on the total number of registered participants. topics will be shared with participants one hour prior to the competition.* *proposed rounds:* 1. *preliminary round:* - each participant will speak for 3 minutes, either *for* or *against* the motion. - top-performing speakers from the preliminary round will advance to the final round. 2. *final round (crossfire & closing statement):* - a crossfire round will be conducted, where the selected participants will engage in a q&a session with each other and the judges. - each finalist will then present a 1-minute closing statement. *judging criteria:* - content & knowledge - delivery & clarity - rebuttal & defence - engagement & time adherence *certificates:* - winners will be awarded 1st, 2nd, and 3rd prizes. - all participants will receive a certificate of participation. together let's make this international yoga day memorable. we look forward to your cooperation at this extraordinary international yoga day celebration. please contact* iiim nss coordinators: *dr. poonam amrutia (+91 94295 58484); request for email data contribution â€“ research acknowledgment included *dear fellow student,* we hope you're doing well. we are a group of students working on a research project focused on analyzing charusat student inbox data to train a machine learning model that can automatically classify academic emails â€” such as faculty announcements, seminar notifications, class updates, and internship opportunities. we are reaching out to a few *handpicked students*, and we believe your contribution could significantly strengthen the quality of our dataset. as a token of appreciation, all contributors will be *acknowledged in our final research presentation/report*. please rest assured: Â· your data will be used *strictly for academic and research purposes*. Â· we are only interested in academic/informational emails, *not personal content*. Â· *no data will be collected without your clear consent*, and we will *explain the data extraction process in detail* if you agree to help. if you're willing to contribute or have any questions, feel free to reach out. we truly appreciate your support in helping make this student-led research a success! *note:* please reach out to us if you agree by 15th june 2025. warm

join the world hackathon and innovate globally! hi kevin, get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! the *world hackathon* is just around the corner, and we're inviting developers, designers, and innovators like you to participate. this virtual event brings together brilliant minds from around the globe to collaborate, learn, and build groundbreaking solutions. whether you're a seasoned hacker or new to hackathons, the world hackathon offers an incredible opportunity to: - *solve real-world problems:* work on challenging tracks and develop solutions that can make a real impact. - *collaborate internationally:* team up with participants from diverse backgrounds and expand your network. - *learn and grow:* access workshops, mentorship, and resources to enhance your skills. - *win exciting prizes:* compete for recognition and rewards. ------------------------------ *event details:* - *website:* - *registration deadline:* 14-06-2025 - *event dates:* 14-06-2025 to 20-06-2025 ------------------------------ ready to make your mark? visit our devpost page to learn more about the challenges, rules, and how to register. we can't wait to see what you'll create! best

embrace harmony: yoga & nature session dear all, as part of the 11th international day of yoga (idy) 2025 celebrations, charusat enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental consciousness. join us for our special "yoga & nature" session, designed to connect your well-being with the serenity of the outdoors. *event details:* - *what:* "yoga & nature" session - *when:* june 16th to june 20th, 2025 - *time:* 5:30 pm to 6:45 pm daily - *where:* centre lawn, charusat campus this session offers a unique opportunity to experience the profound benefits of yoga amidst nature, aligning with this year's idy theme: "yoga for one earth, one health." let's come together to foster holistic well-being and environmental sustainability. *kindly confirm your registration by clicking on: * *who can attend:* all charusat students, faculty, staff, and the wider community are welcome! please bring: your own yoga mat and a water bottle. e-certificates will be provided to all participants. let's celebrate the spirit of yoga and its connection to our planet. we look forward to seeing you there! *for more information, please contact:* dr.pritesh patel -- assistant director of physical education and sports charusat physical education and sports section (a constituent of charusat) *accredited with "grade a+" by naac, goi* *accredited with centre of excellence by gog* landline no: 02697-265036 mobile : -- 97142 96999 --

level up your build with claude sonnet 4 + week 2 hackathon updates weâ€™ve partnered with anthropic to bring claude sonnet 4 to all bolt users! push your build to the next level. hey there, we wanted to give you some monday updates as we head into week 2 of the worldâ€™s largest hackathon! first, based on questions from participants, weâ€™ve clarified some rules that will help you submit with more confidence. watch the quick nâ€™ easy video update here ( ) , or review the official rules ( ) for the full rundown. it is not too late to register for the hackathon! register ( ) for the hackathon to get your free builder pack which includes free bolt pro and much more. existing bolt subscribers may use the code for $30 off any subscription upgrades.the pack is sent to you via email within 48 hours of signing up, so be sure to sign-up asap! weâ€™ve partnered with anthropic to bring claude sonnet 4 to all bolt users the wait is over! claude sonnet 4 is now live on bolt ğŸ‘Œ one of the smartest models out there, fully integrated into your favorite ai builder. push your build to the next level. read our blog post ( ) or learn more in the announcement tweet ( ) . bolt-anthropic-1x1-v3-1 ( ) still need your builder pack? if you have not received your builder pack, hereâ€™s what to do: - step 1: make sure you have registered on hackathon.dev ( ) - step 2: wait at least 3 days - step 3: check your email inbox - step 4: if you have already completed steps 1-3, proceed to fill out this form ( ) this weekâ€™s livestreams we just announced ( ) tons of helpful sessions for you this week, including: - demystifying the backend: how supabase powers your application with database, authentication, and more ( ) - real talk: realistic voice ai with elevenlabs ( ) - ai translation with lingo ( ) these sessions will help you to make the most of your builder pack and get your project over the finish line, so donâ€™t forget to tune in! you can find more sessions at rvr.to/bolt ( ) . challenger prizes be sure to peruse all of the additional challenger prizes ( ) to see which unique categories that your project qualifies for; thereâ€™s plenty of chances for your entry to shine! thatâ€™s all the updates we have for now. no matter where youâ€™re at, keep building. whether youâ€™ve got a full mvp or just a sticky note idea, it counts. you showed up. youâ€™re building. thatâ€™s the hard part. weâ€™ll see you around the livestreams ( ) and discord ( ) . keep building!! eric simons ceo & co-founder, bolt.new ( ) (p.s. tag @boltdotnew ( ) to show us what youâ€™re working on!) stackblitz, inc., 2443 fillmore street #380-16814, san francisco, ca, 94115, united states. to opt out of future emails from stackblitz, click here to unsubscribe ( ) .

google classroom link for cse304 full stack development dear students, youâ€ are insisted to join the google classroom using the provided link or class code for the subject *cse304 full stack development.* *code:* jejkrrse *join with charusat email id only.* all subject related communication will be done in this class room only. *thanks & regards,* *priyanka padhiyar* *assistant professor,* *computer science & engineering,* *devang patel institute of advance technology & research (depstar),* *charotar university of science & technology (charusat),* *at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist: anand, (gujarat) india. * --

fwd: invitation to nominate girl students for wwt all india women-only hackathon 2025 dear girl students, greetings!!! kindly go through the trailing mail regarding the hackathon organized exclusively for girl students. interested are hereby informed to fill the google form on the below-mentioned link latest by 10th june 2025. link : regards: radhika patel. ---------- forwarded message --------- from: deepti pillai <deepti@sstarsfoundation.org> date: fri, jun 6, 2025 at 9:30 am subject: invitation to nominate girl students for wwt all india women-only hackathon 2025 to: professor <atulpatel.mca@charusat.ac.in> *dear professor * i hope this message finds you well. i am dr. deepti pillai, formerly with codechef and currently serving as director â€“ community at *shooting stars foundation*, a non-profit committed to advancing access to stem education and entrepreneurship for underserved communities. we are delighted to invite your *girl students* to participate in the upcoming *wwt all india women-only hackathon 2025*, organized in partnership with *world wide technology*, a leading us-based it services company. hackathon highlights: - *open to all women college students* (any stream, any year) - *theme:* *ai for financial inclusion of women â€“ economic empowerment & financial literacy* - *mode:* online - *team event:* 4â€“6 members (*no team? no problem â€” weâ€™ll help form one!*) - *prizes worth â‚¹3,00,000 (1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th prizes - 50k/35k/25/15k/10k). a*ll top 25 teams standing a chance to win a minimum of â‚¹5,000 - *hackathon date:* sunday, july 13, 2025 - *last date to register: june 30, 2025* - *registration link:* < we would be truly grateful if you could share this opportunity with your students or circulate it through your department whatsapp/email groups. *a brochure is attached* for easy sharing. institutional recognition: the college/university with the *highest number of active women participants* will receive a *special mention* on our social media and in exclusive communications to our corporate partners â€” celebrating your commitment to promoting gender diversity in tech. your encouragement could make a life-changing difference for your students, empowering them to innovate, collaborate, and grow in a real-world setting. please feel free to reach out for any queries. with warm regards *dr. deepti pillai* *shooting stars foundation* *bengaluru, india* *linkedin < website < *if you believe youâ€™re not the right recipient for this email, we kindly request you to forward it to the appropriate point of contact in your department.* *to stop receiving further updates from us about our hackathons, please reply with â€œunsubscribe.â€*

"summer internship application charusat university students!" *dear student from* *charusat*, launched global, in collaboration with iit kharagpur (kshitij), is organizing a 2-month training & internship program that includes certifications from wipro dice id and is aicte-approved. this is an excellent opportunity to gain industry-leading skills and real-world experience, significantly advancing your career. secure your place *to reserve your place in this program, fill out the google form today:* < *for more information and real-time updates, join our official whatsapp group: * < < program structure outline hereâ€™s a detailed overview of what the program offers: 1. training outline - live mentoring with industry experts: evening classes (6:30 pm - 8:00 pm) are conducted live on zoom, designed to fit your schedule. get expert guidance at every step. - from basics to advanced: our curriculum is perfect for both beginners and those looking to refine advanced skills, starting from fundamental concepts. - ai-powered development made easy: learn to build applications with minimal coding, create innovative solutions using generative ai, and master effective ai prompt design. - lms access for flexibility: recorded live sessions will be uploaded to our learning management system (lms) and accessible for 6 months from the batch start date. login credentials will be shared after registration, ensuring uninterrupted learning at your own pace. 2. internship conduct - 10+ minor projects: each student will work individually on minor projects related to the topics learned during training. - major project (capstone): this is a group project (3-4 interns per group), with specific responsibilities assigned to each team member. the company will provide all necessary data and materials for the project. - resume building: receive expert guidance to craft a standout resume that captures attention. - mock interviews: get constructive feedback from industry experts to sharpen your interview skills. - masterclasses: learn directly from top leaders in global companies through exclusive sessions. certifications provided - course certificate: a prestigious certificate from iit-kharagpur (kshitij). - internship certificate: earn a valuable certificate from our partnered mncs & startups. - wipro dice id verification: both certificates will be officially verified by wipro dice id, adding significant credibility. - placement assistance with top-notch mncs.

token rollovers start july 1 ğŸ” + free bolt pro for hackathon starting july 1, unused tokens roll over monthly! plus, this weekâ€™s hackathon updates and more. hey there, what a week! the worldâ€™s largest hackathon is officially on, and things are moving fast. from new builds to surprise livestreams and irl meetups, weâ€™re blown away by what this community is already showing off. weâ€™ve officially crossed 80,000 hackathon registrations! as a reminder, itâ€™s still not too late for you to join if you wanna be part of the hype! register ( ) for the hackathon to get your free builder pack which includes free bolt pro and much more. the pack is sent to you via email within 48 hours of signing up, so donâ€™t delay any further! register now ( ) token rollovers start july 1 ğŸš€ you asked. we shipped. starting july 1, unused tokens will roll over to the next month so your tokens stay with you, even if you donâ€™t use them right away. that means: - no more lost tokens - build at your own pace - save up for big launches we're setting a new standard for vibe coding tools! see the official announcement. ( ) tokenrollover ( ) 5 million builders and counting we just crossed 5 million users on bolt ( ) and weâ€™re just getting started. the momentum from this hackathon has been unreal. we're so excited to continue creating alongside all 5 million of you. this is more than just a number or a milestone: itâ€™s a signal that the future is being made in real time. hackathon rule updates we also made some updates to the official rules! take a minute to review ( ) the changes and make sure youâ€™re set up for success. to stay eligible, your project must be primarily built in bolt.new, the core functionality and experience should run within bolt. tools like figma or chatgpt are fine for design or idea development, but your actual app needs to live on bolt. final submissions must also include the â€œbuilt on boltâ€ badge (automatically added when you deploy via bolt). ğŸ”— read the full rules + badge guidance ( ) the elevenlabs challenge is live give your app a voice and a personality. the elevenlabs challenge ( ) is officially live, and $25,000 is up for grabs. use elevenlabs conversational ai ( ) to build a voice-enabled experience inside your bolt.new app. whether itâ€™s a customer support agent, voice-based game, or real-time audio interface, this is your chance to make something truly interactive. what to build: use elevenlabsâ€™ react sdk to give your bolt app natural voice interaction. their tools plug right into bolt, so you can go from idea to full conversational agent fast. helpful resources: - quickstart guide + docs ( ) - join the elevenlabs discord ( ) - join elevenlab's livestream this week ( ) vote for contraâ€™s 2025 creator tools awards weâ€™re proud to share that the official voting site for contraâ€™s 2025 creator tools awards ( ) was built entirely on bolt. itâ€™s fast, beautiful, and packed with tools youâ€™ll recognize. vote now and youâ€™ll be entered to win an apple studio display or a contra pro membership. ğŸ‘‰ check it out + vote ( ) hackathon judge spotlight meet grace ling ( ) , founder of design buddies, designer, illustrator, content creator and one of our amazing hackathon judges! grace is on the lookout for: - real problems solved well - thoughtful design thinking - that creative spark - and unofficially, kawaii vibes ğŸ° sheâ€™s judged 100+ events around the world, so weâ€™re so glad sheâ€™s one of our 40 incredible judges reviewing your hackathon builds. time to tune in this weekâ€™s livestreams were packed with insights, demos, and live builds. catch the replays on our youtube channel ( ) and donâ€™t miss whatâ€™s coming up next: - vibe marketing with contra ( ) - demystifying the backend: how supabase powers your application with database, authentication, and more ( ) - real talk: realistic voice ai with elevenlabs ( ) - ai translation with lingo ( ) keep building!! eric simons ceo & co-founder, bolt.new ( ) (p.s. tag @boltdotnew ( ) to show us what youâ€™re working on!) stackblitz, inc., 2443 fillmore street #380-16814, san francisco, ca, 94115, united states. to opt out of future emails from stackblitz, click here to unsubscribe ( ) .

depstar_b.tech cse_ sem - 4_april 2025 examination _list of toppers dear students, heartfelt congratulations on your remarkable performance in the recent university exam of b.tech(cse) sem-4. may your unwavering dedication and passion continue to guide you toward success in every aspect of your life. stay motivated and give your best in your further study. *find the attached topper's list of 4th semester cse students.*

info_student dear *student* congratulations on being shortlisted for our *career launchpad program*, verified by wipro dice id & nsdc under skill india! *june, july, august & september batch* launched global, in collaboration with wipro dice id, is offering a 2-month of skill training + business projects. this opportunity is available for all departments & every year students with fixed slots. we invite you to complete the application form to secure your spot. * application form: * * < group link* program details *- first month:* skill training includes live lectures and mentorship from industry professionals. login credentials will be provided upon registration. *- second month:* real time projects with live mentorship from professionals. experience business-world problems through. *- project 1:* 10 individual projects to be completed with your mentor. *- project 2:* capstone group project with specific tasks assigned to each intern. *benefits:* - program completion certificate. - internship certificate from top mncs with wipro dice id verification. - 6-month lms portal access & study materials. - growth community pass with placement assistance. - 24/7 personalized mentorship. - complimentary sessions on gen ai & prompt engineering. - guidance on low code & no code applications. - live & doubt-clearing sessions conducted by industrial experts. - guest lectures from microsoft & meta. to enroll in this program, please complete the application form & join the official group as soon as possible at your earliest convenience. *students who are already enrolled, ignore this mail.* warm

govt. of india* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: infosys springboard <springboard@infosys.com> date: wed, 28 may, 2025, 6:07 pm subject: infosys springboard virtual internship 6.0: apply now! to: *dear learner,* we are happy to announce the launch of the *6th edition for infosys springboard virtual internship*! our internship program has been a launchpad for aspiring enthusiasts, providing a platform to work on real-world projects and gain exposure to the latest technologies. the previous batches have seen interns excel and move forward with a wealth of knowledge and practical experience. *whatâ€™s in it for you?* 1. *in-depth technical knowledge:* gain hands-on experience in your chosen field of technology. 2. *project-based learning:* gain practical experience of working on a project. 3. *expert guidance:* learn from industry leaders and become part of a community of like-minded individuals. *who can apply?* - applicants must have passed 12th standard or equivalent or higher examination from a recognized board or university and must be pursuing graduation/post-graduation or completed graduation. *how to apply?* 1. *visit the channel page*: go through the instructions in detail listed on the virtual internship 6.0 channel page. 2. *choose your interest area*: once you've reviewed the instructions, you can then pick any area you'd be most interested in for the projects, such as ai, angular full stack, python, java tech stack or data visualization. 3. *complete the application*: fill out the internship application form as detailed on the channel page. *click here to visit & apply* < the deadline to apply for internship is *june 2, 2025,* and the deadline to complete recommended courses of your chosen technology theme is *june 30, 2025*. in case of queries, write to springboard-support@infosys.com. *regards, team infosys springboard* scan the qr code to download the * infosys springboard app* [image: a qr code on a white background description automatically generated] app store [image: a qr code on a white background description automatically generated] play store follow us on facebook < | instagram < | linkedin < | x (twitter) < -- regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

coming february 3, 2026: a new era for cisco certifications hi cisco networking academy partners, instructors, and students, on february 3, 2026, learn with cisco will introduce exciting changes to its industry-leading certification portfolio, shaping the next generation of networking careers in the age of ai, network automation, and cybersecurity. with this update, most of our certifications will more clearly follow three certification levels for advancing from entry to expert using the framework learners know and trust: - ccna (associate) - ccnp (professional) - ccie (expert) whatâ€™s changing includes: devnet certifications are transitioning to cisco automation certifications what this means for you: the devnet associate certification exam will be renamed to ccna automation. no changes will be made to the exam topics for this certification. anyone holding an active devnet associate certification will automatically be transitioned to ccna automation after february 3, 2025. we are not renaming the devnet associate course from cisco networking academy at this time. cybersecurity certifications will be ccna cybersecurity and ccnp cybersecurity what this means for you: the cybersecurity associate certification will be renamed to ccna cybersecurity. no changes will be made to the exam topics for this certification. anyone holding an active cybersecurity associate exam will automatically be transitioned to ccna cybersecurity after february 3, 2025. we are not renaming the cyberops associate course from cisco networking academy at this time. additionally, please note: - the ccna certification exam and name are not changing. - the ccnp enterprise certification exams and names are not changing. we are working on frequently asked questions for cisco networking academy and will follow up with more details in the coming weeks. see the full announcement from cisco certifications here: coming february 3, 2026: a new era for cisco certifications < the future of networking is intelligent. be ready. <[[${facebooklink}]]> <[[${youtubelink}]]> <[[${twitterlink}]]> <[[${linkedinlink}]]> join our feeds to be the first to hear about updates and opportunities, and share your own innovative ideas. please do not reply to this email. to unsubscribe, log in to cisco networking academy < click on your name (top right corner), and update your notification and email preferences. if you are no longer part of the networking academy program and need to have your account deleted, log in, go to help, and submit a request for deletion. if you do not have a cisco networking academy account, unsubscribe here < Â© 2021 cisco systems, inc. and/or its affiliates. all rights reserved. 170 w tasman, san jose, ca 95134. cisco.com < | privacy statement < | trademarks < .

fwd: proposal for students to participate in the unteched japan international education study tour: july 2025proposal for students to participate in the unteched japan international education study tour: july 2025 regards, radhika h. patel, assistant professor, department of information technology, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charusat, changa ---------- forwarded message --------- from: provost charusat <provost@charusat.ac.in> date: wed, 28 may 2025, 7:41 pm subject: fwd: proposal for students to participate in the unteched japan international education study tour: july 2025proposal for students to participate in the unteched japan international education study tour: july 2025 to: teaching staff <teachingstaff@charusat.ac.in>, registrar charusat < registrar@charusat.ac.in>, deputy registrar (academics & exams) charusat < dy.registrar.ace@charusat.ac.in> *dr r.v. upadhyay,* *provost (vice-chancellor),* charotar university of science and technology (charusat) off. nadiad - petlad highway, changa-388421, gujarat, india c: +91 9427215242 | ph: +91 2697 265015 | e: provost@charusat.ac.in <registrar@charusat.ac.in> | w: ---------- forwarded message --------- from: manshi verma <communications@unteched.in> date: wed, 28 may 2025, 18:12 subject: proposal for students to participate in the unteched japan international education study tour: july 2025proposal for students to participate in the unteched japan international education study tour: july 2025 to: provost@charusat.ac.in <provost@charusat.ac.in> dear dr. rv upadhyay greetings from unteched! we are thrilled to present an extraordinary opportunity for your students to join the *unteched international education study tour: japan 2025*, titled *"go abroad, unlock your potential."* hosted *in partnership with fpt academy japan*, this immersive *one-week program* combines academic excellence with cultural exploration, offering a transformative experience for participants. *program overview:* *host country: tokyo, japan* *host university partner: fpt academy japan* *duration: 14 july â€“ 20 july, 2025 (7 days / 6 nights)* participants will gain hands-on exposure through academic sessions, workshops, and cultural immersion activities. this program is specifically designed to broaden global perspectives, enhance professional skills, and provide an unforgettable learning adventure. *program highlights:* *1. academic sessions: *led by top experts, students will delve into trending topics such as: - ai application in business - digital transformation - cybersecurity in business - diversity, equity, and inclusion *2. field trip at a global company (all in english)* - welcome ceremony & company tour - seminar with experts - skill-up workshop - groupwork *3. experience japanese culture* - calligraphy culture class with japanese teacher - unique insights into japanese lifestyle - immersive cultural activities and sightseeing *program cost:* *program fee: 1100 usd (approx. inr 93,500)* (note: payment to be paid in international account, additional 18% gst applicable for payments to an indian account.) *inclusions:* - 6 nights accommodation in dormitories (shared basis) - local airport transfers (group pick-up & drop) - local transport for program-related visits - orientation and in-program activity fees (including transportation & entrance tickets) - study materials and printing fees - an english-speaking buddy to assist students during program activities - certificate of participation from fpt japan *exclusions:* flights, visa fee, meals, travel & health insurance, personal expenses ***unteched will assist students with flight bookings and visa lodgement.* *registration link: < *encourage your students to register early to secure their spots.* this program is an excellent way for students to enhance their academic profiles, gain global exposure, and immerse themselves in japan's rich culture. we look forward to collaborating with you to make this initiative a success. for any queries or assistance, please feel free to contact us. we look forward to your students joining us on this exciting journey to explore the vibrant culture of japan

ieee is the worldâ€™s largest technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology. student branches offer a space for innovation, collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains. ğŸ’¡ why join the ieee student branch? - *enhance your resume:* engage in projects, workshops, and events in domains like ai, robotics, vlsi, signal processing, and more. - *global networking:* connect with professionals, mentors, and students around the world. - *leadership roles:* lead initiatives and build real-world leadership and teamwork skills. - *exclusive opportunities:* participate in events like ieee xtreme and international conferences. - *access resources:* utilize tools like the ieee xplore digital library to stay ahead in your field. ğŸ”— student membership benefits < ğŸ”— general ieee membership benefits < ğŸ§© available committees 1. main student branch executive committee 2. computer science (cs) 3. women in engineering (wie) affinity group 4. antenna and propagation society (aps) ğŸ“Œ positions available in each committee - chairperson - vice-chairperson - secretary - treasurer - web master each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities, promoting ieeeâ€™s mission, and encouraging participation within the student community. ğŸ“ how to apply please fill out the google form below. the selection process includes evaluation of your responses and an interview later on. ğŸ“‹ apply now < we look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our ieee community!

fwd: important: awareness session on upcoming semester project â€“ 27th may 2025 dear students, you are kindly requested to take note of the upcoming session and ensure your presence without fail. *dear students,* greetings! you are informed that an awareness session on the project process and expectations will be conducted on tuesday, 27th may 2025, at 10:00 am. this session will give you an overview of the complete project process for the upcoming semester. it will cover all important aspects such as planning, execution, and evaluation, along with the academic expectations to ensure a smooth and effective start to your project work. *all processes like project definition finalization, mentor allocation, and team formation will be completed before the start of the upcoming semester, so you can begin implementation from day one.* your participation in this session is crucial for a well-prepared and confident start to your project journey. session details: ğŸ—“ï¸ date: 27/05/2025 (tuesday) ğŸ•™ time: 10:00 am onwards microsoft teams link: *note: attendance is mandatory.* *regards* *katira ashish d.* -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion visit < . --

fwd: online training programme on â€œtransforming research and learning with sciencedirectâ€ dear students, greetings!!! those interested in research and/or working in the research direction of any domain can participate and take advantage of the session and the research facilities provided by the university. *thanks and regards,* *radhika h. patel* *assistant professor* *department of information technology* *depstar,* *charusat, changa* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: library charusat <head.lib@charusat.ac.in> date: wed, may 21, 2025 at 10:49 am subject: online training programme on â€œtransforming research and learning with sciencedirectâ€ to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> cc: dean charusat <dean@charusat.ac.in> dear library users, we are pleased to invite you to a *â€œtransforming research and learning with sciencedirectâ€,* an online training programme organized by *charusat - knowledge resource centre (krc)*, for one of the premier e-resources subscribed to by our university, aimed at enhancing academic and research excellence. *sciencedirect*, by elsevier, provides access to a vast collection of scientific journals, books, and articles across a wide range of disciplines, including: *pharmacy, applied science, computer applications, and engineering.* this initiative will help you: - discover authoritative research content - improve the quality of your academic and research work - stay updated with the latest developments in your field [image: image.png] we encourage all faculty members, researchers, and students to participate actively in this session and make the most of this valuable resource. *kindly confirm your **registration on:* *note: *all participants will be awarded with an *e-certificate* of participation. thank you so much, and we look forward to your participation.

weekly report submission guidelines for summer internship dear students, this is to inform you that all students undergoing the *summer internship (1 & 2)* are required to *prepare a weekly report* detailing the tasks and activities carried out during the internship period. please take note of the following instructions: 1. a *guide allocation sheet* will be shared with you shortly. once received, you are required to *submit your weekly reports to your allocated internal guide*. 2. each weekly report must be *first signed by your external (industry) guide/supervisor* before submission. 3. only after obtaining the external guideâ€™s signature should you approach your *internal guide for verification and signature*. this process is *mandatory* and part of your internship evaluation. kindly ensure timely and accurate documentation of your work each week. *please find the attached weekly report format and course details. * regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

bolt's $1m hackathon begins may 30 check out the hackathon rules and guidelines! plus, drop by an irl meetup this month! bolt logo ( ) hey there, we had a truly amazing time at the kickoff party in sf ( ) with the bolt community. thank you, really, to all who joined us: we ate, drank, played, and danced to the chainsmokers, together. and now? it's time to build together. the world's largest hackathon ( ) begins on may 30. over 20,000 non-devs and vibe coders have already come aboard to bring their projects to life. if you havenâ€™t joined up yet, do it now and don't miss your chance to be part of this monumental event happening around the world. let set a world record together ( ) curious about how the hackathon works? check out the rules and guidelines ( ) to give you the lay of the virtual land. this month, weâ€™re also hosting irl hackathon meetups ( ) in cities around the world. if one is near you, don't be afraid to go and share ideas, ask questions, or just vibe knowing you're all part of something pretty special. maybe one day you'll be bragging about how you met the world's next brilliant founder before they got big. or maybe they'll be the ones bragging about meeting you. register now ( ) we can't want to see what you build! rock on, eric simons ceo & co-founder, bolt.new ( ) . stackblitz, inc., 2443 fillmore street #380-16814, san francisco, ca, 94115, united states. to opt out of future emails from stackblitz, click here to unsubscribe ( ) .

nomenclature competition i multi utility building @ charusat dear students, charusat is excited to invite your creative suggestions for *naming our multi-utility complex.* the facility is a versatile space for csic, civf, hrdc, coe, it cell, iqac, conference rooms, paperless exam halls, an exam control room, and multitudes of related services. it is designed to cater to the diverse needs of charusat's unique initiatives and will play a pivotal role in enhancing the overall campus experience. *criteria for nomenclature:* - should reflect vedic/sanskrit terminologyâ€”easily memorable - should be meaningful and relevant to the facility - should have clarity, brevity, and creativity - should have a touch of academia or knowledge ğŸprize: the best fit name will be awarded a cash prize of â‚¹11,000/- by the prime donor of this facility, shri devang patel (nadiad). click to fill out the form < *deadline*: submit your response before may 30, 2025. *kruten patel* *executive officer (corporate communications)* <9173701614>[image: whatsapp icon medium circle] < [image: email (generic) icon medium circle] <krutenpatel.adm@charusat.ac.in> [image: facebook icon medium rounded] < [image: twitter icon medium circle] < [image: linkedin icon medium circle] < [image: instagram icon medium circle] < [image: youtube icon medium circle] < --

edunet foundation internship opportunity for 4th semester students dear students, we are pleased to inform you about an exciting internship opportunity in collaboration with *edunet foundation*, specifically designed for *4**th-semester students* across relevant disciplines. *internship details:* - *duration:* 08 days (5* days* of on-campus training + *3 days* in *hybrid mode* (online/offline) - *daily hours:* 6 hours per day - *mode:* skill-based, project-oriented learning experience. this internship will enhance your technical and soft skills through immersive learning experiences and industry-relevant projects. we encourage all eligible students to take full advantage of this opportunity to enhance their employability and build a strong foundation for their careers. the edunet foundation, in collaboration with shell, is pleased to offer an exciting internship opportunity through our green and ai skills program. this initiative is designed to equip students from gujarat, maharashtra, tamil nadu, and karnataka with essential artificial intelligence (ai) and green skills, empowering them to thrive in the emerging skill ecosystem and build successful careers in the fast-evolving technology sector. *internship overview:* the internship aims to bridge gaps in the existing academic curriculum while enhancing student employability through hands-on technical skills and industry-relevant knowledge. broadly, it encompasses: - *60 hours* of accelerated internship for students enrolled in year 2 of science. *refer to the brochures for the course outline (enclosed) and pre-requisites < - *opportunity to work with industry sponsors, *gain hands-on experience with real-world technology use cases, and develop prototypes using newly acquired skills. - *free, co-branded certification* by sponsor organisations awarded upon successful completion of the program; - *access to a wide range of self-paced courses* & a dedicated learning management system (lms); - *placement linkages* for eligible students to connect with relevant career opportunities. *about us:* *edunet foundation < is a leading indian ngo focused on education, skilling, employment, and entrepreneurship. edunet is *guidestar certified* and has special consultative status with the economic and social council (ecosoc) at the *united nations*. with a national footprint and association with regulators, state skill development missions, schools, and higher education institutions, efâ€™s programs have impacted more than 2,50,000 learners in the last year. we are closely associated with corporations like* microsoft, ibm, sap, ey, vodafone idea, aditya birla, etc*. to implement their csr initiatives on skill development and enhance the skills of our future workforce. ğŸ‘‰ *you can register using the provided link: * *----------------------------* *thanks & regards,ashwin makwana/sujal dadhaniya* *tpo - **career development and placement cell (cdpc)*, *charotar university of science & technology (charusat) * at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. (t) 02697-265213, 265214 (m) 9662255116 e: tpo@charusat.ac.in / tnp@charusat.ac.in accredited grade a+ by naac "helping hand to shape a career to achieve dreams" --

fwd: innovation nexus : a symposium on multidisciplinary research collaboration dear all, smt. chandaben mohanbhai patel institute of computer applications (cmpica), faculty of computer science and applications (fca), charusat, changa, is organizing "*innovation nexus: a symposium on multidisciplinary research collaboration*". this symposium is designed to provide a dynamic platform for researchers, faculty members, and students to collaborate across disciplines, encouraging innovative research and fostering academic growth. a distinguished expert in industrial ai/ml projects will deliver an insightful session on the latest technological developments in artificial intelligence and its applications in diverse research domains. an exciting opportunity for research scholars, faculty members, and students from various disciplines to showcase their research through *engaging poster presentation sessions*. this competition aims to promote research dissemination in emerging areas of knowledge. - *date:* 7th june 2025 (saturday) - *time:* 10:00 am to 04:00 pm - *venue:* cmpica, charusat, off nadiad-petlad highway, changa, dist. anand, gujarat, india. all the researchers, faculty members, and students are invited to register for the same. *expert talk * - *speaker:* dr. nidhi arora - *designation:* co-founder and director - ai, advic tech, sola, ahmedabad - *expertise:* microsoft certified data analyst associate, ai/ml practitioner, genai consultant, mlops speaker, automation specialist - *topic:* *ai for interdisciplinary applications* we cordially invite all researchers, faculty members, and postgraduate students to register and participate. ğŸ”— *register here:* for further details, kindly refer to the attached brochure. warm

summer internship drive dear student congratulations on being shortlisted for our *national skill development certified* internship program, verified by wipro dice id! *june-july batch* launched global, in collaboration with wipro dice id, is offering a 2-month training + internship program. this opportunity is available for every department with fixed slots. we invite you to complete the application form to secure your spot. * application form: * * < *referral code* *dice_id* program details *- first month:* training includes live lectures and mentorship from industry professionals. login credentials will be provided upon registration. *- second month:* internship with live mentorship on projects from professionals. experience real-world problems through: *- project 1:* 10 individual projects to be completed with your mentor. *- project 2:* capstone group project with specific tasks assigned to each intern. *benefits:* - program completion certificate. - internship certificate from top mncs with wipro dice id verification. - 6-month lms portal access. - growth community pass with placement assistance. - 24/7 personalized mentorship. - complimentary sessions on gen ai & prompt engineering. - guidance on low code & no code applications. - live & doubt-clearing sessions conducted by industrial experts. - guest lectures from microsoft & meta. to enroll in this program, please complete the application form at your earliest convenience. *students who are already enrolled, ignore this mail.* warm

request for mentorship on email classification project respected ma'am, i hope you are doing well. we understand that you were busy with exam invigilation, so we waited before writing to you. james, jugvi, and i are working on a better system for email spam classification, mainly for college-level use. this idea is based on what we learned during our sgp 1 in the third semester, where you had guided us with binary email classification for the unidash project. the architecture actually builds on top of your idea of active learning for unlabeled dataset. we have prepared a basic plan and have a dataset to work with. our goal is to improve the classification system and eventually write a research paper based on our work. we were hoping you could mentor us through this process. we would be really thankful for your support. kind

fwd: pm mentorship scheme for young authors (yuva) 3.0 sir / madam, concerning the above, this is to bring to your kind attention that after the successful execution of the two editions of pm-yuva mentorship scheme, pm-yuva mentorship scheme 3.0 has been launched by the ministry of education, government of india * to train young and budding authors * (below 30 years of age) for the year 2025-26 with the national book trust, india as the implementing agency. the themes of pm-yuva 3.0 are: a.contribution of indian diaspora in nation building b.indian knowledge system c.makers of modern india (1950-2025) the scheme will help to develop a stream of writers who can write on various facets of india encompassing the past, present and future. besides, the scheme will also provide a window to the aspiring youth to articulate themselves and present a comprehensive outlook of contribution of indians across fields in ancient and present times. the scheme aims to cultivate a new generation of writers who can articulate the contributions of the indian diaspora in nation-building, highlighting their peaceful integration and influence across political, economic, and socio-cultural spheres. it will also emphasise on the role of the indian knowledge system in preserving historical wisdom, generating new opportunities, and synthesising indigenous knowledge for national development. through this initiative, young authors will explore the impact of visionaries in various fields like education, science, economy, social empowerment, etc. thereby presenting a comprehensive narrative of india's growth and resilience. given indiaâ€™s position as the third-largest book publishing market, this initiative is a crucial step toward projecting its intellectual and cultural wealth on the global stage. an online national contest is being organised from 11 march 2025 â€“ 10 june 2025 to select the authors under the scheme. there is a provision for payment of a scholarship of rs.50,000 per month for a period of six months to be paid to each of the selected 50 authors. national book trust, india will be publishing the books produced by the young authors as part of the mentorship scheme. * you are requested to disseminate the information pertaining to the scheme among the students and other stakeholders to encourage greater participation in this prestigious scheme. * the details can be accessed at * < * the further enquiries related to the scheme can be sent to the director@nbtindia.gov.in , chiefeditor.nbtindia@gmail.com and nbtyuva3.0@gmail.com . please find below the link to the contest and other details for ready reference: innovateindia.mygov.in/yuva- 2025 < pfa:- < * with best regards * * dr. sunil luthra * * director (training & learning bureau) * * all india council for technical education * * vasant kunj * * new delhi - 110070 * -- click here < to unsubscribe from this newsletter. --

and strengthen indiaâ€™s uas/drone ecosystem, aligning with the governmentâ€™s vision to make india a global drone hub by 2030. the drone federation india (dfi) is a non-government, non-profit, industry-led body representing 550+ drone companies and 5500+ drone pilots across the country. with prizes, startup incubation, and industry mentorship, nidar inspires students and researchers from summer internship opportunity â€“ research-based internship dear students, as you are aware, all of you will be undergoing a mandatory summer internship during the upcoming summer break. if any student is interested in pursuing a *research-based internship* in the following areas, you are encouraged to meet me *in person* to finalize the details: - image and video processing for security applications *(e.g., surveillance, threat detection, biometric systems) * - virtual and augmented reality in healthcare and education *(e.g., medical training, remote learning, immersive simulations) * - internet of things (iot) for smart cities and automation (*e.g., smart infrastructure, environmental monitoring, intelligent systems)* - quantum computing *last date to fill the form: 12th april 2025* please ensure you express your interest and confirm your participation on or before the mentioned date. *intimation of selection will be given by 15th april 2025.* -- *nilesh kumar dubey**(phd)* assistant professor, computer science and engineering, institutional coordinator of *iqac*, *csic,* *uiic, ipr* devang patel institute of advanced technology & research changa-388421, gujarat, india. --

summer internship opportunity â€“ require frontend/backend/full-stack web developer dear students, we are inviting passionate and dedicated students to collaborate on an exciting *live project* focused on developing a full-stack web application for our institute. this is a great opportunity to *enhance your technical skills, gain hands-on experience, and work on a real-world project* that will be considered as your *summer internship*. *project requirements* the project involves building a modern web application using the following technologies: 1. *frontend:* experience with a frontend library or framework (react, next.js, angular, etc.). 2. *backend:* familiarity with node.js frameworks (supabase, express, hono, fastify, etc.). 3. *database:* knowledge of sql or nosql databases (mongodb, postgresql, etc.). 4. *security:* understanding of authentication methods and best practices for web security. 5. *networking:* basics of website deployment, linux server setup, and configuration(git/github). 6. *ui/ux design:* ability to design visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces. *roles available* we are looking for students with expertise in the following roles: - *frontend developer* - *backend developer* - *full-stack developer* - *ui/ux designer* *what youâ€™ll gain* - appreciation letter and stipend opportunity - practical experience in full-stack web development. - a real-world project to showcase in your portfolio. - collaboration with peers to learn and grow. *how to apply* if you are interested, please fill out the application form using the following *link*: * < *note:* *candidates will go through an interview/screening process before final selection for the internship.* we look forward to working with *motivated and committed* students eager to learn and contribute! thank you. -- regards, dr. parth goel assistant professor, computer science & engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar) charotar university of science and technology (charusat) [*accredited with "a+" grade by naac, goi*], at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist:anand, (gujarat) india. ph. no: 02697-265060, ext. no. : 5298 --

re: university elective final exam of ce282.01 web designing dear all students, the university elective final exam of ce282.01 web designing. exam date : 05/04/2025, exam time : 11:10 am to 12:10 am (1 hour, online exam via microsoft teams) you need to follow the instructions given below : 1) exam link will be provided in your microsoft teams in assignment section before the exam. 2) exams will start from 11:10 am to 12:10 am. 3) after 12:10 am the exam will be closed. 4) make sure your microsoft teams working properly. 5) no excuse will be entertain after exam. on thu, mar 20, 2025 at 11:21 am parmanand patel < parmanandpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in> wrote: > dear students, > > you have selected the university elective subject *ce282.01 web designing*. > kindly join the *teams platform* for this subject to stay updated with > course materials, announcements, and other important information. > > students who have not yet joined the *teams group* are requested to do so > at the earliest to avoid missing any critical updates. > microsoft team code : lpb1k01 > > > -- > *thanks & regards,* > *parmanand patel* > assistant professor, > u & p u patel department of computer engineering, > chandubhai s patel institute of technology, > charusat,changa,anand-388421. > > --

exciting internship opportunities with agevole innovations dear students, we hope this message finds you in great spirits. *agevole innovations pvt. ltd.* is delighted to announce the launch of our internship programme 2025, a golden opportunity to elevate your skills and gain hands-on experience in a professional, industry-oriented environment. this is a fantastic chance for you to explore and enhance your skills in an industry environment. internship details: duration: 1.5-2 months fields: app development, web development, ui/ux, cloud, graphics designing, marketing, content writing, ai/ml etc. how to apply: if you are interested, simply fill out the registration form using the link below: registration link: < deadline: 25th april, 2025 (11:59 pm) this internship is designed to provide you with valuable work experience and a platform to apply your academic knowledge in real-world scenarios. seize this opportunity to grow both personally and professionally. for inquiries, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at *internship@agevole.in* <internship@agevole.in>. we're here to assist you in any way we can. best

regarding faculty feedback in e-governance for the even semester and institute-specific feedback for ay:2024-25 dear students, hope you are doing well. as part of our continuous efforts to enhance the quality of teaching and learning, we request you to provide your valuable feedback for the faculty members for the academic year 2024-25. the feedback will be collected through the *e-governance system.* link: * < along with the faculty-specific feedback, you are requested to submit institute-specific feedback available in your account. kindly log in to the e-governance portal and complete the faculty feedback form by *04/04/2025*. *your honest and constructive feedback will help us improve academic delivery and overall learning experience.* your cooperation in this process is highly appreciated. thank you for your time and support. -- *dipak ramoliya** /assistant professor,* department of computer science & engineering, depstar, charotar university of science & technology(charusat)- changa, email: dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in, mo. +91 99987 71587 * accredited grade â€œa+â€ by naac, goi* --

ğŸš€ trends in computing and dominating technologies in the future â€“ register now! | march 28 we are excited to announce that the kdpit is organizing an expert talk on "*trends in computing and dominating technologies in the future*" under data science club @ charusat. this is an opportunity to gain insights on understanding cutting-edge advancements in the technology domain. *event details * ğŸ“Œ *topic*: trends in computing and dominating technologies in the future ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« *speaker*: atul kumar - manager and senior research scientist @ ibm research, bengaluru. ğŸ“… date: march 28, 2025 ğŸ“ venue: charusat campus (exact location will be shared soon) ğŸ”¥ why should you attend? âœ… learn about the latest advancements in ai and its growing impact across industries. âœ… understand real-world applications of ai in various sectors. âœ… gain valuable insights about a career in ai and research. âœ… expand your knowledge beyond textbooks and stay ahead in the ai domain. âœ… get the opportunity to ask questions and interact with the speaker. *ğŸ“ how to register?* *registration form link: *trends in computing and dominating technologies in the future < deadline: 27th march 2025, 11:59 pm. registration is mandatory. *note:* seats are limited, so register early to secure your spot. for any queries, feel free to reach out to us at dasciclub@charusat.ac.in we look forward to your participation in this exciting and knowledge-packed event! best regards. data science club @charusat. linkedin < || instagram < || website < --

fwd: 'getting started with building ai (artificial intelligence) projects and agents' online session for the students of devang patel institute of advance technology and research. ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> date: tue, mar 25, 2025 at 4:53 pm subject: fwd: 'getting started with building ai (artificial intelligence) projects and agents' online session for the students of devang patel institute of advance technology and research. to: depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in> ---------- forwarded message --------- from: bhuvaneshwari from bolt iot <trainings@boltiot.com> date: tue, mar 25, 2025 at 4:52 pm subject: 'getting started with building ai (artificial intelligence) projects and agents' online session for the students of devang patel institute of advance technology and research. to: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> session on building ai projects and agents, covering essential concepts and development steps. dear professor dr.amit ganatra, last week we organised a session on artificial intelligence. we received a tremendous response from students across india joining us. thank you for your support in sharing about this program. in continuation of these ai sessions, this week we are organising a webinar on the topic of 'getting started with building ai (artificial intelligence) projects and agents'. there is *no fee* for this session, but *seats are limited* and will be allocated on a *first-come, first-served basis*. *also, since aicte has declared 2025 as the year of ai *and since institutions are actively updating their curricula to* include topics in artificial intelligence. *this series of sessions will help students gain essential insights into key ai concepts. we request you to *share the invite with your students *by *forwarding this email *or* click here to share over whatsapp < *online event details:* - summer internship opportunities â€“ 2025 at crown software dear students, please apply for the summer internship - 2025 in your relevant domain if interested. ---------- forwarded message --------- from: <hr@glexas.com> date: mon, 24 mar, 2025, 9:48 pm subject: summer internship opportunities â€“ 2025 to: ashwinmakwana ce <ashwinmakwana.ce@charusat.ac.in> dear sir / ma'am, greetings! as part of our ongoing collaboration over the years, we are pleased to extend *summer internship opportunities* for students once again for 2025. we truly appreciate the support of your institution in connecting students with industry exposure, and we look forward to continuing this association. this year, we are offering a *7-8 week internship program* (from *10-05-2025 to 04-07-2025*) in the following domains: 1. *flutter developer* â€“ mobile app development using flutter, dart, firebase - 4 2. *website developer* â€“ frontend & backend development (html, css, javascript) - 4 3. *rest api developer* â€“ api development & integration using php, sql - 3 4. *ui/ux designer* â€“ wireframing, prototyping, designing, video creation using figma -3 5. *qa & testing* â€“ manual and automated testing, bug tracking, and reporting - 3 selection process: - shortlisting based on resume screening - followed by a technical interview (online/offline) mode of internship: - hybrid (online/offline, depending on project requirements) we would be grateful if you could kindly forward this opportunity to your students who might be interested. they can apply using the following *google form*: please let us know if you require any additional information or if there are any formalities to proceed with this collaboration. looking forward to your kind response. best regards, crown software -- regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

4th_sem_summer_internship_may-june 2025 dear students, as you know, 2nd-year students must complete a summer internship during the summer break. an internship must be at least 4 weeks and no more than 6 weeks. the* college has recommended* that students pursue this online internship to gain valuable experience in summer break. *internship program details* we invite you to participate in the newly launched global collaboration with* iit kharagpur (kshitij),* mncs, and emerging startups' industrial learning, certification program, and research projects *all students are informed to enroll for the summer internship program through this link: < * < *use your official email id to access all the documents on the link. * * < * < project 1 involves assigning 10 individual tasks to each intern, which they must complete alongside their mentor. project 2 (capstone/industrial project): this is a group project designated for 15 interns. we will allocate specific tasks to each intern, and they are required to work on them. (the company will provide the necessary data and materials needed for the project.) don't miss this chance to advance your career with our exclusive internshipprogram. limited slots are available â€“ *apply now!* <

fwd: math for ai club activity: math magic behind gans ---------- forwarded message --------- from: spoorthy v <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in> date: thu, mar 20, 2025 at 2:01 pm subject: math for ai club activity: math magic behind gans to: <22aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, head cse < hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, head ce charusat < hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, head it charusat <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, depstar_ce <depstar_ce@charusat.ac.in>, depstar_cse < depstar_cse@charusat.ac.in>, depstar it <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>, hod aiml <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in> cc: aiml <aiml@charusat.ac.in> dear all, i hope this email finds you well. math for ai club under the department of artificial intelligence & machine learning, cspit, charusat is organizing an *expert talk* on the *"math magic behind gans"* on march 21, 2025. discover the fascinating mathematical concepts that power *generative adversarial networks (gans)*, one of the most revolutionary ai techniques used in image synthesis, deep learning, and beyond. this event is open to all students of the institute who are eager to explore the intersection of *mathematics and ai*. no prior gan experience is neededâ€”just bring your curiosity! join us for an interactive session that will deepen your understanding and spark new insights. *session details:* - *date:* march 21, 2025 - *time:* 10:10 am to 11:15 am - *venue:* will be updated at the earliest. - *last date of registration:* 21/03/2025 (09:00 pm) *registration link:* (seats are limited) feel free to contact us for any queries on *pooja mehta (22aiml020) - 6351857705 (student coordinator)* *kesha desai (22aiml008) - 7573017335 **(student coordinator)* *spoorthy v. - 8310726037 **(faculty coordinator)* we look forward to seeing you there! *please refer to the attached brochure for details. * -- thanks and regards, *dr. spoorthy. v*, assistant professor, department of ai-ml, cspit, charusat campus, highway, off, nadiad - petlad rd, changa, gujarat 388421 -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion visit < . -- regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

"charusat students get certified: phase-2 launch-ed global internship" dear student, we are excited to invite you to apply for the launch-ed global internship program, a unique opportunity for students eager to gain hands-on experience in the tech industry through expert training and mentorship. *program overview:* - *month 1: expert training* - attend live sessions led by industry professionals with over 10 years of experience. - learn valuable skills in low-code/no-code tools, ai, and prompt engineering. - receive personalized mentorship and hands-on training. - *month 2: real-world projects* - work on individual mini-projects with mentor support. - collaborate on a capstone group project addressing real-world challenges. *program benefits:* - certification from leading mncs. - networking and professional mentorship. - training in cutting-edge technologies, including generative ai and low-code/no-code tools. *how to apply:* - submit your application via this registration form. *registration form* < - shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our hr team. spaces are limited, so apply soon! enrolled students: name mail id domain college juhi mehta 23bsc046@charusat.edu.in genetic engineering charusat nahar disha dharmendra dishanahar607@gmail.com genetic engineering charusat kushwaha apeksha mahendra kumar apekshakushwaha310@gmail.com genetic engineering charusat pratham solankipratham979@gmail.com data analytics pro charusat hethvi data analytics pro charusat vidhi manat vidhimanat8@gmail.com micro biology charusat kripa lodhia 24bsc044@charusat.edu.in micro biology charusat fannie tony kottekattukaran 24bsc043@charusat.edu.in stock market charusat jaysheel patel 24bsc077@charusat.edu.in genetic engineering charusat jadeja abhisheksinh mayurvijaysinh 24bsc033@charusat.edu.in bio informatics charusat best
