seating arrangement for internal exam semester-4 dear students, please find attached herewith seating arrangement for the internal exam. - students are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the email attachment. - students are required to uphold decorum in the examination hall. - mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are strictly prohibited within the exam hall. - bags must be left outside, and it is mandatory to wear an id card. - students have to take their seat in the exam hall at least 15 minutes prior to the exam time. - before 10 mins the entry gate will be closed and no one will be allowed to enter the examination hall. *the exam will take place in exam hall 201 (first floor) and 301 (second floor) of multi utility complex.* -- *with regards,* *disha panchal* *assistant professor,* *department of computer science & engineering, depstar,* *charotar university of science & technology(charusat)*- changa, accredited with "*grade a+*" by naac,goi accredited with *centre of excellence* by gog email: dishapanchal.dcs@charusat.ac.in <arpitbhatt.dcs@charusat.ac.in>, mo. +91 9726219961 --

an online session of bisag n on science and technology. dear students, an online session of bisag n on science and technology from march 19, 2025 *and thereafter* *on the first wednesday of every month from 11:30 am to 12:30 pm through the vande gujarat channel-1 of bisag-n will be available on youtube link- < * thank you ---------- forwarded message --------- from: tnp cell - charusat <tnp@charusat.ac.in> date: wed, mar 19, 2025 at 1:51 pm subject: attendance at the online session of bisag n on science and technology. *respected sir,the government of gujarat remains committed to empowering the skills of graduate students across the state by providing them with knowledge and expertise in emerging technologies through various incentives under the gujarat it/ites policy (2022-2027). with the growing demand for skilled professionals in the it/ites sector, the department of science and technology is actively working to bridge the skill gap and cultivate a strong talent ecosystem.in line with this objective, various incentive schemes have been introduced under the policy to support universities, stem institutions, deeptech startups, innovators, and incubators. these schemes aim to strengthen gujaratâ€™s position as a leading hub for technology-driven innovation and talent development.to create awareness regarding these incentives and opportunities, the department of science & technology, government of gujarat, is organizing a live informative session on 19/03/2025 and thereafter on the first wednesday of every month from 11:30 am to 12:30 pm through the vande gujarat channel-1 of bisag-n also available on youtube link- < the session will focus on explaining the benefits available under the gujarat it/ites policy (2022-2027) for students, faculty members, startups, and incubators.in this regard, we herewith request you:1. to appoint a nodal officer for coordination and communication regarding this initiative.2. inform and encourage all stem institutions, universities, and colleges to actively participate in these sessions.3. facilitate awareness among students, faculty members, deeptech startups, and incubators regarding the policy benefits.your support will be instrumental in ensuring that students and innovators across gujarat can leverage the available opportunities for skill development, innovation, and entrepreneurship. the session link for youtube is < also request bisag to book slot accordingly. for further details, smt smita gosai, assistant director (it), may be contacted at adit1-dit@gujarat.gov.in <adit1-dit@gujarat.gov.in> and incentive-dit@gujarat.gov.in <incentive-dit@gujarat.gov.in> from the directorate of ict and e-governance.in this regard, the letter is attached herewith.thank youincentive branch,directorate of ict & e-governancedepartment of science & technologygovernment of gujarataddress: block no. 2, 2nd floor, c & d wing, karmayogi bhavan, sector - 10a, gandhinagar - 382010.contact: 079-232-58398 < < *thanks & regards,ashwin makwana/sujal dadhaniya* *tpo - **career development and placement cell (cdpc)*, *charotar university of science & technology (charusat) * at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. amazon summer internship for students dear students, *greetings from amazon!* we are thrilled to present our latest internship opportunities in collaboration with amazon. these programs are designed to help you excel in your career, build a strong resume, and earn multiple certifications, all while being mentored by industry professionals. internship program overview: *phase 1: skill building (45 days)* - hands-on training with industry-relevant tools and real-world case studies. - interactive sessions and mentorship from professionals in top companies. *phase 2: real-world project (15 days)* - work on live industry projects to gain practical experience. - collaborate with peers and receive expert feedback. *phase 3: career support (30 days)* - linkedin & resume optimization to make your profile stand out. - portfolio development to showcase your work. - mock interviews and aptitude training to boost your confidence. - job connections to explore opportunities with top companies. *certifications & benefits:* - aicte course completion certificate - amazon internship certificate - excellence certificate from an mnc mentor - letter of recommendation (lor) *brain battle challenge:* - participate in our brain battle exam after completing the internship. top performers will receive a stipend 15k and an additional certification to enhance their portfolio. *for slot booking: * *join our whatsapp group:* *best

doing persistent efforts to institutionalize the innovation & startup ecosystem in the state through policy, platform, and processes. to augment the support system for nurturing student start-ups in the state, second edition of student start-up and innovation policy (ssip 2.0) was launched on 05 january 2022. under the policy, various flagship initiatives have been envisaged through which youth can get adequate opportunities to harness their creative potential. we have pioneered various open innovation programmes like hackathon and executed them at a large-scale. the 6th edition of â€œsmart gujarat hackathonâ€ with special focus on artificial will be a step forward towards building smart and sustainable solutions to complex challenges. in this edition of hackathon around 15,000 students are expected to participate and work on problem statements. challenges from various departments of the state government, public sector undertakings, municipal corporations, district collectorate, district panchayats and industries will be broadcasted to students across universities, institutes, and schools. the program will feature problem statements from various sectors providing students with ample opportunities to engage in artificial intelligence and other emerging technology-based solution- oriented projects. moreover, winning teams will not only receive cash prizes but also invaluable mentorship support from nodal officers of government departments and benefits from education department of government of gujarat, further encouraging their pursuit of innovation and â€¢ gpu programming with cuda - â€¢ shared memory parallelism with openmp - â€¢ distributed memory parallelism with mpi - â€¢ multi-gpu training with pytorch workshop schedule time day 1 (march 11) day 2 (march 12) 9:10 am - 10:00 am super computing in action - transforming science and innovation dr. amit thakkar 10:00 am - 12:00 pm shared memory parallelism with openmp dr. ritesh patel gpu programming with cuda (continued) dr. ritesh patel 12:00 pm - fwd: inauguration of ieee charusat student branch - women in engineering (wie) ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal cspit <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> date: fri, 7 mar 2025, 9:36 am subject: inauguration of ieee charusat student branch - women in engineering (wie) to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> inauguration of ieee charusat student branch women in engineering affinity group and seminar talk on "women innovators in tech: success stories and lessons learned" newly established ieee charusat student branch women in engineering affinity group invites all female students and faculties of charusat to participate in the inauguration ceremony followed by a seminar talk. about ieee wie *vision:* "to be globally recognized for its contributions in stem fields. our goal is to facilitate the recruitment and retention of women in technical disciplines globally. we envision a vibrant community of ieee women and men collectively using their diverse talents to innovate for the benefit of humanity." *mission:* "to connect, support, and inspire women and girls worldwide, and facilitate their recruitment and retention in stem fields, fostering technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity." guest speaker ruzan khambatta a visionary entrepreneur, social innovator, and passionate advocate for women's empowerment. through her groundbreaking initiatives like wajra o' force, policeheart 1091, and halla bol, she has transformed thousands of lives. her success mantra? small steps today lead to giant leaps tomorrow! learn more about ruzan khambatta < event details - *date:* *10th march 2025* - *time:* *9:45 am to 11:00 am* - *venue:* *2nd floor, seminar hall, cspit ec-ee(a6 building), charusat* this event is a milestone moment as we officially launch the student chapter of wie society of ieee, a dedicated community to uplift and support women in technology. whether you're a student, professional, or tech enthusiast, this is an opportunity to connect, learn, and be part of a movement that drives change. e-certificates will be provided to all the participants. let's come together to celebrate, empower, and innovate! register here < looking forward to your presence! regards, -- dr. trushit upadhyaya professor & i/c principal chandubhai s patel institute of technology faculty of technology & engineering charotar university of science & technology (charusat) charusat campus, changa, 388421 petlad, anand, gujarat, india. m: 7874840344 --

isro â€‹internship(btech/bsc/phd/msc/mtech) opportunities at isro (nesac), goi, dept of space, meghalaya dear students, *internship opportunities at isro (nesac < north eastern space applications centre government of india, department of space umiam, meghalaya nesac is pleased to announce the commencement of two important schemes under the nesac outreach program i.e. internships scheme and the student project trainees-scheme. these schemes have been meticulously designed to provide an excellent platform for interaction with distinguished scientists and engineers, offering invaluable opportunities to interested students and research scholars from a wide range of academic institutions. *about the schemes:* 1. *student internships scheme:* *eligibility criteria:* to be eligible for the internship scheme, candidates must meet the following criteria: 1. the candidate should be a citizen of india. 2. the candidate should be pursuing ug/pg/phd from a recognized university/institution (india/abroad), or the candidate should have just completed ug/pg from a recognized university/institution and seek an internship opportunity (within 6 months from the date of award of the degree) for profile enhancement. 3. the candidate should be a student enrolled for a regular on-campus program in a recognized university/institution, or the candidate should have completed ug/pg/phd as a regular on-campus student. 4. the candidate should possess an aggregate of a minimum of 60% or cgpa 6.32 on a scale of 10. *guidelines:* - all students seeking an internship opportunity must submit a bona fide certificate duly issued by the head of the department/principal/director of the institute. the bona fide certificate should include a statement indicating that the internship period is a part of the course curriculum. - the internship period shall have a maximum duration of 45 days and need not be continuous. - interns/project trainees are not eligible for any stipend/remuneration/financial assistance. - accommodation facilities are not provided for interns/project trainees during their nesac internship. - students will have access to canteen facilities on par with regular employees. - a certificate will be awarded to interns/project trainees upon satisfactory completion of their internship and submission of their assignment report, subject to evaluation by the concerned division heads. - all interns/project trainees shall take clearance from nesac for publishing papers/reports through external agents with regard to the work done at nesac. 2. *student project trainees scheme:* *eligibility criteria:* all students wishing to pursue academic project work at nesac must be a citizen of india and shall possess an aggregate of min 60% or cgpa 6.32 on a scale of 10. further, the candidates must meet the following criteria: *degree* *eligibility criteria* *minimum duration of project* *b.e/b.tech* students should have completed 6th semester 45 days *b.sc* only final year students 45 days *m.e/m.tech* students should have completed 1st semester 120 days *m.sc* students should have completed 1st semester 120 days *phd* scholars should have completed course work 30 days *guidelines:* - all students seeking an internship opportunity must submit a bona fide certificate duly issued by the head of the department/principal/director of the institute. the bona fide certificate should include a statement indicating that the project training period is a part of the course curriculum. - interns/project trainees are not eligible for any stipend/remuneration/financial assistance. - accommodation facilities are not provided for interns/project trainees during their nesac internship. - students will have access to canteen facilities on par with regular employees. - a certificate will be awarded to interns/project trainees upon satisfactory completion of their internship and submission of their assignment report, subject to evaluation by the concerned division heads. - all interns/project trainees shall take clearance from nesac for publishing papers/reports through external agents with regard to the work done at nesac. we cordially extend an invitation to all eligible and ambitious students to seize this exceptional opportunity to be part of nesac, a preeminent institution in the realm of space applications. together, we shall explore the boundless frontiers of science and technology, while contributing to the advancement of our nationâ€™s space endeavours. if you are interested in applying for the internship scheme or the project trainee scheme, we kindly request you to complete the online application form, which is accessible at the following web address: *nesac online application portal < please be aware that merely filling out the application form does not guarantee placement in the internship program. all applications will undergo a thorough review, and the selection process may include telephonic interviews. we encourage all prospective candidates to prepare and submit their applications thoughtfully to enhance their chances of being selected for these esteemed programs. *application timelines:* applicants are requested to adhere to the following timelines for applying to the program: - feb 1 â€“ mar 31 for projects starting from may â€“ june - apr 1 â€“ may 31 for projects starting from july â€“ august - sep 1 â€“ oct 15 for projects starting from december - oct 15 â€“ nov 15 for projects starting from january selected applicants will be contacted within one month of close of applications. link- nesac courses website regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

important information for your participation in cloud computing workshop *dear participant,* thank you for registering for the *expert session on "cloud computing and operating systems"* scheduled for *1st march 2025 at 10:00 am onwards*. we are excited to have you join us for this insightful session. *important prerequisites* to ensure a smooth hands-on experience, please complete the following before the workshop: 1. *create an aws free tier account* (required for hands-on activities) follow these steps to set up your aws free tier account: - visit aws free tier < and click on *"create a free account"*. - enter your email address and set up a password. - provide your contact details and billing information (aws requires a valid credit/debit card for verification, but no charges will apply for free tier usage). - choose *basic support* (free) and complete identity verification via phone. - once verified, sign in to the aws management console. 2. *bring your laptop fully charged* - ensure your laptop has at least *3-4 hours of battery backup* as charging points may be limited at the venue. - install necessary software tools such as *docker, ssh client (for windows: putty), and a web browser* for aws access. *workshop details* ğŸ“… *date:* 1st march 2025 ğŸ•˜ *time:* 10:00 am onwards ğŸ“ *venue:* 329, a5 building (depstar) ğŸ¤ *speaker:* mr. nirav desai, analyst engineer, system level solutions, anand *hands-on topics covered* - setting up and launching a virtual machine in aws ec2. - deploying and managing containers using docker/kubernetes. - cloud storage management with aws s3. for any assistance with aws account setup or other queries, feel free to contact undersigned and/or ms. vaishali vadhavana, cse-depstar. we look forward to your active participation! -- *with regards,* *disha panchal* *assistant professor,* *department of computer science & engineering, depstar,* *charotar university of science & technology(charusat)*- changa, accredited with "*grade a+*" by naac,goi accredited with *centre of excellence* by gog email: dishapanchal.dcs@charusat.ac.in <arpitbhatt.dcs@charusat.ac.in>, mo. +91 9726219961 --

odoo x charusat hackathon '25 â€“ 75 selected teams dear participants, we are overwhelmed by the incredible response to the odoo x charusat hackathon '25*, with 2200+ entries* showcasing innovation, talent, and problem-solving skills. selecting the top 75 teams* for the next stage was an extremely challenging task, given the exceptional quality of submissions. to the selected teams* â€“ congratulations! your journey continues, and we canâ€™t wait to see your ideas come to life in the next stage. prepare well, give it your best, and make the most of this opportunity! to those who couldnâ€™t make it this time* â€“ do not lose faith! your passion and effort are commendable, and many more hackathons await you! keep innovating, keep building! the list of selected participants/teams is attached to this email. please review it and stay tuned for further details to be shared in next mail. thank you for being a part of this journey. we appreciate your enthusiasm and dedication! best

workshop on "cloud computing and operating systems" *dear students,* we are excited to invite you to an exclusive workshop* on "cloud computing and operating systems"*, a power-packed *3-hour* session designed to provide valuable insights on os adaptations for cloud infrastructure. *workshop details:* ğŸ“… *date:* 1st march 2025 ğŸ•˜ *time:* 10:00 am onwards ğŸ“ *venue:* 329, a5 building (depstar) ğŸ¤ *speaker:* mr. nirav desai, analyst engineer, system level solutions, anand this workshop aims to enhance your understanding of cloud-based operating systems and their real-world applications. *session goals* - overview of cloud os and its significance. - real-world applications of cloud os platforms. - hands-on experience with cloud environments. *topics covered* - *cloud os basics:* definition, importance, and benefits. - *core features:* virtualization, resource management, security, automation. - *popular platforms:* openstack, vmware vsphere, microsoft azure, aws. - *hands-on activities:* deploying virtual machines, container orchestration with docker/kubernetes, cloud storage with aws s3. - *future trends:* ai-driven cloud os, edge computing, serverless architectures, cross-cloud compatibility. *hands-on activities (live demonstration & practice)* 1. *deploying a virtual machine in the cloud* - log in to the aws management console. - launch an ec2 instance with a chosen os (ubuntu/windows server). - configure instance type and storage settings. - access the instance via ssh/rdp and explore basic cloud operations. - *outcome:* understand cloud resource provisioning and access. 2. *container orchestration with docker/kubernetes* - install docker on a cloud-based vm. - pull and run a sample container (e.g., nginx, redis). - scale and stop containers to simulate real-world use cases. - (optional) use kubernetes (minikube) to create and manage a cluster. - *outcome:* learn the fundamentals of container-based deployment and scaling. 3. *file storage and management in the cloud* - create an amazon s3 bucket. - upload, manage, and retrieve files using aws s3 and cli commands. - understand permissions and data access policies. - *outcome:* gain insights into cloud-based storage solutions and security measures. *how to register?* click the link below to complete your registration: hurry! limited seats available. secure your spot today and be part of an enriching learning experience. for any queries, feel free to contact undersigned and/or ms. vaishali vadhavana,cse depstar looking forward to your participation! --

certification course on "internet of vehicles (iov): 5g and beyond autonomous and connected cars" dear students, short description of the course. *about the course :* this certification course explores both fundamental and advanced concepts of the internet of vehicles (iov) with a focus on 5g technology and its applications in autonomous and connected cars. the course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of iov integration with modern vehicular technology, enhancing connectivity, safety, and efficiency. *course objective :* the course is focused on the professional sectors like embedded, cyber security, network analysis with the interdisciplinary branch of data science and data analysis. this course provides the implementation of 5g technology on intelligent transportation systems. we will generate the data, analyse it, and create an algorithm to estimate traffic patterns, behaviours, alongwith the networking capabilities of 5g. we will have major modules like software, sensing and hardware. later on we targeted the capstone project. interested candidates can register using the link or qr code provided in the course brochure (attached with this email). please find the course brochure in the attachment for syllabus, industry collaborators and other details. registration form: course registration fees : 499/- only. note : we have received sufficient registrations. the registration is open for deserving and qualified candidates in mathematics, programming, data science, and data analysis. master students can join the course, understand the prerequisite and extend their dissertation on this topic. course start date : 15th feb 2025, venue and time will convey to registered candidate through email today evening, -- *with warm regard...**..* *dr. d.chauhan* *ph.d wireless communication* *associate professor* *coordinator-career development and placement cell* *member of university-industry interaction cell* *electronics and communication engineering* *chandubhai s. patel institute of technology* *charotar university of science and technology* accredited *grade a+* by naac *mobile no : 09909454907* --

charotar university *program overview:* *first month: training* - participate in live lectures and receive guidance from industry professionals. - you will receive login details after the registration process. *second month: internship* - engage in real-world projects with professional mentorship. - *project details:* - *individual assignments:* complete 10 unique projects with your mentor. - *group capstone project:* collaborate in teams on a capstone project, with specific roles assigned to each intern. all necessary resources will be provided by the company. *class formats:* 1. *blended learning:* - access recorded sessions and join live doubt-clearing sessions every weekend. 2. *live mentor-led classes:* - attend live zoom sessions 2-3 times per week after 6:30 pm, with recorded sessions available for later review. you will also have access to our learning management system (lms) for six months. *certificates and benefits:* upon completion, students will receive: - a guidelines for project presentation -1 â€“ sgp (4th semester) scheduled on 14/02/2025 dear students, the detailed guidelines for the project presentation are as follows: *4th semester: guidelines for project presentation - 1 (sgp)**presentation date:* *14/02/2025, friday from 09:10 am onwards**important notes:* - along with the presentation, *regular lectures and labs will continue* as scheduled. - students must *attend their classes* and only proceed for the presentation *when their turn arrives*. - *group distribution**, location, and timing will be shared soon*. *preparation guidelines:**1. presentation structure* ensure your presentation follows a logical sequence: - *title & concept clarity:* clearly state your project title and concept. make sure it aligns with the project objectives. - *problem statement & objectives:* define the problem your project addresses and its goals. - *requirements analysis:* clearly specify both functional and non-functional requirements. - *innovation & use of emerging technologies:* highlight unique aspects of your project and its use of modern technologies. - *implementation & feasibility:* explain how your project is developed, its feasibility, and its impact. - *demonstration & results:* provide a working demonstration or prototype if applicable. - *progress & future scope:* summarize key takeaways and potential future enhancements. *2. presentation format* - *time limit:* keep your presentation concise and within the allotted time. (20 minutes per group) - *slide design:* use professional, clear, and visually appealing slides. avoid excessive text. - *visual aids:* include diagrams, graphs, and visuals to enhance understanding. *3. teamwork & collaboration* - all team members should contribute to the presentation. - assign roles in advance to ensure smooth delivery. - be prepared to answer questions from the panel. *4. evaluation criteria* your presentation will be assessed based on the following: - clarity & relevance of title/concept - completeness of functional & non-functional requirements - originality & innovation - use of emerging technologies - impact, feasibility & prioritization - teamwork, collaboration & presentation skills refer to the *sgp comprehensive evaluation rubric* for detailed scoring criteria. *5. presentation etiquette* - dress in formal or business casual attire. - speak clearly and confidently. - maintain eye contact. - manage your time effectively to cover all points. - medium of communication should be in english only. - *rehearse your presentation* multiple times to ensure a smooth delivery. - *arrive on time* and be ready before your slot. - *ensure all necessary materials (slides, srs document files, etc.) are prepared* and available. best of luck with your presentations! ğŸš€ -- regards, dr. parth goel assistant professor, computer science & engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar) charotar university of science and technology (charusat) [*accredited with "a+" grade by naac, goi*], at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist:anand, (gujarat) india. ph. no: 02697-265060, ext. no. : 5297 --

fwd: us university graduate education fair - @charusat on 4th feb 2025 ---------- forwarded message --------- from: head cdpc charusat <head.cdpc@charusat.ac.in> date: mon, feb 3, 2025 at 11:04 am subject: us university graduate education fair - @charusat on 4th feb 2025 to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> < all, greetings from career development and placement cell (cdpc)!! we invite you to explore the u.s. university education fair at our campus. this in-person fair is your chance to interact with 15+ reputed and accredited u.s. universities, offering a wide array of graduate programs (masterâ€™s, ph.d. programs). *fair details: * *date : tuesday, february 04, 2025* *time : 10.00 - 12.30 noon* *venue : center square , **iiim building, charusat university campus, changa* registration required: fairs are an opportunity for you to connect with u.s. higher education institutions to learn more about study options in the united states. *meet the officials from 14 u.s. universities :* - governors state university - lewis university - massachusetts college of pharmacy and health sciences [ mcphs ] - northeastern university - san jose state university - the catholic university of america - university of louisville, college of business - university of massachusetts lowell - university of nebraska lincoln - university of southern california marshall school of business - university of wisconsin milwaukee - wayne state university - worcester polytechnic institute - ets india testing body [ toefl / gre ] - indo american education society *student - to do list before the fair:* 1. research participating institutes before arriving at the fair event. 2. make a list of priority institutes that you would like to visit followed by secondary interests. 3. visit booths in that order to ensure you have enough time! fwd: disha program for transformative innovation | grant support by iiti drishti cps foundation, iit indore thanks & regards, miss. naina parmar, assistant professor, computer science & engineering department, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar) changa-gujarat 388421 ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> date: sat, feb 1, 2025 at 9:17 am subject: fwd: disha program for transformative innovation | grant support by iiti drishti cps foundation, iit indore to: depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in> ---------- forwarded message --------- from: iiti drishti cps foundation <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in> date: fri, jan 31, 2025 at 5:21 pm subject: disha program for transformative innovation | grant support by iiti drishti cps foundation, iit indore to: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> dear dr. amit nayak greetings from iiti drishti cps foundation, iit indore !! we are excited to invite you and your esteemed institution/organization to participate in the disha (developing innovations for successful harnessing and adoption) program, spearheaded by the < drishti cps foundation < this program is an exceptional opportunity for faculty and student-led startups to bring groundbreaking innovations to life, transforming ideas into commercially viable solutions. about disha: the disha program aims to identify, fund, and mentor deep-tech innovations, facilitating their journey toward commercialization. it focuses on cyber-physical systems (cps) in critical areas such as digital healthcare, intelligent manufacturing, and related domains, emphasizing system modelling, simulation, and visualization. who can apply: - open to faculty, researchers, and students from higher education institutes across india who wish to commercialize their technology by creating spinoff startups. - faculty, researchers, and students with market-ready products or technologies aimed at commercialization. - startups already incorporated as private limited/llp by eligible faculty and/or researchers and/or students. - existing startups having strong academic link/willing to collaborate with academics for technology upgradation/willing to take ip developed in academia to the market through their startup. program highlights: - financial support of up to inr â‚¹50l initially, with additional funding based on progress up to inr â‚¹50l. - comprehensive mentorship in technology and business development. - assistance with ip filing, startup registration, and commercialization strategies. - host institutions will receive grants from the iiti drishti cps foundation to support startups and research initiatives at their respective institutions. - access to entrepreneurial resources, including tools and credits for early-stage development. why participate? this initiative provides a unique platform to: - bridge the gap between academia and industry. - accelerate innovation to market-ready solutions. - establish a network with experts, investors, and peers. we firmly believe your institutionâ€™s or organizationâ€™s expertise and innovative projects can significantly contribute to and benefit from this initiative. for more details on eligibility and application procedures, please refer to the program guidelines attached here. the application deadline is 9th february 2025, and we encourage you to submit your proposals at your earliest convenience. link for application: *click here < we look forward to your participation in shaping the future of innovation and fostering impactful collaborations. note: 1. guidelines, faqs and program brochure are attached for your reference in this email. *regards,* rekha ganeshkar iiti drishti cps foundation *e:* *tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in <tdp.drishticps@iiti.ac.in>* *m:* +919303854671 *w:* drishticps.iiti.ac.in *a:* iiti drishti cps foundation, iit indore simrol, indore, 453552, madhya pradesh < < < -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion visit < . --

*100% placement assistance: *join our growth community for direct placement support with top companies.

fwd: stalls of overseas study consultants at rpcp ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal rpcp charusat <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in> date: thu, jan 23, 2025, 4:36 pm subject: stalls of overseas study consultants at rpcp to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> dear all, we are excited to invite you to explore opportunities for higher studies abroad at our upcoming event avalanche 2025 at rpcp. a variety of esteemed organizations will be showcasing their programs, offering valuable insights into the best international study options. *date:*24-25 jan 2025 *time:* 10:00 am onwards *venue:* rpcp building come and meet representatives to learn about scholarships, application procedures, and explore a wide range of courses and programs designed to help you further your academic and professional career. *stalls to visit:* 1. *disha consultant*: specializing in university selection, visa guidance, and financing for studies in the us, canada, and germany. with 22 years of experience, let them guide you to your academic dreams. 2. *apomind*: offering gpat/niper coaching with a gamified learning platform for an engaging and effective study experience. 3. *pharmavision*: experts in pharmacist career counseling with over 15 years of experience helping students navigate their future careers in pharmacy. 4. *kanan international*: the trusted immigration consultancy with over 24 years of experience, providing coaching for ielts, toefl, gre, and sat, along with study abroad guidance. 5. *apex education*: leading ielts institute with personalized assistance for your international study plans. 6. *aussizz group*: a leader in education and migration consultancy, offering visa services and top-tier coaching for ielts and pte preparation. 7. *aspire square*: experts in study abroad consulting for destinations like australia, canada, the uk, the usa, and new zealand, plus dmit tests and immigration services. 8. *future link*: a canada-based consultancy helping students with visa assistance and coaching for global study opportunities, with 60,000+ success stories. 9. *d-vivid*: simplifying the study abroad process with experienced advisors ready to guide you to success. donâ€™t miss this chance to take the next step in your education journey. we look forward to your presence! a kind request to forward to the students. -- *dr. manan raval* *principal - ramanbhai patel college of pharmacy* *charotar university of science and technology* *charusat campus,* *changa - 388421, ta: petlad, di: anand* *ext. no. - (02697) 265141* *e-mail - principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in <principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>* --

fwd: alert regarding fraudulent job appointment scams using aicte and moe identities-regarding ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> date: thu, jan 23, 2025, 4:40 pm subject: fwd: alert regarding fraudulent job appointment scams using aicte and moe identities-regarding to: depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in> ---------- forwarded message --------- from: aicte <aictenoreply@aicte-india.org> date: thu, jan 23, 2025 at 4:29 pm subject: alert regarding fraudulent job appointment scams using aicte and moe identities-regarding to: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> to, the vice chancellors of technical universities directors/principals of aicte-approved institutions subject: alert regarding fraudulent job appointment scams using aicte and moe identities. it has come to the attention of the all india council for technical education (aicte) that fraudulent activities are being conducted wherein fake job appointment letters and related communications are issued in the name of aicte and ministry of education (moe) officers. these communications are sent from counterfeit email addresses resembling official domains, misleading individuals into believing they have been offered employment opportunities. it is for your information that the all india council for technical education (aicte) uses only its own domain as aicte-india.org < for any communication. key points of concern: 1. nature of fraud: fraudsters are impersonating aicte and moe officials and issuing fraudulent job offers, 2. tactics used: use of fake email addresses and forged documents to appear legitimate. 3, impact: such scams tarnish the reputation of aicte and moe while exploiting unsuspecting individuals. actions to be taken by institutions: 1. raise awareness: inform all students, faculty, and staff about this fraudulent activity and advise them to be cautious when dealing with unsolicited job offers. 2. verification protocol: encourage individuals to verify the authenticity of any job-related communication purportedly from aicte or moe by contacting official channels. 3. report suspicious activity: direct any instances of fraudulent communication to the aicte or the cyber crime division immediately, 4. publish notifications: kindly display this circular on notice boards and circulate it widely among your institution's community. 5. in view of the above, once again all the institutions are requested to respond/ provide data to communication received only from the domain @ aicte-india.org < or @ go v.in < . reporting cyber fraud: institutions and individuals are requested to report such incidents to the local cyber crime cell and the computer emergency response team (cert.ln) at the earliest. your proactive action is crucial in combating this menace and ensuring the safety and security of our academic community. please remain vigilant and help us safeguard the integrity of our esteemed organizations. thank you for your immediate attention and action. pfa:- < * with regards * * dr. prashant kharat * * dy. director & ciso * * all india council for technical education * * nelson mandela road, vasantkunj, new delhi-110070 < * -- click here < to unsubscribe from this newsletter. -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion visit < . --

project opportunity: working on diffusion models (gan) for image generation and editing dear students, i hope this email finds you well. i am reaching out to share an exciting *project opportunity* for those interested in *advanced ai models *and image processing techniques. the project will focus on *diffusion models (gan)*, a cutting-edge approach to *generating and editing images based* on *text prompts*. these models have gained significant attention in the ai community for their ability to create high-quality, contextually relevant images from scratch or update existing ones based on user input. project scope: - understanding the fundamentals of diffusion models. - implementing or fine-tuning a diffusion model for image generation. - enabling image editing or updates as per user prompts. - exploring potential applications in creative and industrial domains. requirements: - a solid understanding of deep learning fundamentals. - familiarity with frameworks like pytorch or tensorflow and *hugging face (must).* - interest in exploring advanced generative ai techniques. - willingness to work collaboratively and contribute to research-oriented outputs. if you are interested in taking up this project, please reply to this email with your interest and any relevant experience you may have by 25/01/2025. looking forward to your enthusiastic participation in this endeavor! thank you. -- regards, dr. parth goel assistant professor, computer science & engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar) charotar university of science and technology (charusat) [*accredited with "a+" grade by naac, goi*], at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist:anand, (gujarat) india. ph. no: 02697-265060, ext. no. : 5297 --

info_students dear student of *charusat* *launched*, in collaboration with *iit kharagpur kshitij*, is offering a 2-month training + internship program. this opportunity is available for all department and every year with fixed slots. we invite you to complete the application form to secure your spot. congratulations to all who have successfully enrolled in the industrial training & internship program. we hope you found the* induction session* valuable. *application form * * < group link* *referral id: dice id (for charusat students only)* *program details* *- first month: training includes live lectures and mentorship from industry professionals. login credentials will be provided upon registration.* *- second month: internship with live mentorship on projects from professionals. experience real-world problems through:* *- project 1:* 10 individual projects to be completed with your mentor. *- project 2:* capstone group project with specific tasks assigned to each intern. *benefits:* - program completion certificate from *iit kharagpur kshitij*. - internship certificate from top mncs with wipro dice id verification. - 6-month lms portal access. - growth community pass with placement assistance. - 24/7 personalized mentorship. - complimentary sessions on gen ai & prompt engineering. - guidance on low code & no code applications. - live & doubt-clearing sessions conducted by industrial experts. - guest lectures from microsoft & meta. to enroll in this program, please complete the application form & join the official group at your earliest convenience. *students who are already enrolled, ignore this mail.* warm

invitation: become a kubestronaut in 2025 join the largest devops community view in browser ( ) kubestronaut (1) ( ) hey 23dcs023@charusat.edu.in, i am excited to announce the launch of our 2025 kubestronaut program - a comprehensive, year-long journey designed to transform beginners into kubernetes experts through cohort-based learning and certification preparation. what makes this program special is its focus on collaborative learning and real-world application. we're not just aiming for certifications; we're building a community of cloud-native practitioners who support and learn from each other. program timeline ğŸ—“ï¸ january - march: cka (certified kubernetes administrator) ğŸ—“ï¸ april: ckad (certified kubernetes application developer) ğŸ—“ï¸ may: kcna (kubernetes cloud native associate) ğŸ—“ï¸ june - august: cks (certified kubernetes security specialist) ğŸ—“ï¸ august - october: kcsa (certified kubernetes service administrator) ğŸ—“ï¸ november -december: buffer time to catch up and prepare for final goals. key program features: - structured cohort-based learning environment - progress tracking and motivational leaderboards - bi-weekly expert-led q&a sessions and progress check-ins - hands-on labs focusing on real-world scenarios - active discord community for peer support and networking ( ) program delivery all learning content and labs will be delivered through the kodekloud learning platform, supplemented by: - regular discord channel interactions ( ) - bi-weekly live sessions for progress reviews and expert guidance - comprehensive lab exercises and practical assignments cost and requirements the program itself is free! the only requirement is maintaining an active kodekloud standard subscription (or higher) to access the course materials and labs. ready to begin your kubernetes journey? register your interest now to secure your spot in this transformative program. register your interest ( ) looking forward to embarking on this exciting journey with you! best regards, mumshad mannambeth kode kloud ( ) learning path ( ) | for teams ( ) | kodekloud engineer ( ) | playgrounds ( ) | pricing ( ) facebook ( ) linkedin ( ) x ( ) instagram ( ) youtube ( ) unsubscribe ( ) or manage preferences ( ) . kodekloud (brand owned by zaurac technologies pte. ltd.) 14 robinson road, #08-01a far east finance building, singapore, central singapore, 048545 singapore

appreciation to lesson planning portal developer - dhairya shah (23dcs118) & priyanshu valiya (23dcs141) dear students, we are delighted to share the contributions of our students *(dhairya shah - 23dcs118 and priyanshu valiya - 23dcs141) *for the successful completion of phase -1 of the lesson planning (lp) portal (web application) and making it live for teachers. this platform is designed to streamline academic processes and objectives, save valuable time, and enable teachers to efficiently manage lesson planning for their subjects. the key contributors of this project are as follows: - dhairya shah (23dcs118) â€“ lead developer & system architect - priyanshu valiya (23dcs141) â€“ next.js developer - dr. parth goel (coordinator, teaching learning committee) â€“ mentor and testing of a portal it is worth noting that this significant task was *completed within just three weeks*, resulting in phase 1 (version 1.0) of the portal. their efforts have culminated in a user-friendly and efficient platform that will benefit the entire institution. this accomplishment is a testament to the hard work and dedication of our students. *let us all take a moment to applaud dhairya and priyanshu for their outstanding accomplishment and be inspired by their dedication.* we would like to acknowledge and express our gratitude to dr. amit nayak sir (process owner - teaching learning committee) and dr. bankim patel sir (principal-depstar) for their continuous support and valuable suggestions during the portal's implementation. thank you for your continuous enthusiasm and support in making such initiatives successful. -- regards, dr. parth goel assistant professor, computer science & engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar) charotar university of science and technology (charusat) [*accredited with "a+" grade by naac, goi*], at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist:anand, (gujarat) india. ph. no: 02697-265060, ext. no. : 5297 --

fwd: ccna academy - introduction to basics of networking technology @ depstar in ay:2024-25 *dear students,* [image: cleardot.gif] greetings for the day!!! we are excited to announce that devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar) is offering specialized networking knowledge through the *ccna academy*, along with the opportunity to earn the ccna certification. the cisco networking academy program provides students with valuable internet technology skills through certifications like *ccna* and *ccnp*. the goal of this program is to train and equip students to design, build, and maintain complex computer networks, addressing the demands of the digital economy and providing access to cutting-edge it and telecommunications technologies. *objectives:* - to provide students at depstar with highly employable it skills in internet networking. - to help meet the growing demand for skilled networking professionals, reducing the need for foreign talent in the industry. *methodology:* cisco systems will supply the curriculum, training materials, and program support needed to establish and maintain the academy. students will have access to comprehensive online study materials, including interactive labs, helping them develop confidence and hands-on experience in networking. the cisco curriculum ensures the development of practical computer networking knowledge and skills. *scope of the certification course:* in todayâ€™s competitive job market, many organizations prefer professionals with not only a degree but also relevant certifications. the cisco certified network associate (ccna) certification is one of the most recognized credentials in the industry. by completing the ccna program, students will gain a deep understanding of networking principles and concepts. *ccna networking competencies include:* - understanding computer hardware, software, electricity, networking terminology, and protocols. - lans and wans, osi model, ethernet, and ip addressing. - designing and documenting basic network infrastructure and structured cabling. - network-to-network communication. *course fees:* - 2000 inr the ccna academy classes will be held on the *1st and 3rd saturdays of each semester*. interested students can register by filling out the google form: for more details about the course, please visit the official cisco networking academy site: course content: *tutor:* dr. amit nayak (ph.d., head of the department - information technology) *ccna academy statistics at depstar:* - *ay 2017-18:* 42 students - *ay 2018-19:* 32 students - *ay 2019-20:* 32 students - *ay 2020-21:* 33 students - *ay 2021-22:* 16 students for any queries, feel free to reach out to *ritika jani* or *dr. amit nayak* . -- *thanks and regards,* *ritika jani.* *assistant professor.* *department of information technology,* *devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar)* *charusat, changa.* *"the more you sweat in practice the less you bleed in battle"* --

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- *invitation to join hackathon event organized by iit kanpur* dear vice chancellor/ director *greetings from the association of indian universities (aiu).* i am delighted to extend an invitation to your esteemed university to participate in the upcoming hackathon event organized by iit kanpur. as india's leading cybersecurity innovation hub, c3ihub, iit kanpur aims to nurture talent and drive innovation by tackling real-world cybersecurity challenges. this hackathon offers an exciting platform for students and researchers to engage with industry experts, showcase their skills, and contribute to solving critical cybersecurity issues. i would like to invite your esteemed university to encourage participation through your students and alumni in the cybersecurity challenges. for more details, please visit the event website at < *the main goal of this hackathon is to raise awareness about cybersecurity among young people.* *expectations from universities:* *promotional support:* sharing event details with students and faculty through internal communication channels. prominent display of hackathon materials on campus and social platforms. *participation:* encouraging active participation from your student community. facilitating faculty involvement in hackathon activities. *benefits for participants:* hackathon challenges will resemble real-world scenarios, allowing participants to develop expertise as they progress through them. participants will learn how to stay cyber-safe against modern cyberattacks and crimes. hackathon winners will receive cash awards, cloud credits, and opportunities for internships or jobs with c3ihub. hackathon winners will also get startup incubation opportunities with siic at iit kanpur under the guidance of c3ihub. we believe that your university's participation will significantly contribute to the success of this event, while also providing valuable learning and growth opportunities for your students and faculty. i appreciate your support and we look forward to your active participation. warm regards, fwd: mandatory safety reminder for charusat family: helmet & seat belt compliance â€“ nss initiative ---------- forwarded message --------- from: kishan patel <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in> date: wed, nov 27, 2024 at 11:28 am subject: mandatory safety reminder for charusat family: helmet & seat belt compliance â€“ nss initiative to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>, <family@charusat.edu.in > cc: registrar charusat <registrar@charusat.ac.in> dear charusat family members, greetings from charusat nss unit we would like to inform you that it is now *mandatory* for all students,staff and faculty members to: - *wear helmets* while riding two-wheelers. - *fasten seat belts* when driving or traveling in a car. to ensure adherence, *nss volunteers* *will be stationed at both university gates to monitor compliance and raise awareness.* we kindly ask everyone to be *polite and cooperative* with them, as they are working to safeguard your safety. this initiative is *compulsory* and has been implemented to maintain a safe environment for all members of the charusat community. your cooperation is crucial to the success of this initiative. letâ€™s work together to make our campus safer. thank you for your valuable support and understanding . --

23dcs023, your october developer update is here october 2024 here's your monthly dose of google for developers news! want to see more of what you care about? update your interests to receive a more curated selection of news and resources in the next edition. < personalize this newsletter < < advancing multilingual ai with gemma 2 we recently unveiled a new 2-billion parameter gemma 2 variant fine-tuned for japanese, and weâ€™re inviting developers to adapt gemma to their own languages, to help people better communicate across cultures. join the kaggle competition < and empower others to learn and contribute to the development of language models for diverse communities. learn more < < be inspired to build with google ai we are excited to launch season 3 of build with google ai < this season showcases how gemma models create custom, self-managed ai solutions. see how developers fine-tune models for automation and enhanced experiences. explore projects, tutorials, and tips. < watch now < < tune in for #theandroidshow join us on october 31 at 10am pt for our autumn episode of #theandroidshow! in our quarterly show, weâ€™ll be live from droidcon in london, where weâ€™ll be taking the lid off the biggest update to gemini in android studio since launch, plus demos of jetpack compose and more. plus, weâ€™ve assembled a team of experts from across android to answer your #askandroid questions on building excellent apps, across devices. < learn more < product updates gemini nano for android: experimental access now open all android developers can now experiment with gemini nano, our most efficient on-device ai model. you can use the ai edge sdk via ai core to add advanced ai capabilities to your apps, starting with text-to-text prompts on pixel 9 devices. note: experimental access is for development only. < learn more < vertex ai prompt optimizer vertex ai prompt optimizer, now in public preview, refines prompts for any model on vertex ai. with its iterative approach, you can optimize instructions and examples to improve performance in your ai applications. < read more < project idx early access updates project idx, an ai-assisted workspace for full-stack app development, is evolving! join our early access program to test experimental features and provide feedback. your input will help shape tools that streamline developer workflows. < sign up now < codelabs and pathways use cnns with complex images dive into convolutional neural networks (cnns) to process complex images where the subject could appear anywhere. develop skills in building robust ai models for image recognition and analysis tasks. start learning < getting started with the gemini api learn how to use the gemini api with the google ai javascript sdk to build generative ai for your web applications. this codelab walks you through the process, providing a hands-on guide for ai-powered web development. start learning < developer community join devfest 2024 thereâ€™s a devfest 2024 happening near you. connect with developers at local events to explore responsible ai through expert talks, hands-on workshops, and networking. there's something for everyone, no matter your level. < find a devfest < google chrome built-in ai challenge the google chrome built-in ai challenge invites developers to create web apps or chrome extensions using built-in ai apis. compete for cash prizes and showcase your skills. sign up to explore, create, and share. < register now< didnâ€™t find what youâ€™re looking for? update your interests < to see more relevant content in next monthâ€™s edition. connect with us blogger < youtube < x < instagram < linkedin < (c) 2024 google llc 1600 amphitheatre parkway mountain view, ca 94043 this message was sent to 23dcs023@charusat.edu.in because you indicated that you are willing to stay up to date with news from google developer program. if you don't want to receive such emails in the future, please unsubscribe here < you can also change your preferences on your google developer program email setting by logging in at google developer program <

real-time projects with mentor assistance - minor project (individual) - 7 days - major project (group) - 21 days - project review by experts *3rd month: placement assistance* - placement support including mock interviews, group discussions, resume building, and personality development - placement opportunities with a potential package of up to 10 lpa *benefits of joining codeioxâ€™s program:* 1. co-branded training completion certificate (iso and wipro approved) 2. internship completion certificate from mncs 3. outstanding/excellent performer certificate (based on performance) 4. letter of recommendation from mncs 5. real-time industrial-grade projects to enhance your resume 6. placement assistance provided 7. expert guidance from professionals working in reputed organizations like tcs, ibm, microsoft, accenture, deloitte, and more *note:* training fees are applicable. *almost done with the campaign â€“ only 11 seats remaining for your class!* donâ€™t miss out on this opportunity! to secure your spot, please register now using the following link: *we believe that investing in this program is an investment in your future career. explore more about our courses through online reviews and take advantage of this limited opportunity.* for any questions or further information, feel free to reach out. *best

regarding anti-ragging registration dear students, greetings...! please find the below reminder for the anti-ragging affidavit registration for ay 2024-25. kindly find the revised process for filing the anti-ragging affidavit. step-1: go to step-2: fill in the information as desired and submit the form. read and confirm that you and your parents have read and understood the aicte regulations step-3: on successful completion, you will receive an email regarding the reference number and weblink where you will be able to check your registration status step-4: go to and *generate an undertaking document. take a print of it. put your signature and your parent's signature and submit the hard copy of it to your respective faculty batch counselor. * [reference id can be found in your mail received from the anti-ragging committee.] step-5: go to this google form link and submit anti-ragging form(signed copy of student & parents). *deadline: 09/11/2024, 4:30 pm.* *note:- this mail for d2d students only.* here, i attached documents for your reference. *thanks & regards,* *priyanka padhiyar* *assistant professor,* *computer science & engineering,* *devang patel institute of advance technology & research (depstar),* *charotar university of science & technology (charusat),* *at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist: anand, (gujarat) india. * --

did you know? your devops training could be free. your company might be willing to sponsor your professional development, including online training platforms like kodekloud. frame 33269 (3) ( ) hey 23dcs023@charusat.edu.in, we've missed you at kodekloud! youâ€™ve done it: finding time to level up your devops skills while juggling your daily work. here's the scoop: your company could be willing to fund your devops training! that's right! while you've been working hard on our courses, your employer might be more than happy to cover the cost. sounds too good to be true? image 513 (1) ( ) here's why this is a big deal: - many companies have untapped training budgets - your skills upgrade is a win for your whole team - you could advance your career without the personal expense intrigued? we've prepared resources to help you make the case to your employer: ask my manager to sponsor my kodekloud learning ( ) let us know how it goes! kode kloud ( ) learning path ( ) | for teams ( ) | kodekloud engineer ( ) | playgrounds ( ) | pricing ( ) facebook ( ) linkedin ( ) x ( ) instagram ( ) youtube ( ) unsubscribe ( ) or manage preferences ( ) . kodekloud (brand owned by zaurac technologies pte. ltd.) 14 robinson road, #08-01a far east finance building, singapore, central singapore, 048545 singapore

fwd: announcement of maker fest vadodara 2025 dear students, weâ€™re thrilled to announce the 7th edition of *maker fest vadodara!* the event is scheduled for *february 1st and 2nd (sat-sun), 2025.* innovation is the key to shaping the future, and *maker fest vadodara* is the ultimate platform for students to showcase their groundbreaking ideas. whether theyâ€™re solving real-world problems or creating something entirely new, this is their chance to be at the forefront of change. in the past six editions, weâ€™ve seen incredible participation - over 1500 registrations, 360 maker teams exhibited, prize amount of rs10.75 lakhs distributed and welcomed over 47,000 visitors. *we invite your students to be a part of this movement* â€“ as *makers*. if theyâ€™re working on something original and useful, this is their moment to shine, network with industry leaders, and gain valuable exposure. *event details:* - *dates:* february 1st & 2nd, 2025 (saturday-sunday) - *venue:* grounds of faculty of technology, msu registrations will open soon at: encourage your students to gear up and submit their best projects. letâ€™s make this yearâ€™s maker fest vadodara the best one yet!

announcement of ulsc logo competition winner dear students and faculty, we are excited to announce the winner of the ulsc logo competition! after careful consideration and review of all the creative submissions, we are pleased to congratulate *satyam charola (id: 22ce016)* as the winner of this competition. his design will represent the ulsc, and we appreciate the effort and creativity he put into the logo. satyam was awarded with a cash prize for his achievement. we extend our heartfelt thanks to all participants for their outstanding contributions and enthusiasm. stay tuned for more such opportunities! best

fwd: urgent: encouragement for student participation in yuva sangam phase-5. ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> date: fri, 11 oct 2024 at 4:28 pm subject: fwd: urgent: encouragement for student participation in yuva sangam phase-5. to: hod depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in> ---------- forwarded message --------- from: aicte(no-reply) <noreply9@aicte-india.org> date: fri, oct 11, 2024 at 4:25 pm subject: urgent: encouragement for student participation in yuva sangam phase-5. to: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> dear vice chancellor/director/principal/ dean, greetings from aicte! as you know, yuva sangam is a key initiative under the ek bharat shreshtha bharat (ebsb) program, launched by the hon'ble prime minister of india. this flagship program facilitates exposure tours for youth primarily students from higher educational institutions (heis) to experience diverse cultures and achievements across different states. through these exchanges, we aim to foster national integration and understanding among young people. yuva sangam not only emphasizes cultural exchange but also includes activities designed to enhance leadership, sports, and soft skills. participants will engage in workshops on communication and teamwork, take part in sports events organized by sai, and have the chance to interact with vvips and notable personalities from the host state. the success of previous yuva sangam phases underscores the vital role of youth in building connections across communities. this initiative has positively impacted the lives of thousands, contributing to a more united and inclusive india. i encourage you to motivate your students to register for yuva sangam phase-5, an enriching student exchange program under ebsb. registration is open from *october 10, 2024* to *october 21, 2024* and can be completed online at please find attached a document with strategies to inspire student registrations for yuva sangam. pfa: pfa: pfa: *thank you for your support.* *best regards,* *naresh grover* *director (nodal officer, yuva sangam)* *aicte* -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < . --

fwd: tata strive _free google certification program 2024 with charusat university dear charusat university learners greetings from tata strive!!! this is regarding the tata strive _google career certificate scholarship program these are scholarships for the google certification program and tata strive is bringing them to your institution. these programs can help students get on the fast track to an entry-level job in a high-growth field. students do not need relevant experience to complete this flexible, online job training. you can complete the certificate at your own pace in the given time. there are 8 google industry relevant domain / technical courses. (anyone you can choose) 1. google data analytics professional 2. google ux design 3. google it support 4. google it automation with python 5. google digital marketing and e-commerce 6. google business intelligence 7. google advanced data analytics 8. google cybersecurity along with google certifications, tata strive also offers complimentary youth development modules (ydm) course (20 hrs). these modules are leading self, leading at social relationships, and leading at work. these will also be hosted online on the tcs-ion platform. we are also offering subject matter expert (sme) sessions, where an online platform will be set up for esteemed speakers from high-profile companies and students to interact and clear doubts. kindly refer the below details: registration link: to register for the google certification program, please use the following link: registration link < by selecting the proper options *state: gujaratdistrict: anandinstitute name: charusat university* registration deadline: 12th oct 2024 up to 12:00 noon orientation date: course end date: 18th dec, 2024 thank you! *----------------------------* *thanks & regards,ashwin makwana/sujal dadhaniya* *tpo - **career development and placement cell (cdpc)*, *charotar university of science & technology (charusat) * at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> respected sir/ma'am, are your students ready to take the leap into the future of technology? the *xr creator hackathon < is not just another competition; it's a* gateway to innovation*,* recognition, and real-world experience* in the thriving field of extended reality (xr)! we invite your esteemed institution to be a part of this transformative challenge, proudly presented under the *"create in india" initiative* at the *waves summit (world audio visual & entertainment summit) < *in collaboration with the *ministry of information & broadcasting < bharat xr, < wavelaps, and xdg.* at *bharat xr < we are passionate about leading the charge in extended reality technologies in india. our mission is to *empower and nurture the next generation of xr talent,* and this hackathon is a direct extension of that vision. by participating, your students have the chance to engage with the latest ar/vr tools, gain hands-on experience, and be recognized on national and global stages. *what awaits the participants? * - a prize pool of 5 lakh inr - investment opportunities for their winning ideas - global recognition in the xr industry - a fully sponsored trip to the waves summit in new delhi - exclusive chances for sponsored trips to international ar/vr conferences *choose from exciting themes:* students can dive into one of five dynamic themes: - healthcare, fitness, well-being - educational transformation - immersive tourism - digital media & entertainment - e-commerce & retail transformation *how to register?* - form to nominate yourself as the *poc* for the hackathon: < - about xr creator hackathon: < - encourage your students to *register individually* here, exclusively for the college students: < - *waves summit:* < *incentives for your institution:* your institution can shine brighter with our incentives: - *100+ registrations*: the point of contact will receive a digital certificate of appreciation featuring the ministry of information & broadcasting logo. - *200+ registrations*: your college's logo will be displayed on our official event website, enhancing your institution's visibility across the nation. *why is this challenge essential?* we urge your institution to rally your students to register before the *deadline* on *october 15, 2024*. this remote challenge is open to all indian citizens and offers a platform for students to develop their skills, innovate with cutting-edge technologies, and connect with industry professionals. *support for beginners:* to empower every student, we are offering dedicated learning sessions for beginners during the ideation and implementation phases. the first session on* october 11, 2024*, will unveil the latest advancements in ar and vr. we are also open to organizing tailored sessions for your college to ensure students have the best possible start. attached is an official letter from* mrs. neerja sekhar, ias, additional secretary to the government of india, ministry of information & broadcasting*, which provides further details about our collaboration and the significance of this event. by partnering with *bharat xr* and other esteemed organizations, your institution will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of xr in india. join us in inspiring the next generation of xr innovators! your support can be the catalyst that propels your students into an exciting future. together, we can foster a culture of creativity and excellence in ar/vr technology. letâ€™s make history together by shaping the future of xr technology! warm syllabus for internal unit test -1 dear students, please find the syllabus for the internal unit test- 1 : : cse201 (java programming) subject. *unit -3*:- *inheritance*: using super creating multilevel hierarchy, method overriding, dynamic method dispatch, abstract classes, using final with inheritance, *package*: defining package, finding package and classpath, access protection, importing package, *interface*: defining interface, default methods,implementing interface, *unit -4*:- exception types, try â€¦catchâ€¦finally, throw, throws, creating your exception subclasses *unit -5:*- life cycle of thread, thread methods, thread priority, thread exceptions, implementing runnable interface, synchronization and concurrency regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

u & p u. patel department of computer engineering, cspit organizes following event in step towards helping people having disabilities or physically challenged. *title of the event:* " creative project ideas for improving the lives of specially abled people " guidelines: 1. students may submit their creative working project ideas on a drawing sheet of paper/ppt/pdf. submission link: these can be further modified on the day of presentation [*7/12/2024*]. 2. last *extended date* of entry submission: 30th november, 2024 [ideas through online shared google form]. each student has to make a separate entry using the shared google form link. 3. students may use a pen, pencil, sketch pens or any other tools [computer software/hardware] to depict their ideas on the day of presentation [date: 7/12/2024, venue: mac lab (601), a7 building]. participants have to remain present in mac lab (601) [a7 building] from 09:15 am to 12:00 pm on 07/12/2024, saturday to present their project ideas. students may use presentation and poster to demonstrate their project ideas. 4. students may show project implementation 5. students may submit their ideas in a group of maximum 3 students. 6. best of the three innovative ideas will be awarded prize money & certificate *(first prize 1500 rs/-, second prize 1000 rs/-, third prize 500 rs/-)*. others will receive a certificate of participation. *eoc department coordinators are requested to encourage students for participation and please forward this mail to students of your department.* *for any further query you may please contact student fwd: regarding the syllabus of the sessional examination & quiz-2 of ma253 dear students, the syllabus of the *sessional examination & quiz-2 *of ma253 (dma) is as follows. *unit-2 relations and lattice* 2.3 representations of relations: graphical and matrix representation. 2.4 covering of a set, partition of a set. 2.5 partially ordered sets, totally ordered sets, hasse diagram. 2.6 lattices, sub lattices 2.7 properties of lattices (without proof) 2.8 complete lattices, bounded lattices, distributive lattices, complemented lattices and complemented distributive lattices. *unit-3 graph theory* 3.1 basic terminologies, simple graphs, types of graphs. 3.2 degree of a vertex, matrix representations of graph 3.5 isomorphic graphs *unit-5 abstract algebra* 5.2 lagrangeâ€™s theorem. 5.3 subgroup, cyclic subgroup, permutation group. *unit-6 linear algebra* 6.1 vector space: definition and examples. subspaces. 6.2 linear combinations, linearly dependence and linearly independence. 6.3 basis and dimension of a vector space. kindly note that *quiz-2* will be on the *same day* in the *online mode* from *03:00 pm to 03:25 pm*. the google form link for quiz-2 will be provided at *02:55 pm* in your *institute's email ids only*. the link will be closed at sharp *03.25 pm.* thank you. convenor ma253 -- *dr. pragneshkumar r. makwana* *m.sc., m.phil., ph.d.* *assistant professor,department of mathematical sciences,p. d. patel institute of applied sciences,* *charotar university of science & technology,changa, gujarat, india.* --

fwd: promoting a continuous learning environment: clubs management | technical club dear all, a gentle reminder for the registration. the link is open till 24.09.2024, 4:30 pm. link : *thanks and regards,* *radhika h. patel* *assistant professor* *department of information technology* *depstar,* *charusat, changa* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: dipika damodar <dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in> date: fri, sep 20, 2024 at 2:09 pm subject: promoting a continuous learning environment: clubs management | technical club to: depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in> cc: dr dweepna garg <dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>, hod depstar < hodds@charusat.ac.in>, principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> dear all, in our pursuit of fostering a vibrant learning culture, clubs management | technical club is excited to introduce the "*learn after college hours*" initiative. we believe that education extends beyond the classroom and that collaborative learning can thrive even after formal college hours. in this context, we are organizing a webinar on *"blockchain foundations: the core of trustless technology"*. this session will be delivered by *ms. naina parmar* *webinar details:* - *date:* 25th september,2024 - *time:* 8:00 pm to 9:00 pm - *mode:* online (ms teams - the joining link will be sent to registered participants only.) *why attend?* blockchain technology is reshaping industries by enabling secure, decentralized, and transparent systems. through this session, you will: - understand the core principles of blockchain and its architecture. - explore the concept of a *trustless system* and how blockchain ensures security without intermediaries. - learn about the real-world applications of blockchain in various sectors like finance, healthcare, and supply chain. - get insights into future career opportunities in the blockchain domain. *registration process:* to attend this insightful session, please click the link below to register: Â· registration link: Â· registration deadline: 23rd , september 2024 itâ€™s a fantastic opportunity to expand your technical knowledge and explore the future of digital trust. for any queries, please feel free to contact ms. dipika damodar (email id: dipikadamodar.dit@charusat.ac.in | contact: 7405862155). we look forward to your active participation! -- best
