apply for start-up gujarat seed fund (30 lakhs-40 lakhs) via civf dear start-up, as you know civf (charusat innovative ventures foundation)- a section-8 company of charusat university has been officially recognized as a *nodal institute* by the *industries commissionerate, govt. of gujarat*. we invite you to apply for a seed grant to fuel your growth and innovation. don't miss this opportunity to accelerate your startup journey! (find the scheme document as *ann-1*) as a nodal institute, civf can now offer the following support: - assistance up to *inr 30 lakh* as a *seed support* to the startups. - sustenance allowance of *inr 20,000 per month *to the startups and *inr 25,000 per month* to *women-led startups* for a period of one year. - additional assistance up to *inr 10 lakh *for the startups generating significant impact on the society. thus seed support extends to up to inr 40 lakhs. - assistance up to *inr 1 lakh* per startup for obtaining* training in soft skills *on a reimbursement basis. - assistance up to *inr 3 lakh* to enroll and participate in national/international recognized *acceleration programs.* - additional 1% interest subsidy, maximum up to* 9% on term loans* to applicants under the scheme's provisions for assistance to msmes. the application process is as under: 1. read the eligibility criteria of the scheme. (product/service should be innovative, company should be registered and the start-up should be based in gujarat) *(*refer to detailed eligibility criteria in* ann-2)* 2. fill out the form based on the benefit you want to avail. (find all applicable forms in the attachment as *ann-3, ann-4, ann-5 & ann-6. *take the pdf content of the application form in word, enter the details in soft copy, take print and sign and stamp on hard copy and send the original file at civf- 209, iiim) 2. pitch deck presentation in front of civf internal committee. 3. civf will recommend the selected start-ups to industries commissionerate for seed grant or other benefits. 4. if approved at the slec committee of *industries commissionerate*, the grant will be given to ni (i.e. civf) and be disbursed to start-up in tranches based on your milestones. all the very best and feel free to seek further information. *deadline: 01/10/2024 till 12:30 pm* note: "please share the above information with eligible start-up founders to ensure that the deserving candidates can benefit from the government scheme." *regards,* *dr. swati joshi, * *senior executive officer (seo), * *charusat innovative ventures foundation (civf), **209, iiim,* *charotar university of science and technology (charusat) * *changa - 388 421 * *gujarat - india * *contact no.: +91- 7383491911* *e-mail: seo@civf.co.in < --

depstar_cse_call for nominations: become a gender champion @ charusat dear students, we are excited to announce an opportunity for you to *become a gender champion at our institution. *gender champions play a crucial role in promoting gender equality, raising awareness, and fostering a respectful and inclusive environment within our campus community. as a gender champion, you will have the opportunity to: - engage with peers and faculty on issues related to gender equality. - organize awareness programs and activities to promote gender equity. - be a voice for creating an inclusive environment for all students, regardless of gender. *eligibility criteria:* - students above 16 years of age and currently enrolled in the institution. - a strong commitment to promoting gender equality. - leadership qualities, excellent communication skills, and a passion for advocacy. if you are interested in taking on this role and making a positive impact, we encourage you to nominate yourself by filling out the application form *[attached to this email].* the deadline for nominations is september 21, 2024. let's work together to create a campus where everyone feels valued and respected! *a letter from ugc is attached for your ready reference. * best

steps to access wifi internet on laptop and computer labs dear new students... to access wifi internet, please follow under mentioned steps: 1:- open url (open url within campus only) 2:- login with your egovernance id and password 3:- top left cornet (3 horizontal bar) go to settings 4:- select "internet wifi password change" 5:- you may set a strong password for your internet access. with the help of your student id and wi-fi password, you can access the internet from permitted computer labs and on your laptop. (wifi on mobile is restricted) to access wifi from laptop, connect to either charusat wifi or wincell ssid with password "charusat" you may also get a better idea with the attached video. *best regards* *ritesh bhatt *head datacenter, win-cell charotar university of science & technology (charusat) accredited *grade 'a+'* by naac at. changa 388 421, ta. petlad, dist. anand o: +912697-265106 / 07 --

new options to manage personalization on google play hello 23dcs023, in the coming weeks, google play will launch new personalization options that give you more seamless control of your personalization preferences and allow you to better manage your data in play. personalization provides a richer experience in the play store, helping you discover exciting games, useful apps, relevant offers and much more, all of which is tailored to you. learn more about personalizing your google play store experience < once available, these new features - alongside existing play personalization controls - will be easily accessible by visiting personalization in play from the google play store menu. this new destination will be a one-stop-shop for tailoring your personalization preferences in play, giving you a more powerful way to: â€¢ manage all of your personalization options on google play and easily view activity and access personalization controls â€¢ choose which apps, books or other library items are used to personalize your google play experience. with one click you will be able to exclude use of play data associated with that app for personalization in play. some examples of data that would be excluded for that app would include when you install or uninstall it, purchases that you make in it and your app activity. learn more about new personalization options < with these enhanced controls you can ensure that you have a better play experience that is personalized to you and continues to respect your privacy preferences. should you have any questions please visit our help center < or get in touch < thank you for using google play! (c) 2024 google llc, 1600 amphitheatre parkway, mountain view, ca 94043, usa you have received this mandatory email service announcement to update you about important changes to your play product or account. please do not reply to this email, as we are unable to respond from this email address. if you need support, please visit the google play help center <

fwd: one day workshop on "hands-on iot: building smart devices with code and hardware" register if you have not yet recieved the mail. selection will be first come basis. dear students, we are delighted to inform you that depstar is organising a one-day workshop titled *"hands-on iot: building smart devices with code and hardware."* this workshop is focused on the *coding and hardware configuration aspects of iot devices*, making it highly beneficial for students who are currently working on projects in the field of iot or those interested in pursuing work in this area. the workshop will be entirely practical, guiding participants on how to connect and code for various hardware devices. in addition, *there will be a discussion session at the end, where students working on iot projects can interact with the speaker, ask questions, and seek guidance regarding their ongoing work projects [students may bring their ongoing project for the discussion].* *coverage of the workshop but not limited:* 1. arduino with coding exposure 2. raspberry pi with coding exposure 3. nodemcu with coding exposure 4. various sensors and its connection along with coding for microcontrollers. *expert name: dr. jignesh patoliya (sr. engineer in einfochips ltd, ahmedabad)* we look forward to your participation. *date: 21 september, 2024* *time:9:30 to 4:00 [1 hour lunch break 12:00 to 1:00]* *venue: communicated to registered students only through mail. [limited seats 50 students only]* *click here for registration:* -- *nilesh kumar dubey**(phd)* assistant professor, computer science and engineering, institutional coordinator of *iqac*, *csic,* *uiic, ipr* devang patel institute of advanced technology & research changa-388421, gujarat, india. --

ulsc logo competition! dear students, we are excited to announce the digital logo making competition for the students of charusat. this is a unique opportunity to showcase your creativity and design skills while contributing to an important aspect of our student governance body. *competition details:* *theme : *design a logo that represents the values, vision, and mission of the university level central students council(ulsc). *eligibility : *open to all students of charusat. *submission format :* logo designs must be created digitally and submitted in .png or .jpeg format (high resolution). *submission deadline : 22th september, 2024* - *vision: - *to build an inclusive student community that fosters academic excellence, cultural enrichment, leadership, and holistic development. - *values: - *we value inclusivity, collaboration, and excellence in all endeavors. leadership, integrity, innovation, and student well-being are at the core of our actions. - mission: - our mission is to provide opportunities for students to grow academically, culturally, and personally, promote teamwork and leadership, and advocate for student needs to create a supportive university environment. *google form: * submit your entries here further details have been shared in the document attached below. we look forward to seeing your creative submissions! best

expert session on "untabooing menstruation and sanitary pads" on 16.09.2024 dear all, the women development cell is organizing an expert session on â€œ untabooing menstruation and sanitary pads ğŸ©¸â€ on september 16, 2024. the session is designed for university girl students, teaching and non-teaching females to break the taboo around menstruation and promote better menstrual hygiene practices. this initiative aims to create a safe and open environment for discussing menstrual health, combat societal taboos, and equip students with knowledge and resources for better hygiene practices. by fostering this understanding, i hope to encourage positive attitudes toward menstrual health, which is crucial for young women's overall well-being and empowerment. registration link: all the female students and faculty members are hereby requested to kindly take the opportunity and register. thank you.

fwd: participate students for nss day competitions â€“ september 16, 2024 dear all, we are thrilled to announce that charusat will be participating in the upcoming national service scheme day (nss day) celebrations hosted by gujarat university, ahmedabad. the event will take place from september, 22nd to 24th, 2024, with the main activities at the senate hall of gujarat university before that charusat organize competitions at university level. *key details:* - *university event date:* september 16, 2024. - *location:* nss unit, rpcp building top floor, charusat university. - *state-level event dates:* september 22-23-24, 2024 to prepare for this, we will be organizing several university-level competitions. the winners will represent charusat at the state-level event. below are the details and guidelines for each competition: *competitions:* 1. *essay competition* - *topics:* - one nation one election - importance of renewable energy source - national development through entrepreneurship - srimad bhagavad gita â€“ the precious essence of life-making - present time imperative value education - clean cyber india - *rules:* - duration: 1 hour - essays must be written on-site. 2. *oratorical competition* - *topics:* - ai â€“ blessing or curse? - duty of youth for india of 2047 - fourth pillar of democracy â€“ media - character building to nation building - cyber security â€“ challenge of the digital age - *rules:* - duration: 7 minutes per speech - warning bell after 5 minutes - speeches can be delivered in gujarati or hindi or english - prepare in advance, but no notes or prompts during the presentation. 3. *instrument music competition* - *rules:* - duration: 4 minutes per performance - participants must provide their own instruments - ensure your performance fits within the time limit. 4. *rangoli competition* - *themes:* - sustainable future - unity in diversity - national heroes - education and empowerment - *rules:* - rangoli must adhere to one of the specified themes - judging based on creativity and theme adherence. *important notes:* - all competitions will be judged by expert faculty members. - specific event venue details and event coordinators' contact information will be communicated soon. - completing the participation form is mandatory for attendance. the deadline for submitting the form is *september 14, 2024*. - mobile phones are strictly not allowed during the competition. - charusat id cards must be worn at all times. for any queries or further information, please contact: - *event coordinator:* mr. kishan patel, nss program coordinator - *student coordinator:* dhruv rupapara (nss ec department) and team (6353933976) please complete the participation form via the following link: prepare well and adhere to the competition rules. we look forward to your enthusiastic participation! best of luck! *best regards,* *dr. atul patel* *registrar* accredited grade â€œa+â€ by naac *p.s.* nss program officers, faculty members and other staff members please encourage students to take advantage of this opportunity. class coordinators and counsellors, kindly share this information with students via whatsapp groups and motivate them to participate. --

one day workshop on "hands-on iot: building smart devices with code and hardware" dear students, we are delighted to inform you that depstar is organising a one-day workshop titled *"hands-on iot: building smart devices with code and hardware."* this workshop is focused on the *coding and hardware configuration aspects of iot devices*, making it highly beneficial for students who are currently working on projects in the field of iot or those interested in pursuing work in this area. the workshop will be entirely practical, guiding participants on how to connect and code for various hardware devices. in addition, *there will be a discussion session at the end, where students working on iot projects can interact with the speaker, ask questions, and seek guidance regarding their ongoing work projects [students may bring their ongoing project for the discussion].* *coverage of the workshop but not limited:* 1. arduino with coding exposure 2. raspberry pi with coding exposure 3. nodemcu with coding exposure 4. various sensors and its connection along with coding for microcontrollers. *expert name: dr. jignesh patoliya (sr. engineer in einfochips ltd, ahmedabad)* we look forward to your participation. *date: 21 september, 2024* *time:9:30 to 4:00 [1 hour lunch break 12:00 to 1:00]* *venue: communicated to registered students only through mail. [limited seats 50 students only]* *click here for registration:* -- *nilesh kumar dubey**(phd)* assistant professor, computer science and engineering, institutional coordinator of *iqac*, *csic,* *uiic, ipr* devang patel institute of advanced technology & research changa-388421, gujarat, india. --

cadets from charusat university, manthan patel have been selected for all india thal sainik camp 2024 jai hind! respected all, greetings from ncc unit ! cadets from charusat university, manthan patel have been selected for all india thal sainik camp 2024 which is one of the prestigious camps of ncc (national cadet corps) and will participate in the training and competitions at delhi from 02th september to 13th september, 2024 (national level) it gives us immense pleasure to announce that they have performed best in the tough selection process at different stages. cadets from all over gujarat participated in this competition which includes different military subject tests. these cadet have performed well and have secured the first rank in subjects firing. they've been through various phases of the selection process i.e. inter battalion camp where competition between 147 cadets of the different battalion took place; after that the competition among selected cadets took place and 3 among them were selected for inter group competition which took place between cadets of different groups of gujrat e.g. vallabh vidhyanagar, ahmedabad, rajkot, jamnagar and baroda. the selection in the inter group level competition was followed by final selection test for all the selected cadets and again they made us proud by securing 1st rank in the respective events to represent gujarat directorate at delhi to have a tough faceoff with the cadets of 17 directorates from all over india. cadet is a student of bachelor of electronics & communication technology, cspit at charusat. it is a proud moment for the entire 2 guj ctc ncc v v nagar group and charusat family. it can be considered as the best achievement by our students as the cadet from charusat are among the 88 selected cadets out of 800. along with the education, charusat university encourages students to serve the nation practicing principles of developing character, comradeship, discipline, and a secular outlook, the spirit of adventure and ideals of selfless service amongst young citizens. charusat ncc is grateful to provost dr. r v upadhyay and registrar dr. atul patel for their constant guidance and support. we are thankful to dean, dr.vijay chaudhary, principal dr.trushit upadhyaya & hod dr.upesh patel for facilitating the process. also the oc, lt. col rahul bhoraskar and other pi staff of 2ctc, ncc have been continuously supporting the cadet of our university. congratulations to the cadets for achieving wonders and successfully adding more feathers to the cap of charusat university. cto- charusat ncc unit -- assistant director of physical education and sports charusat physical education and sports section (a constituent of charusat) *accredited with "grade a+" by naac, goi* *accredited with centre of excellence by gog* landline no: 02697-265036 mobile : 95582 95583 -- 97142 96999 --

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ *mailer to students:* dear students, we are pleased to inform you that applications are now open for the *reliance foundation undergraduate scholarships* and* reliance foundation postgraduate scholarships.* *reliance foundation undergraduate scholarships:* during the 2024-25 academic cycle, the *reliance foundation* *undergraduate scholarships* will invite first-year undergraduate students enrolled *in any stream of their choice* in any institute from across the country who fulfil the scholarshipâ€™s academic and household income criteria to apply, enabling them to continue their studies without the financial burden, and setting them up for future success. reliance foundation will provide 5000 undergraduate scholarships (up to rs. 2 lakhs each over the duration of the degree). the scholarships will seek to empower meritorious students from across india with a secondary education and enhanced life opportunities. students with a household income of under rs.15 lakh who are enrolled in a regular full-time undergraduate degree programme pursuing *any subject stream* can apply. the scholarship aims to encourage applications by girls and specially-abled students. while the scholarships main focus is to provide financial support for meritorious students enrolled in any institute across india, its value will go beyond financial, with students automatically gaining networking opportunities through a strong alumni network that will create long-term impact on the lives and career trajectories of the scholars. please note: only first-year students who are studying any regular full-time undergraduate degree programme are eligible to apply. students availing other scholarships are also *eligible to apply* for the reliance foundation undergraduate scholarship. *reliance foundation postgraduate scholarships* the *reliance foundation postgraduate scholarships* aim to enable and propel indiaâ€™s future leaders who can think big, think green, think digital for the benefit of society. through the *reliance foundation postgraduate scholarships*, reliance foundation will provide 100 postgraduate scholarships (up to rs. 6 lakhs each over the duration of the degree) in *select future-ready courses in engineering, technology, energy and life-sciences *(full list of eligible programmes is available on our website)*. *the scholarships will be *awarded purely on the basis of merit *and hence we welcome students from* all socio-economic backgrounds *to apply for the scholarship*. *the scholarship aims to encourage applications by girls and specially-abled students. please note: only first-year students who are studying in regular full-time postgraduate degree programme are eligible to apply. *to find out more and to apply, visit our website: * * < *.* *applications are now open, and will close on the tata imagination challenge - india's largest idea competition dear students, please go through the trailing mail and register for the challenge if interested. after registration, please send the following details to me : student id student name contact no counsellor name class coordinator name ______________________________________________________________________ greetings! we are delighted to introduce the *tata imagination challenge*, india's largest idea competition organized by the tata group. this exciting platform empowers undergraduate and postgraduate students across all disciplines and years of study to share their innovative ideas for shaping a better tomorrow. last year, the challenge attracted a phenomenal response with over 2.63 lakh students participating from 10,000+ campuses across 1,200+ indian cities and towns. *why participate?* 1. *exciting prizes*: the competition offers attractive cash prizes (inr 2 lakh each for 10 winners) and tata brand vouchers. 2. *career opportunities*: winners have the chance to secure interviews for the prestigious tata administrative services (tas) program, launching a bright future with the tata group. 3. *learn from leaders*: finalists and winners receive mentorship from renowned tata leaders, gaining invaluable insights into the corporate world. *competition format:* Â· *round 1 | online quiz*: this round assesses students' knowledge of the tata universe, quantitative analysis, and logical thinking skills. Â· *round 2 | gamified assessments*: this engaging round involves a series of game-based challenges to further evaluate students' potential. Â· *round 3 | video pitch*: shortlisted candidates submit a compelling video pitch showcasing their ideas for change. Â· *final round | live pitching*: the top 50 finalists present their ideas directly to senior tata leaders in mumbai. we kindly request your esteemed institution's support in spreading awareness about this exciting opportunity among your students. registration is now open and will close by 9 september 2024. students can register for the tata imagination challenge by clicking this link: for any further inquiries, please direct students to contact tataimaginationchallenge@tata.com. looking forward to your institution's active participation in this prestigious event. fwd: announcement: smart india hackathon (sih) 2024 - call for participation *dear students,* i hope this message finds you well. we are thrilled to announce that the *smart india hackathon (sih) 2024* is fast approaching, offering a remarkable platform for students to showcase their innovative problem-solving skills and collaborate with peers across various domains. *steps to participate:* 1. *team formation:* - assemble a team of 6 students who share your interest in a specific domain or area of study. - all team members must be from the same college; no inter-college teams are allowed. - it is mandatory to include at least one female member in each team. - for the software edition, programming skills are crucial. for the hardware edition, multidisciplinary teams are encouraged. 2. *choose a problem statement:* - select a relevant problem statement from the sih website that aligns with your team's expertise and interests. - *link* : 3. *registration and idea submission:* - *student registration:* students cannot register directly; the collegeâ€™s spoc (single point of contact) handles registrations. only students selected in the internal hackathon can be registered for sih 2024. - the college spoc will nominate the top 30 teams (25 shortlisted and 5 waitlisted) based on the results of the internal hackathon. - *idea submission:* - idea submission will begin in august 2024, with a limit of 500 ideas per problem statement (ps). once the limit is reached, submissions for that ps will close. - teams can submit ideas for up to 2 problem statements. the nominated team leader will receive login credentials to complete the idea submission process. - the last date for team nomination and idea submission by the college spoc and team leader on the sih portal is *12th september 2024.* - *link : * *general guidelines:* - the grand finale of sih 2024 will be held offline at various nodal centers across india in the 2nd/3rd week of november 2024. - teams selected for the final hackathon will need to travel to the assigned nodal center, which could be anywhere in india. - shortlisted teams are eligible for sleeper class non-ac fare reimbursement, payable at the nodal center upon submitting train tickets and forms. - the nodal centers will arrange accommodation for teams during the grand finale. - college photo id and a consent letter copy are mandatory for participating in the finale. for those interested in participating but unable to form a team, we will provide further guidance on how to connect with other participants. we eagerly look forward to your innovative ideas and solutions that will make a significant impact in the upcoming sih 2024.

fwd: floodai hackathon: innovate solutions for urban flooding using ai dear friends, we are excited to invite you to participate in the *floodai hackathon 2024*, a unique opportunity to contribute to solving one of the most pressing global challengesâ€”*urban flooding*. this hackathon, organized by iiec, iit gandhinagar, in partnership with the interdisciplinary program in climate studies at iit bombay, aims to leverage the transformative power of artificial intelligence to develop innovative solutions for managing and mitigating urban floods. *event details:* dates: *august 24-25, 2024* venue: iiec, iit gandhinagar *why participate?* urban flooding increasingly disrupts daily life and damages infrastructure, particularly in rapidly urbanizing indian cities where inadequate drainage systems exacerbate the problem. with climate change intensifying these challenges, scalable and effective solutions are urgently needed. the floodai hackathon offers you a platform to collaborate with experts, analyze real-world data from indian cities, and create physics-ai-driven solutions that can make a significant impact. this is your chance to use your skills to tackle an urgent issue, and contribute to sustainable and adaptive strategies for urban flood management. *what to expect:* *data-driven challenges:* you will be provided with rich datasets from actual indian cities to analyze and derive insights for your solutions. *team collaboration:* teams of four participants will be formed from the pool of registered individuals, ensuring a diverse mix of skills and perspectives in each group. *expert guidance:* you will have the opportunity to engage with experts in ai and urban planning, helping to refine your ideas and approaches. *key dates:* - application window: *august 5-15, 2024* - notification of shortlisted participants: *august 17, 2024* - team formation: *august 19, 2024* - concept notes submission by teams: *august 21, 2024* - hackathon and pitching event: *august 24-25, 2024* *the top three teams will be awarded cash prizes worth rs. 2 lakhs*, and standout projects will have the opportunity to be further developed and incubated at iiec, iit gandhinagar. ready to make a difference? don't miss this chance to be at the forefront of creating innovative solutions for urban flooding. *register now < to secure your spot and take part in shaping the future of resilient urban infrastructure. we look forward to seeing you at the floodai hackathon! best regards, team iiec iit gandhinagar -- charotar university of science & technology accredited grade a+ by naac accorded with centre of excellence by govt. of gujarat web: -- *prof. ashwin makwana (ph d), * head, *career development and placement cell (cdpc)*, charusat *and* *associate professor,* u & p u patel *department of computer engineering,*faculty of technology & engineering(cspit), charotar university of science & technology, at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. 02697-265213/265123, (m)9408151969 *charusat accredited with 'a+' by naac - govt. of india* -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_ce" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_ce+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < .

invitation to participate the flaunch emerging tech internship on genai and xr dear all, please go through the below mail and register for the same: greetings from 1m1b! we are pleased to introduce a new virtual internship in generative ai and xr technology, organized by flaunch pvt. ltd. in collaboration with aicte and 1m1b. this program offers students a chance to gain practical skills, earn certifications and academic credit, and qualify for a stipend through their capstone projects. the internship is designed to help students develop essential skills in emerging technologies, preparing them for future careers. by partnering with your esteemed institution, we aim to offer your students a valuable opportunity to engage in hands-on learning and showcase their abilities. program highlights: - duration: 6 weeks (virtual) - structure: - level 1: a 4-week course featuring self-paced learning, weekly mentoring, and project assignments. successful participants will receive academic credit and an aicte internship certificate. - level 2: the top 100 projects from level 1 will advance to a capstone phase, with opportunities for a stipend and professional exposure. we believe this internship will greatly benefit your students, helping them prepare for the jobs of tomorrow. for more details, please see the attached orientation poster or visit the aicte national internship portal. the orientation webinar is scheduled for august 21, 2024, at 5 pm. students can apply directly through the aicte national internship portal at < we look forward to your institution's participation. *----------------------------* *thanks & regards,ashwin makwana/sujal dadhaniya* *tpo - **career development and placement cell (cdpc)*, *charotar university of science & technology (charusat) * at: changa, ta:petlad, dist:anand, gujarat. (t) 02697-265213, 265214 (m) 9662255116 e: tpo@charusat.ac.in / tnp@charusat.ac.in accredited grade a+ by naac "helping hand to shape a career to achieve dreams" --

fwd: last date for submissions extended to 17th august, 2024 29th international advanced computing and communications conference 18th â€“ 20th december 2024 - iiit bangalore, electronics city, bangalore call for papers adcom 2024: responsible ai and beyond *general chair: prof. **chandrashekar ramanathan* < (dean faculty - iiitb) | technical program chairs: prof. srinath srinivasa (dean r&d -iiitb) and dr. saragur m. srinidhi (accs)* the* advanced computing and communications society* (accs) in association *with the international institute of information technology bangalore* announces the 29th annual *international conference on advanced computing and communications* (adcom 2024 at bangalore during 18th - 20th december 2024. adcom, the flagship systems conference of the accs, is a major annual international meeting that draws leading scientists and researchers in computational and communications engineering from across industry and academia. adcom highlights the growing importance of large-scale systems engineering and provides the platform to share, discuss and witness leading edge research and trends. adcom 2024 seeks to share insights for a â€˜responsible aiâ€™ framework to develop artificial intelligence safely and ethically based on the five core principles of fairness, transparency, accountability, privacy and safety. sustainable, reliable, effective, and human-centered ai systems require responsible ai principles and perspectives not only from technological but also from ethical, legal, and socio-economic domains. this edition of adcom will also explore as a sub theme the democratization of access to ai with a need for trust, risk and security management (trism) to enhance positive performance and societal gains that ai enables. adcom 2024 calls for original, high impact research papers on responsible ai framework and related technologies while seeking novel contributions that help define trust and security management in large ai systems, which include, but not limited to: - legal, ethical, and regulatory frameworks for responsible ai - fairness, accountability, and transparency in ai - ai unlearning and explainability - mlops, devops, and aiops for responsible ai and data science systems - algorithmic bias and fairness in search and recommendation - bias mitigation and fairness-aware machine learning - software verification and validation for responsible ai and data science systems - approaches for ensuring calibrated trust in ai - actionable metrics that can be measured and monitored for ai ethics - trust, security, privacy, policy management - agent based trust management - trustworthy and responsible autonomy - authorization, authentication and identity management - tooling for modelops, proactive data protection, ai-specific security, model monitoring - monitoring for data drift, model drift, and/or unintended outcomes - risk controls for inputs and outputs to third-party models and applications. *all accepted papers of adcom 2024 will be published in the ccis series of springer. ccis is abstracted/indexed in dblp, google scholar, ei-compendex, mathematical reviews, scimago and scopus. * *important dates:* full technical papers sought out by *17 august 2024* acceptance communicated by *15 oct* *2024* final print ready papers due by *25 nov 2024* submissions only through easychair â€“ * < visit us at * < for detailed information on the conference *for more information on the conference:* email us at *adcom2024@accsindia.org <adcom2024@accsindia.org>* or call us at +91 80 2630 7142 or +91 76249 57142 *write to us at:* *secretary, adcom 2024 advanced computing & communication society gate #2, c. v. raman avenue* *indian institute of science, bangalore 560012, india* having trouble viewing this cfp message? click here to read it on our website. < unsubscribe here < Â© advanced computing and communications society -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < . --

anyone can pick up devops - part 5 - docker release-5 or how we make our soup portable for customer consumption! kodekloud-logo-new ( ) â€œa soup like this is not the work of one man. it is the result of a constantly refined tradition. there are nearly a thousand years of history in this soup.â€ - willa cather this is the fifth email on devops processes, known as devops 101 or the software soup. it looked like this when we last talked about it: - plan-1 ( ) the soup recipe - create (code-2) ( ) and assemble the ingredients for the soup as well as the tools. - build-3 ( ) or cook the soup - test-4 ( ) the soup for quality - release-5 the soup to the front-end shop to prep for presentation - deploy-6 the soup into bowls for consumption by the customer - operate-7 the front-end shop so that soup can flow to the customer - monitoring-8 the customer experience of the soup by checking temp, etc, and maintaining a good experience for the customer (replace â€œsoupâ€ with â€œsoftwareâ€ if you are wondering what this has to do with information technology) - the release process explained after delving into git, jenkins, and linux for creating, building, and testing, we now turn to the release-5 stage. this isn't the entirety of coding, building, and testing, but it's a prevalent path. release-5 focuses on packaging software for deployment, akin to preparing our soup for serving. - the rise of docker & containerization in 2014, docker revolutionized packaging standards. it allows any application to be packaged into a 'container image'. this image, housing your software, is stored in a shared location and can be replicated as a 'running container'. think of it as digitally replicating our soup for multiple servings. when the recipe changes, a new version is stored in this shared location. docker, the pioneer of this container format, is the most recognized brand in the container world. - mastering docker understanding docker is pivotal for any devops engineer in the 2020s. it's the key to grasping containerization across platforms. if docker is unfamiliar territory, invest 4 hours in docker for the absolute beginner. ( ) it's a game-changer. stay tuned for deploy-6: serving our containerized application to the customer. kode kloud ( ) learning path ( ) | kodekloud engineer ( ) | playgrounds ( ) | pricing ( ) facebook ( ) linkedin ( ) x ( ) instagram ( ) youtube ( ) unsubscribe ( ) or manage preferences ( ) . kodekloud (brand owned by zaurac technologies pte. ltd.) 14 robinson road, #08-01a far east finance building, singapore, central singapore, 048545 singapore view in browser ( )

anyone can pick up devops - part 4 - linux/shell scripting test-4 or how we make sure our software soup is tasty and delicious! kodekloud-logo-new ( ) â€œnow, recreate the soup.â€ - ian holm as chef skinner in ratatouille this is the fourth email on devops processes, known as devops 101 or the software soup. it looked like this when we last talked about it: - plan-1 ( ) the soup recipe - create (code-2) ( ) and assemble the ingredients for the soup and the tools. - build-3 ( ) or cook the soup - test-4 the soup for quality - release-5 the soup to the front-end shop to prep for presentation - deploy-6 the soup into bowls for consumption by the customer - operate-7 the front-end shop so that soup can flow to the customer - monitoring-8 the customer experience of the soup by checking temp, etc., and maintaining a good experience for the customer (replace â€œsoupâ€ with â€œsoftwareâ€ if you are wondering what this has to do with information technology) let's continue our journey through software and soup! - testing: quality assurance for software to ensure our software meets both our expectations and the customer's, we use testing. this ranges from basic checks (is the software functional?) to extensive evaluations (does it consistently perform under various conditions?). - devops testing tools in devops, there's a plethora of testing tools available. some are specific to programming languages, while others are more universal. - the power of shell scripting one invaluable tool in devops is shell scripting. if you've encountered screens that look like command prompts or terminals, you've interacted with a shell. these shells, backed by processes like bash or zsh, allow commands that can run tests, interact with platforms like aws, or manage docker containers. or like this? 4. mastering linux for effective shell scripting shell scripting is versatile and not tied to a specific programming language. however, proficiency in linux is crucial to harness its full potential. linux is the backbone of many devices, from streaming devices to smartphones. unfamiliar with linux? dive into our linux challenges course. if you're already linux-savvy, jump into our shell scripting for beginners ( ) course. both courses are around 3 hours and packed with hands-on labs, essential for any devops professional. next time: release-5 or how to make our soup portable for consumption!!! kode kloud ( ) learning path ( ) | kodekloud engineer ( ) | playgrounds ( ) | pricing ( ) facebook ( ) linkedin ( ) x ( ) instagram ( ) youtube ( ) unsubscribe ( ) or manage preferences ( ) . kodekloud (brand owned by zaurac technologies pte. ltd.) 14 robinson road, #08-01a far east finance building, singapore, central singapore, 048545 singapore view in browser ( )

fwd: opportunity to create lasting impact through #unnatbharatabhiyan seg portal! dear charusat family members, *namaskar !* as we reflect on the last academic year, we are proud of the several projects we have submitted and the encouraging results we have received. now, we have an exciting opportunity to make a lasting impact through the #unnatbharatabhiyan seg portal! [image: image.png] we invite our brilliant faculty and students to submit project proposals that can drive positive change and create a meaningful impact on our communities. the window of opportunity is wide open, and we encourage everyone to seize this chance. *(details regarding all subject expert groups (seg) are attached to this email.)* *how to submit proposals:* principal investigators (pis), connect with dr. dilip gosai, head of credp, and submit your proposals through the uba charusat login link: uba charusat login < navigate to the "apply for seg proposal" tab on the left side of your dashboard/screen, and select the seg of your interest to submit your proposal. *tentative submission window opening*: last week of august 2024 *proposal categories:* 1. *technology development:* - solution-oriented proposals with developed lab technologies ready for field/rural implementation. - *funding cap:* â‚¹1,00,000 - ensure solutions are sustainable, innovative, implementable, and scalable. 2. *technology customization:* - proposals for altering/modifying existing market technologies to benefit rural populations. - *funding cap:* â‚¹50,000 - specify a time target for specific outputs and ensure project sustainability. *important notes:* - long-term research projects, fellowships, ph.d. programs, lab/center setups, exhibitions, workshops, and capital/construction are not covered. - uba seg focuses on financial support for technical interventions in uba-connected villages, not for r&d. *spread the word!* let's spread the word in our faculty and student networks and motivate everyone to submit their proposals. together, we can drive positive change and make a lasting impact on the communities we serve, moving closer to making *viksit bharat 2047* a reality! anyone can pick up devops - part 3 - jenkins build-3 or how we bring the ingredients together! kodekloud-logo-new ( ) â€œi'll curse myself forever. this nasty soup we're in is largely of my own brewing.â€ - adam west as batman in batman the tv show (1966) this is the third email on devops processes known as devops 101 or the software soup. it looked like this when we last talked about it: - plan-1 ( ) the soup recipe - create (code-2) ( ) and assemble the ingredients for the soup as well as the tools - build-3 or cook the soup - test-4 the soup for quality - release-5 the soup to the front end shop to prep for presentation - deploy-6 the soup into bowls for consumption by the customer - operate-7 the front-end shop so that soup can flow to the customer - monitoring-8 the customer experience of the soup by checking temp, etc, and maintaining a good experience for the customer replace â€œsoupâ€ with â€œsoftwareâ€ if you are wondering what this has to do with information technology. now, this chapter of our journey takes into the concept of bringing all our ingredients together. in plan-1 ( ) , we figured out the software soup we wanted to make and planned for it. in code-2 ( ) , we created the software (code) feature by feature and put it into a git repository so we could bring all the code by the various developers together. our soup analogy focused on bringing all the ingredients together to the prepping station. in build-3, we have to â€œcookâ€ or build our software soup. this is where the soup is made consumable. in software, we refer to this as building the software or packaging it for release and deployment. - building software & devops building software varies by programming language. for instance, java uses maven and gradle, while c uses make. - the universal build tool challenge we need a universal tool that can manage various language-specific build tools, much like a kitchen that can handle different cooking methods. - language-specific tools just as different dishes require unique pots and pans, programming languages like java, python, ruby, and rust have their distinct tools. - the ideal solution: a centralized cooking hub imagine a stove that can accommodate various cooking implements. this is what we need for diverse programming languages. - enter the build server a build server uses the native tools of a programming language to construct software. for java, it would utilize maven. - the need to know build tools & languages: it's essential to understand specific build tools and their corresponding programming languages. build servers, like stoves, adapt by using the right tool for the task. - jenkins: the leading ci/cd server jenkins, a renowned build server, is also a ci/cd (continuous integration and continuous delivery) server. familiarity with jenkins provides insight into most build servers. - the devops engineer's toolkit: mastering build servers to excel as a devops engineer, understanding build servers is crucial. if you're unfamiliar with them, spend 3 hours on kodekloud's jenkins course ( ) for hands-on learning. next upâ€¦.. test-4 or how do we make sure the soup is tasty and delicious? kode kloud ( ) learning path ( ) | kodekloud engineer ( ) | playgrounds ( ) | pricing ( ) facebook ( ) linkedin ( ) x ( ) instagram ( ) youtube ( ) unsubscribe ( ) or manage preferences ( ) . kodekloud (brand owned by zaurac technologies pte. ltd.) 14 robinson road, #08-01a far east finance building, singapore, central singapore, 048545 singapore view in browser ( )

devops ci/cd general terms and conditions 1. terms of engagement: a. the positions / requirements are purely on contract basis on consolidated emoluments, initially for a period upto 3 years or completion of the project, whichever is earlier. the selected candidates may be assigned to another project based on organizational requirement. b. contract may be considered for extension for a further period based on performance of the employee & requirement and duration of project. c. the candidates engaged under this shall be on contract and shall not derive any right or claim to have a regular post/ appointment in c-dac. d. c-dac is involved in projects at various location across the india, hence a selected candidate may be deputed or transferred from one project to another as per organizational requirement at any project location across india. i. the candidate selected shall be posted first in india and shall be paid consolidated salary as notified herewith. ii. on deputation to overseas location, the candidate shall be paid a higher salary as offered. iii. apart from monthly salary, cdac shall arrange visa/ work permit and provide to & fro economy class air tickets for deputation & repatriation. in addition to salary fully furnished accommodation will be arranged by cdac for the period of deputation. iv. any / all other expenditure will have to be borne by the candidate from his own sources. 2. qualification: a. for all the posts indicated, the candidates should have qualified from aicte/ugc approved college/institute or recognized university. b. in case any university/institution or college is following an evaluation system of cgpa/dgpa/ogpa or letter grade, wherever applicable, it is mandatory for the candidate to submit proof of percentage (%) issued by university/institution/college and awarded class along with the degree certificate. c. candidates in the last semester, who would complete the course before the appointment can also apply. however, if selected, the joining shall be after passing such examination with required min. score only. 3. experience: a. candidate possessing relevant post qualification experience, if sought for, only needs to apply. b. academy/teaching/research work, experience in non-profit organization, internship/project work placements are part of academic curriculum and will not be considered as experience, unless specified. c. candidate should possess experience certificates/documents issued by the previous and present employer clearly indicating period of employment, salary drawn and post held. d. the decision of c-dac with respect to experience will be final. work experience indicated without supporting documents will not be considered and is liable to be rejected/cancelled without any prior intimation. e. the pay bracket provided against each position is for the starting pay for the min. experience required for the said post. candidates with higher experience commensurate with the experience bracket given will be offered additional increments as per c-dac policy. f. c-dac internal candidates need to complete at least 2 yearsâ€™ service in c-dac as on date of notification, for applying to positions notified 4. age limit and relaxation: a. upper age limit will be as specified against each post b. applicants belonging to reserved category (sc/st/obc) / physically challenged/ex-servicemen would be eligible for relaxations according to the â€˜government of indiaâ€™ norms. c. government employees on payscale will be eligible for relaxation in age by 5 years including other age relaxations as applicable. d. the cut-off date for ascertaining the age and experience will be last date of submission of application. e. candidates seeking age relaxation need to submit a copy of caste certificate when called for document verification. f. sslc/ssc/isc mark sheet/ certificate and any other valid document will be considered as proof of date of birth. g. the economically weaker sectionâ€™s certificate should be strictly in the format prescribed by dopt. the format is available on the website < h. the application of the candidates not meeting the prescribed age criteria will be reject/cancelled without any prior intimation. i. candidates belonging to obc category (non creamy layer) should produce the certificate issued in prescribed format. 5. selection procedure: a. candidate should meet the eligibility criteria as specified in the advertisement. b. the qualification and experience prescribed, are the minimum requirements and possession of the same does not automatically make the candidates entitled to be called for written test and / or selection processes. c. there will be an initial screening based on the academic records and other parameters declared in the on-line application and only screened-in candidates will be considered for further selection process. d. the management reserves the right to increase/alter the minimum eligibility criteria/cut off limits, in the event of the number of applicants are more, for any post(s), at its discretion. candidates will be selected on the basis of their academic credentials, experience profile, written test marks (if any), performance in the interview and such other selection processes/parameters, as adopted and deemed fit by management. e. mere application and fulfilment of the mentioned qualifications etc., does not entitle a candidate to be called for written/skill test/ interview. c-dac may restrict the number of candidates to be called to participate in interview/selection process to a reasonable limit, on the basis of qualifications and experience higher than that of the minimum prescribed in the advertisement. the candidates should, therefore, furnish all the qualifications and experience possessed in the relevant field, over and above the minimum qualifications prescribed. f. the selection process shall be carried out by the respective c-dac centre based on its requirements and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further process. g. all information submitted in the application will be verified with the original documents at the time of document verification or at any stage of the recruitment process. if any documents/information provided by the candidate is found to be false or incorrect or non-conformity with the eligibility criteria, then his/her candidature is liable to be rejected/cancelled at any stage of the recruitment and selection process without any prior intimation. h. the candidature is also liable for rejection at any stage if c-dac comes across any evidence/knowledge that the qualification, experience and any other particulars indicated in the application/other forms/formats are not recognized/false misleading and/or amounts to suppression of information/particulars which should have been brought to the notice of c-dac. 6. application fees: no application fee is charged by c-dac for applying to this advertisement. 7. how to apply: a. before filling the online application form, candidates should read general terms and conditions carefully. b. candidate should read all the eligibility parameters and ensure that he/she is eligible for the post before starting to apply online. c. candidate should have a valid email id and mobile no. which should remain valid & active till the completion of selection process. d. while applying online candidates can click on the â€˜applyâ€™ button provided against each position for which he/she wish to apply. e. the candidate needs to log in with mobile no. and then fill in the otp received on the said mobile no. f. on filling the correct otp, the applicant will be directed to fill in the application form. in case you have filled in an application in our previous advertisement, the applicant will receive a prefilled editable application. g. candidates shall check the prefilled application and submit it, after adding additional details by clicking on â€˜submitâ€™ button. h. candidates should scan their photograph in .jpg format (not more than 400 kb) and keep it ready before starting to apply online for uploading. i. candidate should upload their resume in pdf format (not more than 500 kb) j. a unique application number will be generated by the system, please note this application number for future reference and use. candidates can take a print of the application form and keep it with them for their own records. k. no hard copy/printed applications should be sent to c-dac. incomplete and defectively filled online forms shall be rejected straightway and no subsequent correspondences will be entertained in this regard. l. candidates working in government/psus/govt. autonomous bodies should also apply online in advance and print of the application form, duly filled and signed should be forwarded through proper channel to hrd section, c-dac, hyderabad. m. those who are not forwarding their application through proper channel are required to produce 'no objection certificate (noc)' from their current employer at the time of interview, if called for, failing which they will not be permitted to attend the interview. n. any dispute with regard to selection/recruitment process will be subject to courts/tribunals having jurisdiction over hyderabad, telangana only. 8. important notes: a. c-dac reserves the right to increase or decrease the number of posts or not to recruit against any post notified in this notification at its discretion without any notice/notification. b. it is the responsibility of the candidates to assess his/her own eligibility for the post for which he/she is applying in accordance with the advertisement. in case, it is found at any point of time in future during process of selection or even after appointment that candidate was not eligible as per prescribed qualification, experience etc, which could not be found at the time of selection due to whatever circumstances, his/her candidature/appointment shall be liable to be cancelled/terminated as case may be without giving any notice. c. candidates those who are applying for multiple posts should submit separate application for each post. d. in case of ambiguity/dispute arises on account of interpretation in version other than english, english version will prevail. e. candidates are not required to send printout of application or any other documents in hard copy to c-dac. f. interview call letters, other correspondences (if any) etc. will be sent to candidates only through email to the email id provided in their online application. no hard copy will be sent. g. mere issue of interview call letter to candidate will not imply acceptance of candidature or selection for the post. h. in case of internal candidates, please note that the finally selected candidates will have to resign from the current services and join for selected post as fresh employee. i. all queries pertaining to recruitment including selection process should be addressed to our recruitment team only through recruit-hyd@cdac.in j. kindly note that we have not authorized any agent/ agency for representing c-dac for anything related to recruitment or its processes. k. c-dac reserves the right to cancel or introduce any personal interview/other selection process. c-dac also reserves the right to cancel/restrict/curtail/enlarge the recruitment process and/or the selection process without any notice and without assigning any reasons. l. c-dac reserves the right to fill/not fill up the post or even to cancel the whole or part of the process of recruitment without assigning any reason thereof. m. all the posts will be filled as per the as applicable rules / guidelines of c-dac. n. the candidates are advised to visit c-dac website regularly. notice/ information, corrigendum, extension etc., if any, shall be published on our website < only. o. no ta/da shall be paid for attending written examination/ interview. p. canvassing in any form will be a disqualification for selection. 9. important dates: a commencement of on-line registration of application by candidates 20-july-2024 b last date for on-line registration of application by candidates 16-aug-2024 c written test/interview date will be communicated later by email only important dates: acommencement of on-line principalsmaid@gmail.com>, <principal.smaid@cvmu.edu.in> respected sir/madam, we are delighted to invite your esteemed institution to participate in prajatantra 2024, a national youth festival celebrating india's incredible democracy. praja foundation, in collaboration with the national institute of urban affairs (niua) and un-habitat india, proudly presents this year's event, supported by rohini nilekani philanthropies and the friedrich naumann foundation for freedom south asia. prajatantra has grown significantly over the past six years, becoming a premier national festival that fosters a community of young changemakers from 120 cities across 28 states and 6 union territories. previous editions have seen participation from distinguished dignitaries such as shri hardeep singh puri and shri kaushal kishore, along with key figures from un and government sectors. this year's theme, "citizen participation: building blocks of democracy," emphasizes the crucial role of youth in shaping the future of our cities. we invite your institution to nominate a team of four to seven students to represent you in various competitions, including policy presentations, debates, quizzes, and more. key dates: - qualifying round (online):30th august - 1st september 2024 - semi-final (online):14th - 15th september 2024 - grand finale (in-person):16th - 18th november 2024 for further details, please refer to the attached concept note and registration form. we look forward to your participation and contribution to making prajatantra 2024 a success. warm

skills in chosen domains and to reach a large learner base by catering to learning across the country, with a focus on reaching learners from tier 2 and 3 towns with flexible offerings based on learner needs â€“ across chosen disciplines with options to learn through resources in vernacular languages. more than 1,30,000+ learners have already explored swayam plus as on date. for more subject: fwd: register for amazon women of the world (wow) for tech skill development -reg. to: having trouble reading this email? view it in your mobile/ web browser < ------------------------------ respected sir/madam, on november 16, 2023, aicte and amazon india signed a mou to collaborate on amazonâ€™s women of the world (wow) initiative. this program aims to empower and equip women students enrolled in engineering colleges across india with essential skills to thrive in the technology industry. amazon wow < offers sessions relevant across the four years of engineering. students will have access to workshops led by industry experts, resources for career advancement, information about different career paths and roles, and the opportunity to connect with peers at *free of cost.* amazon wow curriculum is designed to complement students' academic studies by providing practical insights and skills relevant to the dynamic field of engineering. through this program, students will have the opportunity to connect with amazon leaders through personalized 1:1 mentoring connects for guidance, support, and insights into career development and also upskill through sessions on a wide range of topics including: *software development* *data analytics* *cloud computing* dive into the latest programming languages, development frameworks, and methodologies. learn how to analyze and derive insights from large datasets, utilizing cutting-edge tools and techniques. explore the fundamentals of cloud platforms, infrastructure as code, and scalable application deployment. *artificial intelligence & machine learning* *leadership development & networking* *tech oa/interview practice* gain insights into ai and ml technologies, including hands-on experience with real-world applications. leadership skills & networking strategies essential for building long-term careers. prepare to succeed in tech assessments and interviews through specialized practice sessions. amazon has a series of educational sessions planned in july & august on amazon wow. these sessions offer a unique opportunity for students to gain insights into the latest trends, best practices, and career pathways within the technology industry. students will also have an opportunity to view recordings of completed sessions. next steps: women students to register on amazon wow main page by *august 15 2024*, to receive regular updates on the latest technical advancements and to participate in sessions. for any questions, please reach out to directorpnap@aicte-india.org < or contact amazon wow team at amazon-wow@amazon.com < we encourage women students at your institution to register for this program and take advantage of the resources it offers. pfa:- < *with warm regards,* *dr. dinesh singh, * fwd: good news: charusat becomes a referral partner of idp for ielts dear charusat family members, *international english language testing system* (*ielts*) is an international standardised test of english language proficiency for non-native english language speakers. ielts is one of the major english language tests in the world. globally, there are more than 4 million test takers a year, making ielts the worldâ€™s most popular english language proficiency test for higher education and global migration. it has two modules: academic and general training. ielts is jointly managed by the british council, *idp*, and cambridge english. however, in india, idp has taken over the business of the british council for ielts. ielts was developed during the 1980s and first administered to the students in 1989. ielts results are accepted by 12,000 organisations in over 140 countries worldwide, which includes *universities, colleges, schools and governments*, as well as professional and industry bodies. ielts results are also used for migration, work, & study applications in australia, new zealand, the uk, and canada. *idp* is a leader in global education services. as an *australian* listed company, idp operates in more than 50 countries and its websites attract 100 million visits a year. idp specialises in combining human expertise with a leading digital platform to help people get accepted into their ideal course, take an english language test or learn english in their schools. you will be happy to know that now charusat has become a *referral partner* of *idp education ltd*. there are numerous benefits that charusat will receive from this partnership, which are listed below: Â§ charusat now becomes the *official exam registration centre* from where students can register for ielts. they do not need to rely on consultants. charusat shall get their data from the portal as and when required. Â§ charusat students will be given *master training* by the official trainer from idp for free. Â§ students will also have *career counselling* for migration and college selection from idp. Â§ idp will provide *train the trainer workshops* for charusat faculty members for free. Â§ appropriate branding will take place on the campus. Â§ if charusat gets a good number of students registered from the campus, in near future, charusat will get *ielts exam centre* as well. please forward this message to the students of your department and motivate the interested ones to register in training and for the exam from charusat as that in the larger interest of the students charusat becomes a test centre soon. further communication about different events and the details of the registration flow will be shared by the dean, foh and their team.

fwd: new elearning format - virtual training on ai and ml in chip design [image: ai and ml in chip design] < in today's fast-paced technological landscape, artificial intelligence (ai) and machine learning (ml) techniques are revolutionizing chip design methodologies. integrated-circuit (ic) chip companies and engineers have unprecedented opportunities to use these technologies to enhance product quality across crucial dimensions such as speed, energy efficiency, and cost. this, in turn, allows for meeting goals with reduced engineering resources and accelerated time-to-market. ieee invites you to a two-day live, virtual training, *artificial intelligence (ai) and machine learning (ml) in chip design* with subject matter expert, andrew b. kahng, distinguished professor of cse and ece at university of california, san diego (ucsd). *day 1: 13 august 2024 12-2pm et * *day 2: 14 august 2024 12-2pm et* this comprehensive virtual training will equip engineers with the: - essential knowledge to leverage ai and ml effectively in chip design and eda, - understanding of the rationale behind these technological shifts to identifying high-value applications and selecting relevant ai and ml technologies, and - insights into optimizing design methods and preparing for the future of chip design. attendees of the virtual training will have the opportunity for first-hand interaction with professor kahng to ask questions during the interactive portion of the training. *learn more* < *note, this live event is part of the 2024 ieee elearning course program of the same title. the content will be loaded into ieee *xplore* and the ieee learning network after the live event for your team to access in the future. announcing tedx charusat :: ingenious creations dear charusat family members, greetings!! faculty of technology and engineering (fte), charotar university of science and technology (charusat) is going to host *tedx charusat *on september 24, 2024. this event promises to be inspiring and thought-provoking, showcasing innovative ideas and compelling stories from a diverse range of speakers. *event details:* - *date:* september 24, 2024 - *venue:* charusat campus (exact venue details will be shared on later date) - *time:* 10:00 am - 4:00 pm *tedx charusat* aims to bring together the brightest minds, fostering an environment where ideas can be shared, discussed, and celebrated. under the theme *"ingenious creations",* we will explore groundbreaking ideas and revolutionary innovations that have the potential to change the world. we believe that every participant will leave the event with new perspectives and a renewed sense of curiosity. *call for speaker recommendations:* as we prepare for this exciting event, we are looking for identification of exceptional speakers. if any staff member has any close contacts or knows of individuals who have a powerful story, innovative idea, or unique perspective to share, please refer them to us. we are looking for speakers who can inspire, challenge, and engage our audience. *how to recommend a speaker:* please send your speaker recommendations to *tedx@charusat.ac.in <tedx@charusat.ac.in> *by july 25, 2024. kindly include the following details: - name of the speaker - contact information (email and phone number) - a brief description of their background and the topic they would speak on. - a video link to the tedx /any other prominent talk given by the speaker your input is invaluable, and we are confident that tedx charusat will be an unforgettable event. thank you for your support and participation. we look forward to seeing you at tedx charusat! *for any query/concerns/information *kindly get in touch with *dr. nikita bhatt* (nikitabhatt.ce@charusat.ac.in) |* dr. dweepna garg* ( dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in) | *dr. kirti makwana *( kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in) | *ms. pinal patel* ( pinalpatel.cv@charusat.ac.in). best regards, dr. vijay chaudhary, dr. bankim patel & dr. trushit upadhyaya -- i/c principal chandubhai s patel institute of technology faculty of technology & engineering charotar university of science & technology (charusat) charusat campus, changa, 388421 petlad, anand gujarat, india. --

the process of csic (charusat startup and innovation centre) @charusat dear students, greetings of the day!! as csic coordinator, i am excited to share the process we follow at charusat. we csic (charusat startup and innovation centre), a dynamic and forward-thinking start-up center that focuses on job creators, not job seekers. our team of experts has been working tirelessly to develop cutting-edge products/services that are designed to how it can address a specific problem or fulfill a need in the market. it works with a vision to develop successful entrepreneurs who can contribute (to nation-building) through creativity, problem-solving, and innovation for the growth and development of society at large. csic aims to create an entrepreneurial ecosystem within charusat that acts as a catalyst in identifying, motivating, and nurturing entrepreneurial talents; mentoring them toward sustainable pursuits through entrepreneurship awareness, education, training, and research. we are proud to share that our start-up has already gained significant traction in the industry, and we have received positive feedback from early adopters. we would be honored to further discuss our upcoming start-up and explore potential and opportunities with ssip, for further information, kindly visit the following links. for ssip 2.0 policy: * < the steps under which entrepreneurial mindset development follows @csic: 1) sensitization/orientation activity 2) idea registration 3) idea pitching & evaluation 4) prototype building funding under ssip 5) company registration apart from the above process, other things under which students can groom themselves: 1) idea thon. 2) exposure to take part in other competitive events across india. 3) company registration you can meet me in lab 307 related to csic for any assistance. -- *nilesh kumar dubey**(phd)* assistant professor, computer science and engineering, institutional coordinator of *iqac*, *csic,* *uiic, ipr* devang patel institute of advanced technology & research changa-388421, gujarat, india. --

fwd: invitation for participation in mun - model united nations - youth parliament to be organized at charusat interested student(s) may register . *thanks and regards,* *radhika h. patel* *assistant professor* *department of information technology* *depstar,* *charusat, changa* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: registrar charusat <registrar@charusat.ac.in> date: mon, jul 15, 2024 at 3:52 pm subject: invitation for participation in mun - model united nations - youth parliament to be organized at charusat to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> dear all, we are happy to announce that charusat is organising *model youth parliament (mun)* on the theme - *lifestyle for environment*. the event is organised as a part of *yuvamanthan* *experiential learning events* guided by *ugc*. the mun is organised with a view to provide the youth opportunities to solve indiaâ€™s critical challenges through a series of meetings where they role play indian and international policy makers and engage in consensus building, international relation and diplomacy. *youth parliament* under the mun aims at teaching the youth democracy, equipping them with debating skills, stimulating them to present their own thoughts and listening to those of others, how to follow through, advocate for an idea, and make it a reality. it will be organised parallel at *two* different venues where both *international and national issues* will be discussed by the participants. the details of the same are as following: date: *july 30, 2024, tuesday* time: *2:00 pm to 4:30 pm* venue: *charusat campus* the participants will represent various countries in the international forum while national issues will be discussed by model parliamentarians representing different issues related to the theme. consensus on the resolutions will be decided by voting at the end of the discussion monitored by the jury members. all the participants will be provided with certificates of participation. you are requested to share this with all the students of your respective institutes. interested faculty members may also participate in the event. they may register themselves for the mun through the following link: for any suggestion or query you may contact dr. robert parmar, asst. professor on: +91 99254 66788. thanking you in anticipation of your participation, with

fwd: don't miss out! - eltai webinar 124 ---------- forwarded message --------- from: eltai india <info@eltai.in> date: fri, jul 12, 2024 at 8:58 pm subject: don't miss out! - eltai webinar 124 to: eltai member 2 <members2@eltai.in>, students of subjects other than english (college) <students_college@eltai.in>, teachers of english (college) <englishteachers_college@eltai.in>, eltai conference 2022 < eltaiconf2022@gmail.com>, eltai conference 2023 participants < eltaiconf23participants@eltai.in> [image: image] unlock the secrets of qualitative research [image: image] dear eltai members and students, we cordially invite you to attend our upcoming eltai monthly webinar on "doing literature review in qualitative research" on july 28th. the session will be conducted by dr. bharat neupane from kathmandu university, nepal, and will take place on the google meet platform. literature review is a crucial aspect of qualitative research, as it helps researchers to situate their study within the existing body of knowledge and identify gaps in the literature. in this webinar, dr. neupane will provide insights into the process of conducting a comprehensive literature review for qualitative research projects. key topics to be covered: - importance of literature review in qualitative research - strategies for searching and selecting relevant literature - techniques for critical analysis and synthesis of literature - structuring and writing the literature review section we encourage all eltai members and students to register for this informative webinar and take advantage of the opportunity to learn from an expert in qualitative research. we look forward to your participation and engagement in this webinar. best regards, eltai webinar team register now < [image: link] < email] <info@eltai.in>[image: instagram] < facebook] < twitter] < youtube] < link] < english language teachers' association of india d-54 third floor, anandham apartments, #156, sidco nagar main road, villivakkam, chennai - 600 049, tamil nadu, india unsubscribe < -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "eltai member 2" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to members2+unsubscribe@eltai.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < . -- charotar university of science & technology accredited grade a+ by naac accorded with centre of excellence by govt. of gujarat web: --

join us for an informative webinar with the *educationusa advisor at the u.s.- india educational foundation (usief) center, *where they'll provide you with a comprehensive overview of the essential steps you need to follow to *pursue your academic goals in the u.s *and let you know the* mastering the usa higher education application process from start to finish!* when it's happening: *friday, 19th july 2024, 7 pm (ist) onwards* *click here to register now* < or use * < *hurry up and register. only limited slots are available* in this webinar, you'll learn: - *understanding usa higher education*: explore the landscape of higher education opportunities in the usa. - *admission requirements demystified*: break down the essential criteria and requirements for successful applications. - *crafting compelling personal statements*: learn how to write impactful personal statements and essays that stand out. - *navigating application timelines*: gain insights into managing deadlines and timelines effectively. - *mastering letters of recommendation*: discover strategies for securing persuasive letters of recommendation. *click here to register now* < or use * < *hurry up and register. only limited slots are available* don't miss out on this valuable opportunity to kickstart your u.s. study journey!
