01:00 pm *venue:* cmpica auditorium, cmpica building *mr. onkar sonawane* is renowned for his expertise and contributions to the field of cybersecurity. as *india's youngest ethical hacker | 2x tedx speaker | 2x josh talks speaker, *mr. onkar brings valuable insights and innovative approaches to safeguarding digital landscapes. during this talk, mr. sonawane will share his experiences, discuss emerging trends, and provide valuable insights into the dynamic world of cybersecurity. whether you are a seasoned enthusiast or someone looking to delve into the realm of cybersecurity, this event promises to be enlightening and engaging for all. this event presents a unique opportunity to expand your knowledge and interact with a leading figure in the cybersecurity domain. we encourage all students from cspit, depstar, and cmpica to participate actively and make the most out of this enriching experience. please mark your calendars for march 2, 2024, and join us for this insightful session. *kindly register yourself by clicking here. < we look forward to your enthusiastic participation. kindly contact dr. kirti makwana (kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in) and/or mr. arpit bhatt (arpitbhatt.dcs@charusat.ac.in) for any query/ information. best regards, [image: cyber 1.0 onkar.png] *dr. chirag i patel* associate professor, & ( i/c head of department ) computer science & engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar) charotar university of science and technology (charusat), at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist:anand, (gujarat) india. ph. no: 02697-265060, ext. no. : 5299 --

fwd: syllabus for internal theory exam for digital electronics (cse101) *thanks & regards,* *mrs. mohini darji* *assistant professor* *department of computer science & engineering* *devang patel institute of advance technology and research **(depstar)* *charotar university of science and technology (charusat)* *changa-gujarat 388421* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: harshul yagnik <harshulyagnik.cse@charusat.ac.in> date: mon, 19 feb 2024 at 2:58 pm subject: syllabus for internal theory exam for digital electronics (cse101) to: <23cs@charusat.edu.in> cc: mohini darji <mohinidarji.dcs@charusat.ac.in>, gaurav kumar < gauravkumar.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, head cse <hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, hod aiml <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, hod depstar <hodds@charusat.ac.in> dear students, the syllabus for the internal theory examination for digital electronics (cse101) is as follows: unit 1: number systems different radix number systems, number base conversions, complements, signed and unsigned numbers, digital arithmetic (binary addition and subtraction (normal and with complements)), binary codes, code conversion, binary logic and logic gates unit 2: simplification of boolean functions boolean algebra (basic definitions, axioms, postulates and theorem, boolean functions: canonical and standard form, maxterm and minterm, sop and pos), simplification of boolean functions using boolean theorems and postulates, simplification of boolean functions using k-map (up to 4 variable k-map), realize logic circuit using basic gates and universal gates unit 3: combinational circuits design procedure, analysis procedure of combinational circuits, half adder, half subtractor, full adder, full subtractor all the best for examination -- harshul yagnik assistant professor, department of computer science engineering, charotar university of science & technology < +91-9737642757 < --

(artificial intelligence) for devang patel institute of advance technology and research students to: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> students learn to build hands-on ai projects. earn a certificate and an internship upon completion. dear professor dr.amit ganatra, i want to express my gratitude for the support you provided in reaching out to students during the past few months. professors like you have gone above and beyond to support students not only with their coursework but also helping them learn the latest technology beyond what is taught in regular course curriculum. we appreciate you for this. some time back we launched artificial intelligence (ai) training and have been thrilled with the response. in just a short amount of time, hundreds of students have enrolled. especially with the launch of chatgpt, ai is becoming increasingly pervasive across all industries, from healthcare and finance to entertainment and transportation. our ai training and internship program offers students the necessary skills to secure high-paying jobs in this field. considering this, we are launching a scholarship and internship program for our ai training and internship. please share this opportunity with your students. what is the artificial intelligence (ai) scholarship and internship program? - as part of this program, the qualifying students of devang patel institute of advance technology and research can *join the artificial intelligence (ai) online video training at an 80% discount.* while the regular fee of the training is rs.8,600/-, the qualifying students can get it at just rs.1,750/-. - students have to visit < to answer the scholarship test. what are some of the activities that students will perform as part of this ai training? - learn concepts of artificial intelligence (ai) from the basics. no previous knowledge is required. - learn programming languages like python, html and javascript. - during the training, we will be available to solve any doubts or queries. - students will build 6 different hands-on projects, such as their own chatgpt, ai recipe generator, ai software coding helper, ai image generator and many more... - they will also build innovative artificial intelligence (ai) projects by applying the learnings of the training in their field. why should the students avail this scholarship? - this four weeks of online video training is *excellent for those who want to start with artificial intelligence (ai)* because it teaches them to build projects from the basics. - *certificate:* upon completion of the training, which can be submitted as part of university rules as well as during the job application process. - *work on industrial projects: *the students will work on the most popular ai platform by open ai. the same platform is the base for chatgpt and is used by thousands of mncs across the globe. - *guaranteed internship upon training **completion: *this internship certificate can be submitted to the college if the university rules require them to do so. other critical points: - *the option of full refund:* in case the students are not happy with the training offered to them, then they can get a full refund as per the refund policy. this ensures that there is no risk for students or the faculty involved in the process. - *lifetime access:* students can register now and start the training after the exams or at any other time. they can also take a break in between. - link to answer the scholarship quiz: < the last date to avail the scholarship is tuesday, 20th of february 2024. my team and i are excited to teach devang patel institute of advance technology and research students about artificial intelligence (ai). if you have any questions, please reply to this email or call us at (+91)8881197198 and press 4 to speak with us. i'm happy to provide any further information you need. regards, rohit ts software developer - bolt iot bolt iot (inventrom private limited), 79, 11th cross rd, binnamangala, indiranagar, bengaluru, karnataka 560038, india < (+91)8881197198 unsubscribe < manage preferences < --

ccna academy - introduction to basics of networking technology @ depstar in ay:2023-24 dear students, greetings!!! devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar) provides knowledge of networking through the ccna academy along with the ccna certification. the cisco network academy program offers a wide range of valuable internet technology skills through ccna, and ccnp. the main purpose of cisco is to educate and train a pool of students on the campus to design, build and maintain complex computer networks for the demands and opportunities of the new economy and access to the latest it and telecommunication technology. *objectives:* to educate and train the students in our institute in the highly employable it skills in internet networking skills. this will also benefit the corporations in our state that face a shortage of skilled it personnel and this obviates their need to recruit foreign talents. *methodology:* cisco systems will provide the curriculum, training, and program support required to help establish and maintain the academies. the extensive online material for studying the curriculum is available which also includes the interactive laboratory, which establishes the confidence to work. cisco curriculum develops practical computer networking knowledge and skills in a hands-on environment. *scope of certification course:* most of the organizations are recruiting professionals who apart from the regular degree have qualified the certificate courses. cisco-certified network associates (ccna) is one such certificate course for a computer network. upon completion of ccna, students will have an understanding of networking. *ccna networking competencies cover* - computer hardware and software, electricity, networking terminology, and protocols - lans and wans, open system interconnection (osi) model, ethernet, and internet protocol (ip) addressing - design and documentation of basic network and structured cabling - network-to-network communication *fees: 2000 inr* the ccna academy - introduction to basics of networking technology in depstar will be conducted on the 1st, and 3rd saturdays of every semester by the tutor. interested students are requested to fill out the google form: < *more about the course is available at: * *course content: * *tutor:* dr. amit nayak (ph.d., head of the department - information technology) the statistics of ccna academy till the date in the institution is as follows : ay:2017-18 - 42 registered students ay:2018-19 - 32 registered students ay:2019-20 - 32 registered students ay:2020-21 - 33 registered students ay:2021-22 - 16 registered students feel free to contact radhika patel or dr. amit nayak sir for any queries. *

two days workshop on recent trends in augmented & virtual reality with hands-on on unity 3d & blender" dear students, greetings from devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar) cse department, charusat!! we are happy to announce that our department is organizing a two day workshop on *"* recent trends in augmented & virtual reality with hands-on on unity 3d & blender" dated* 16th & 17th of february 2024**.* this workshop is supported by *"charusat"**.* *purpose of workshop :- **to give a brief overview to students about the vr-ar and game development, introduction to â€œunity 3dâ€ with hands-on, creating a 3d model in blender, and mini project to develop a 3d games.* we request you to give an early intimation showing your interest to participate by filling a simple form in the link: *date: 16th & 17th february 2024.* *registration: free* note: soft copy of certificates will be given to all participants. only 50 participants will be entertained based on first come first serve. the *last date for registration is 12th february 2024*. the workshop venue and schedule will be mailed to the registered user after the last date of registration. resource person: feel free to contact as undersigned. -- *nilesh kumar dubey**(phd)* assistant professor, computer science and engineering, institutional coordinator of *iqac*, *csic,* *uiic, ipr* devang patel institute of advanced technology & research charotar university of science and technology (charusat), changa-388421, gujarat, india. *7990616659* [image: workshop.jpg] --

aiesec vvn-charusat achievement, best expansion entity of aiesec in india *i hope this message finds you well. * i want to express our sincere gratitude to charusat for their pivotal role in helping aiesec in vvn achieve the prestigious best entity award, displaying our joint commitment to fostering youth leadership and cross-cultural understanding. special thanks to dr. atul patel for exemplary leadership and unwavering support. kudos to mr. kruten patel and mr. bhadresh rana (pocs) for facilitating seamless communication, and to mr. kruten patel (pr head) for amplifying our impact effectively. a shout-out to mr. bhadresh rana (isc head) for navigating global engagements, and mr. sachin patel (official social media partner) for showcasing our initiatives innovatively. i extend my gratitude to all heads of departments, kathit shah (president of aiesec in vvn), and vice presidents - siddharth patel and lisa menpara (ogx), karan thakkar (bd), parshwa salot (mkt), shrivardhansinh jadeja (md) and yash patel (tl of bd) for their pivotal roles in their success. we look forward to continuing our collaborative efforts in shaping tomorrow's leaders. *thank you for your unwavering support!!!* -- *regards,* *radhika patel* *department of information technology,devang patel institute of advance technology and research,charotar university of science and technology,accredited with "a+" grade by naac, goi* 02/01/24, 03:17:24 pm --

session on the competitive exam awareness by ims education dear students, a session is organized for the students, who plan to pursue higher study. the purpose of this seminar is to provide valuable insights to the students and encourage them to contemplate their future in further studies. furthermore, the seminar will specifically focus on examinations such as cat, gre, gmat, etc. we aim to provide students with valuable insights into these examinations, including strategies for preparation, the significance of these exams in their academic and professional journey, and guidance on pursuing further studies. *date of the session: february 3, 2024* *venue: 329 seminar hall, a5 building * *time: 09:45 am to 11:00 am * *topics: cat, gate, gmat* please find the attached brochure for the same. regards ms. krishna patel (ph.d.) assistant professor department of computer science & engineering devang patel institute of advance technology and research charotar university of science and technology --

fwd: invitation to join launch (youtube) - moe - aicte investor network by shri dharmendra pradhan hon'ble minister of education - 31st january 2024 - 6:30 pm onwards â€“ reg. *thanks and regards,* *radhika h. patel* *assistant professor* *department of information technology* *depstar,* *charusat, changa* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: all india council for technical education(no-reply) < admin@aicte-india.org> date: wed, jan 31, 2024 at 9:25 am subject: invitation to join launch (youtube) - moe - aicte investor network by shri dharmendra pradhan hon'ble minister of education - 31st january 2024 - 6:30 pm onwards â€“ reg. to: <radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in> dear sir/madam, greetings from the ministry of educationâ€™s innovation cell and aicteâ€¦. we are herewith extending an invitation to you for the youtube live launch event of the moe - aicte investor network, a ground-breaking initiative by the ministry of education (moe) and the all india council for technical education (aicte). event details: - date: january 31, 2024 - time: 6:30 pm (ist) - platform: < *about moe - aicte investor network:* the moe - aicte investor network is an exceptional platform jointly established by aicte and moe's innovation cell. our mission is to promote innovation and entrepreneurship in the education sector by offering financial support, mentoring, and strategic guidance to early-stage start-ups and visionary entrepreneurs. this year, we aim to encourage private investment in student and faculty-led start-ups through this network. objectives: 1. empowerment of educational institutions: enable colleges and universities to become innovation hubs, fostering a conducive environment for start-up development. 2. facilitation of entrepreneurship: transform innovative ideas into scalable and sustainable businesses. 3. access to resources and funding: provide start-ups with essential resources, mentorship, seed capital, and potential investors. we would be honoured to have your online presence at this significant event. please share the youtube live link among all your network's students, faculty members, and experts. thank you for your support in promoting innovation and entrepreneurship in the education sector. pfa:- *with warm regards* *dr. elangovan kariappan* *assistant innovation director | innovation cell | ministry of education, govt. of india* *aicte hq | new delhi - 110 070 * *elangovan.kariappan@aicte-india.org <elangovan.kariappan@aicte-india.org>* --

ğ— ğ—¡ğ—–'ğ˜€ ğ—œğ—»ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—»ğ˜€ğ—µğ—¶ğ—½ ğ—™ğ—¼ğ—¿ charusat ğ—¦ğ˜ğ˜‚ğ—±ğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ˜€ [ğ— ğ—”ğ—¡ğ——ğ—”ğ—§ğ—¢ğ—¥ğ—¬ ğ—œğ—¡ğ—§ğ—˜ğ—¥ğ—¡ğ—¦ğ—›ğ—œğ—£] *dear students of charusat* *,* *(all departments 1st to 4th year**)* *[ mandatory final reminder ]* greetings from teachnook! teachnook in collaboration with *wissenaire iit bhubaneswar and iit bombay e-cell *is organizing a 2 months of training + internship program. we are enrolling only *limited students *in the program for *charusat* *.* *it is mandatory for students to fill out the form, if you get shortlisted you will be getting a call from our hr team:* *to know more information join in whatsapp group:* * < *find the below attachments for reference:* *first month*: iit training has been designed in the form of live lectures along with living mentorship from industry professionals. (login credentials will be provided to students after registration) *no prerequisites required.* *second month*: internship with live mentorship for projects from professionals. the live industry project will be giving students experience in solving real-world problems. project 1:- 10 individual projects assigned to each intern which they have to complete with their mentor . project 2:- capstone project: it's a group project assigned to a group of 15 interns. for each intern particular work will be assigned to them they have to work on it. fwd: request your students to register for yuva sangam phase-4 regards, radhika h. patel, assistant professor, department of information technology, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charusat, changa ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> date: sun, 28 jan 2024, 12:43 pm subject: fwd: request your students to register for yuva sangam phase-4 to: depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in> ---------- forwarded message --------- from: all india council for technical education(no-reply) < admin@aicte-india.org> date: sat, 27 jan, 2024, 2:01 pm subject: request your students to register for yuva sangam phase-4 to: <principal.dptr@charusat.ac.in> *the principal/dean/director/faculty* aicte approved institutions greetings from aicte ! as you are already aware that yuva sangam is a flagship program of the *ek bharat shreshtha bharat (ebsb)* initiative, launched by the hon'ble prime minister of india. this initiative focuses on conducting exposure tours of the youths comprising mainly students studying in higher educational institutions (heis) & some off-campus youths from one state to other states & vice versa. it provides an immersive experience of various facets of life, development landmarks, recent achievements and a youth connect in the host state. the program aims to promote national integration and understanding by connecting youth from different parts of the country through educational and cultural exchanges. in addition to the cultural exchange, yuva sangam also includes a number of other activities that are designed to help students develop their leadership, sports and soft skills. for example, students may get an opportunity not only to participate in workshops on leadership, communication, and teamwork but also sports events that may be organised by sai. they will also have the opportunity to meet and interact with vvips, celebrities or important personalities of the host state. the success of earlier phases of yuva sangam are a testament to the importance of investing in youth and building bridges between different communities. the program has had a positive impact on the lives of thousands of youth and has helped to build a more united and inclusive india. i request your support in motivating students of your institution to register for *yuva sangam phase-4*, a student exchange program under *ebsb.* all interested students can register online at * < the registration has started on *25-01-2024 *and the last date is *04-02-2024.* please find attached a document on how to inspire students to register for yuva sangam. pfa:- < *thank you* *(ravindra k. soni)* * adviser, aicte* --

fwd: "empower change: call for proposals now open! unnat bharat abhiyan seg portal awaits your impactful projects ğŸŒ±âœ¨ regards, radhika h. patel, assistant professor, department of information technology, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charusat, changa ---------- forwarded message --------- from: head credp charusat <head.credp@charusat.ac.in> date: sat, 27 jan 2024, 6:38 am subject: "empower change: call for proposals now open! unnat bharat abhiyan seg portal awaits your impactful projects ğŸŒ±âœ¨ to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> cc: dilip gosai <dilipgosai.pr@charusat.ac.in>, registrar charusat < registrar@charusat.ac.in>, provost charusat <provost@charusat.ac.in> dear charusat family members, vande mataram ! we are delighted to inform you that the subjet expert group (seg) portal for unnat bharat abhiyan is once again open for the submission of project proposals. this presents a valuable opportunity for faculty and students of charusat to actively contribute to the development of rural areas through impactful technological interventions. the portal will be open for proposal submission from 26th january to 9th february 2024. we encourage your active participation and collaboration in this initiative, which aligns with our commitment to fostering positive change in rural communities. the current window for proposal submission is specifically targeted at participating institutes under five segs that have successfully completed the evaluation process in the first round. the details of the segs and their respective coordinators are as follows: capacity building, strategy for convergence and implementation of various govt. schemes coordinator: dr. r. ramesh, nird&pr hyderabad ethos in technical institutions coordinator: prof. anand b. rao, iit bombay rural energy systems coordinator: prof. p.m.v. subbarao, iit delhi sanitation & solid waste management coordinator: prof. indumathi nambi, iit madras sustainable agriculture system coordinator: dr. r.n. padaria, iari new delhi to submit proposals, principal investigators (pis) can contact dr. dilip gosai, head, credp, and submit projects on the portal through the direct uba charusat login link: once logged in, navigate to the "apply for seg proposal" tab on the left side of the dashboard/screen, and select the seg of interest to submit the proposal under two categories: technology development and technology customization. categories and fund caps: technology development: fund cap: â‚¹1,00,000 description: this category involves the submission of proposals where technological interventions are ready to be disseminated in the field/rural areas. solutions should be sustainable, innovative, implementable, and scalable. pis should ensure the sustainability of the project post-completion. technology customization: fund cap: â‚¹50,000 description: this category involves technological interventions already available in the market but require alterations/modifications to benefit the rural population. pis should specify a time target for specific outputs and ensure project sustainability post-completion. note: long-term research projects, fellowships, costs on ph.d. programs, setting up laboratories/centers, exhibitions, workshops, and capital/construction are not available through the unnat bharat abhiyan program. the focus is on providing financial support for technical interventions in the fields of uba-connected villages, not for general r&d. we kindly request you to circulate this information within your pi network and motivate them to submit proposals within the stipulated time frame (till 9th february 2024). thank you for your cooperation and enthusiastic participation in unnat bharat abhiyan. together, we can make a meaningful impact on rural development. warm regards, dr. dilip gosai head credp ( charusat rural education development program) charotar university of science & technology accredited grade a+ by naac charotar university of science & technology charusat campus - changa off nadiad-petlad highway, pin-388421 gujarat, india ph +91-2697-265160 cell no.+91-98252-93046 web: --

ctc ncc vvnagar, student of b. tech computer science engineering department, depstar of charotar university of science and technology changa is selected to represent gujarat directorate in the republic day camp at new delhi from 28-12-23 to 08-02-24. he is selected in *prime minister's rally* to be held at *km cariappa parade ground, new delhi on 28th january 2024*. it is a proud moment for the entire *2 guj ctc ncc vvnagar group and the charusat family.* it is the best achievement by our student as *only 107 cadets* have been selected from gujarat state. apart from curriculum, aws academy (charusat) registration for cloud foundation course [registration deadline extended] dear teachers/students, greetings!!! it is a matter of pleasure that 7 (4cp+3sa) batches of aws academy have completed with more than 600+ (667 trained - 100+ certified) students aws certified who benefited in terms of good internship and job opportunities. interested students are requested to register themselves using the following link: > *registration for cloud foundation course: *click here!! > < note: the batch registration will be closed on *6th january 2024*. as said by brain tracy: "continuous learning is the minimum requirement for > success in any field." so *we would highly encourage the students to take > part in aws academy * [image: 33bd050e-fea5-45a1-8ded-ca3fc79e2ea1.jpg] *learning outcomes:* - efficient design and deployment of the aws system - cost-evaluation and cost-control mechanisms - elastic load balancing on multiple ec2 instances - data ingress and egress on aws - identifying relevant and suitable uses of aws architecture - lift and shift mechanism of aws on-premises applications - finding the right solutions based on computational, database, and security needs - and of course, be aws certified ready! as we have become an aws academy member institute, we can start providing training to the students which help them to uplift their career as it professionals. *following are a few glimpses about aws certification:* aws certifications demonstrate the skills to design and manage software solutions on amazon's ultra-popular cloud platform. simply put, cloud computing is the on-demand, pay-as-you-go distribution of it resources over the internet. amazon web services (aws) is the worldâ€™s leading cloud platform and provider of these resources. as more and more businesses move traditionally in-house services to the cloud - to reap benefits like reduced costs and increased efficiency - those with skills and certifications in the latest cloud computing solutions - especially those from aws - will enjoy a wide range of job opportunities and top-tier salaries. *benefits of aws certification* there are numerous advantages to becoming aws certified. amazon web services certificationsâ€¦ - validate your skills and knowledge in the preeminent cloud computing platform. - are consistently listed among the top-paying info-tech certifications worldwide. - garner more interviews for aspiring cloud specialists and higher wages once hired. - are recognized industry-wide as reliable and well-designed tech credentials. - demonstrate credibility and dedication to your cloud computing career path. - provide access to a network of like-minded peers and aws thought-leaders. - require recertification which ensures that your aws skills remain current. *for any query contact: * dr. minal patel (depstar-ce) [m - 9998574188] minalpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in prof. sanket suthar (cspit-it) sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in <sandippatel.it@charusat.ac.in> dr. parth shah (hod, it, cspit) parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in ---------------------------------------- --

welcome to charusat cycling club - let's get rolling! dear cyclist, we are thrilled to extend a warm welcome to you as a new member of the charusat cycling club! your passion for cycling aligns perfectly with our mission to foster a vibrant community of riders dedicated to health, fitness, and the joy of cycling. to kick off your membership journey and get better acquainted with our club, we've arranged a special welcome meeting. *details for the meeting are as follows*: date: 2nd january, 2024. time: 11:00 a.m. onward venue: ec/ee auditoria, first floor. *agenda:* 1] introductions: meet fellow members and the charusat cycling club committee. 2] q&a session: ask any questions you may have about the charusat cycling club. this meeting will be a fantastic opportunity for you to immerse yourself in our cycling community, connect with fellow riders, and gain insights into how we operate. should you have any specific questions or require further information beforehand, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. we're excited to have you join our charusat cycling club and look forward to meeting you at the welcome meeting. best regards, dr. yogesh jani dy. director of physical education and sports charusat physical education and sports section (a constituent of charusat) *accredited with "grade a+" by naac,goi* *accredited with centre of excellence by gog* landline no : 02697-265036 mobile: 95582 95583 -- 97142 96999 --

tap into your creative skills! - join credp as a volunteer and make a difference - unique opportunity awaits you! dear charusat students, i trust this email finds you in good health and high spirits. we are excited to invite you to become an integral part of the *charusat rural education development program (credp) *as a volunteer. this is a unique chance to contribute to meaningful initiatives and further develop your skills in report writing, editing, digital communication, photo collages and video reels, social media handling, and creative expression. *why volunteer with credp?* credp is dedicated to bringing about positive change in rural communities through education and development programs. by joining credp as a volunteer, you will have the opportunity to: 1. *make a positive impact:* contribute to projects benefiting and uplifting rural communities. 2. *enhance your skill set:* hone your report writing, photo and video editing, social media management, and creative skills in a practical and impactful setting. 3. *build meaningful connections:* connect with fellow volunteers, professionals, and experts with a passion for community development. 4. *be part of something meaningful:* play a crucial role in addressing educational challenges and fostering sustainable development in rural areas. *volunteer opportunities:* we are currently seeking enthusiastic volunteers for a variety of activities, including: 1. *report writing and editing:* assist in crafting compelling reports that communicate the impact of our programs and initiatives. 2. *social media handling:* contribute to managing our social media platforms to raise awareness and engage with our audience effectively. 3. *creative skills:* apply your creative talents in design, content creation, and other digital creative tasks to support our educational and developmental projects. 4. *presentation to schools:* utilize your creative skills in designing and delivering presentations to school authorities and students about the saras 3d program, a joint educational and developmental project. *how to get involved:* if you are eager to make a difference and interested in joining credp as a volunteer, please fill out the attached volunteer registration google form < . feel free to express your preferences and highlight your areas of expertise, and we will strive to match you with a project that aligns with your interests. *orientation session:* we will conduct an orientation session to provide more insights into credp and the exciting volunteer opportunities available. this session will be an excellent opportunity for you to learn more about our organization, meet the team, and have any questions you may have addressed. the date of which will be announced later. *conclusion:* your involvement as a credp volunteer can make a tangible difference in the lives of those we serve. we look forward to welcoming you to our dynamic team and collaborating with you on projects that matter. should you have any questions or need additional information, please don't hesitate to contact us at dr. dilip gosai at 9825293046 or rajesh gadhvi at 7874839350. thank you for considering this opportunity to be a force for positive change. thanks & regards, *corporate communication officer* [image: ïŒ] : < [image: ï“½] : * < [image: my account - activating your personal whatsapp link] < --

fwd: sardar patel good governance cm fellowship programe *thanks and regards,* *radhika h. patel* *assistant professor* *department of information technology* *depstar,* *charusat, changa* ---------- forwarded message --------- from: nisha panchal <nishapanchal.dce@charusat.ac.in> date: sat, dec 16, 2023 at 11:23 am subject: fwd: sardar patel good governance cm fellowship programe to: <22dce@charusat.edu.in> *for your information* dear sir/madam, greetings from kcg, department of education! the education department, government of gujarat aspires to achieve equity, inclusiveness, and quality in education through good governance. good governance is the way of empowering the masses and deliverance of the benefits of higher education to the most deprived. this not only ensures accountability but also ensures that discrimination and disparities in the education system do not take place. the government of gujarat has initiated a new step for establishing good governance - *sardar patel good governance cm fellowship programe* with *academic partner indian institute of management, ahmedabad (iima)*. under the sardar patel good governance cm fellowship 2023, a total of 20 fellows will be placed in various departments and offices. the applicant has to apply online for this fellowship. to fill the online application form, the applicant has to visit and go through the notification for more details. you are kindly requested to disseminate the information to all the students of your universities so that the student fulfilling the criteria can get the chance to work with government, this will give them a new experience. the advertisement for the same is also attached herewith. thanking you. *regards,* *prof. a. u. patel,* *advisor, kcg,* *former vice-chancellor,* *gujarat university* -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_ce" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_ce+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < . -- *nisha a. panchal,* *assistant professor,* *department of computer engineering,* *devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar)* *charotar university of science and technology (charusat)*

you are requested to go through and adhere to the examination guidelines listed below: 1. bring your hall ticket. 2. wear id cards. 3. do not bring any kind of stationery material and equipment, if it is not required for the subject. 4. do not bring a writing pad and stationery pouch in the examination hall. 5. report to the examination venue at least 20 minutes before the examination starts.*(cmpica building)* please get in touch if you have any questions. regards, on wed, dec 6, 2023 at 4:30 pm dr. kirti makwana < kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in> wrote: > dear students, > > the fy university theory examination will start from 18/12/2023. kindly > find the examination guidelines such as instructions to be followed, > instance(s) of *unfair means (ufm)* adopted, punishment handled for the > ufm, *detention* criteria and *know your answer book (kya).* hereby, all > of you are requested to go through and adhere the examination > guidelines listed below: > > 1. bring your hall ticket. > 2. wear id cards. > 3. do not bring any kind of stationery material and equipment, if it > is not required for the subject. > 4. do not bring writing pad and stationery pouch in the examination > hall. > 5. report to the examination venue at least before 20 minutes of > examination starts. > > *instance(s) of unfair means (ufm) adopted* > > 1. > > if an examinee is discovered in possession of any examination-related > materials, such as pads, written or printed materials, chit slips, compass > boxes, handkerchiefs, clothes, or any part of the body, as well as foot > scales, calculators, cell phones, electronic devices, or stored information > in electronic gadgets, electronic watches, or any act of snatching notes, > chits, answer books/tablets, or any part thereof from another examinee, > either within the examination hall or outside it (such as in the toilet or > lobby), or if they attempt to contact any unauthorized person during the > examination period, and it is determined that they have copied from the > mentioned materials, disciplinary actions will be taken. this includes > situations where literature is found near or just beneath the examinee's > seat, even if they claim not to have copied from the material. > 2. > > an examinee caught attempting to copy from a neighboring examinee's > answer sheet/tablets or engaging in examination-related inquiries through > gestures or talks, with the other person found cooperating, will face > disciplinary action. this includes any communication with another examinee > or attempting to pass on information, even after receiving a warning from > the supervisor, examiner, or any competent authority. > 3. > > an examinee will face consequences if they have included > identification or irrelevant symbols, sketches, or marks that could overtly > reveal their identity. use of indecent or abusive language in the > examination hall or answer book, or engaging in writing unrelated subject > matter before the exam starts is strictly prohibited. furthermore, > attempting to bribe the examiner by providing personal details such as > address, contact information, or mobile number, or trying to establish > direct contact with the examiner or through a representative for personal > favors, is considered a serious violation and will lead to disciplinary > action. > 4. > > if an examinee engages in improper practices during an examination and > is subsequently discovered by a university observer through close-circuit > cameras, disciplinary measures will be taken. improper practices may > include cheating, attempting to copy from unauthorized materials, or any > other actions that violate the examination guidelines. the use of > close-circuit cameras is a means to monitor and maintain the integrity of > the examination process, and any breaches will be dealt with according to > the university's policies and procedures. > 5. > > copying from another examinee or facilitating cheating by allowing > someone to copy from one's answer book or passing on exam-related material > to another examinee in the exam hall is a serious violation of academic > integrity. > 6. > > attempting to destroy evidence, such as chewing on a chit, found in > possession during an examination, is a serious violation. consequences may > include academic penalties or disciplinary actions as per the institution's > policies. > 7. > > an examinee displaying non-cooperative behavior, including unfair > means or misbehavior with supervisors or observers, may face disciplinary > consequences. this includes failure to follow instructions, obstruction, > threats, or verbal assault. > > *punishment handled for the ufm : *the examinee's result will stand > cancelled/failed in all congratulations to cadet. radha barad on this extraordinary achievement! jai hind everyone, greeting of ncc unit - charusat i am pleased to share remarkable news regarding one of our students, radha barad (23ec002) from ec department, cspit of our esteemed university. radha barad has recently been recommended for the prestigious national defence academy (nda) for air force and indian naval academy(ina)for 10+2 navy tech entries , both being permanent commission entries. it would also be the first batch of girls joining the indian naval academy for this entry. her dedication has earned her the remarkable achievement of securing all india rank 124 in the order of merit among the candidates for nda entry. she has received a joining letter from nda for 151 courses commencing on 2 january 2024. service allotted to her in nda is air force ground duties. this reflects her unwavering determination to serve the nation. this was her motivation to join ncc in her first year , have her personality developed as well as to have a chance to serve the society. the charusat ncc unit and 2ctc ncc unit has been motivating and supporting her throughout her journey to fulfill her dream. this accomplishment not only brings pride to radha and her family but also reflects positively on our university. charusat university and 2ctc ncc unit is proud of radha barad for her remarkable achievement, and we congratulate her on this significant milestone. we wish her continued success in all her future endeavours.

regarding the sad and untimely demise of charusat/mtin student - bhabhor divyaben vijaybhai â€“ 21gnm003 dear all, with grief, i have to inform you that *bhabhor divyaben vijaybhai â€“ 21gnm003*, a student of *manikaka topawala institute of nursing* pursuing *general nursing and midwifery (gnm) program* at charusat committed suicide in charusat hostel on monday - december 11, 2023 shockingly for some personal and unknown reasons. we are deeply grieved by the sad demise of our family member. may the soul rest in peace! this is indeed an immense loss to her family, friends, and classmates, too. we share their grief and sorrow. may god give them the strength & courage to bear the loss! on a personal level as well as on behalf of charusat and the mtin family, let us express our heartfelt condolences for the painful loss. with prayers in the heart for her eternal peace, we pray for the departed soul. finally, let us strive to stand by one another in all pain and agony, success and failures, victories and losses; may them be personal, social or professional. let us create a healthy collaborative environment for the peaceful existence of all. *om shanti, shanti, shanti!* dr. atul patel registrar accredited grade â€œa+â€ by naac --

congratulations to mr. ravi yadav on this extraordinary achievement! jai hind everyone, greeting of ncc unit - charusat i am pleased to share remarkable news regarding one of our outstanding students, mr. ravi yadav, from our esteemed university. ravi yadav has recently been recommended for the prestigious indian military academy (ima) as a commissioned officer(permanent commission). his exceptional dedication and prowess have earned him the remarkable achievement of securing the all india rank 6 in the order of merit among the candidates for this entry. in addition to his exemplary performance, ravi has been an active member of our university's national cadet corps (ncc). his commitment is evident through his participation in various national camps, including the republic day camp (rdc) and youth exchange program (yep). these experiences have undoubtedly contributed to his growth and excellence in the field. ravi's journey reflects not only his commitment to personal development but also his unwavering determination to serve the nation. it is worth mentioning that he expressed his aspiration to join the forces during his initial year of ncc training, and today, he has successfully realized that dream. this outstanding accomplishment not only brings pride to ravi and his family but also reflects positively on our university. charusat university is exceptionally proud of ravi yadav for his remarkable achievement, and we congratulate him on this significant milestone. we wish him continued success in all his future endeavours.

gentle reminders for campus etiquette and respectful conduct *dear students,* i hope this message finds you well. as we navigate through the corridors of knowledge and explore the realms of academia, it becomes essential for us to uphold the principles of shared responsibility and respect for our learning environment. after each class,* let's extend a small act of kindness by turning off the fans, ac, and lights.* it's a gesture that not only conserves energy but also reflects our commitment to sustainability and a greener campus. in the realm of laboratories, where innovation takes flight, *i urge you to treat the space with the same care and consideration you would your own. after each experiment, take a moment to arrange chairs, mouse, keyboard, and cables. *by doing so, we contribute to the smooth functioning of the labs and create an atmosphere conducive to learning for everyone. furthermore, the little things matter. *wearing your id card is not just a rule but a symbol of belonging, an acknowledgment of the community we are building together.* it fosters a sense of unity and security on our campus. remember, our collective efforts in maintaining the decorum of our classes and labs create an environment where everyone can thrive. let's approach each day with the understanding that our actions, no matter how small, contribute to a positive and inclusive atmosphere for all. for those students whose semester begins on december 18, 2023, please make sure you are aware of the attendance requirements as of the first day of your particular semester. fulfilling these prerequisites is essential to guarantee a seamless academic experience. *thank you for your cooperation, and let's continue to make our campus a place we are all proud to call home.* -- *regards,* *sachin patel* *department of information technology,devang patel institute of advance technology and research,charotar university of science and technology,accredited with "a+" grade by naac, goi* [image: mailtrack] < sender notified by mailtrack < 12/07/23, 01:44:31 pm --

examination guidelines dear students, the fy university theory examination will start from 18/12/2023. kindly find the examination guidelines such as instructions to be followed, instance(s) of *unfair means (ufm)* adopted, punishment handled for the ufm, *detention* criteria and *know your answer book (kya).* hereby, all of you are requested to go through and adhere the examination guidelines listed below: 1. bring your hall ticket. 2. wear id cards. 3. do not bring any kind of stationery material and equipment, if it is not required for the subject. 4. do not bring writing pad and stationery pouch in the examination hall. 5. report to the examination venue at least before 20 minutes of examination starts. *instance(s) of unfair means (ufm) adopted* 1. if an examinee is discovered in possession of any examination-related materials, such as pads, written or printed materials, chit slips, compass boxes, handkerchiefs, clothes, or any part of the body, as well as foot scales, calculators, cell phones, electronic devices, or stored information in electronic gadgets, electronic watches, or any act of snatching notes, chits, answer books/tablets, or any part thereof from another examinee, either within the examination hall or outside it (such as in the toilet or lobby), or if they attempt to contact any unauthorized person during the examination period, and it is determined that they have copied from the mentioned materials, disciplinary actions will be taken. this includes situations where literature is found near or just beneath the examinee's seat, even if they claim not to have copied from the material. 2. an examinee caught attempting to copy from a neighboring examinee's answer sheet/tablets or engaging in examination-related inquiries through gestures or talks, with the other person found cooperating, will face disciplinary action. this includes any communication with another examinee or attempting to pass on information, even after receiving a warning from the supervisor, examiner, or any competent authority. 3. an examinee will face consequences if they have included identification or irrelevant symbols, sketches, or marks that could overtly reveal their identity. use of indecent or abusive language in the examination hall or answer book, or engaging in writing unrelated subject matter before the exam starts is strictly prohibited. furthermore, attempting to bribe the examiner by providing personal details such as address, contact information, or mobile number, or trying to establish direct contact with the examiner or through a representative for personal favors, is considered a serious violation and will lead to disciplinary action. 4. if an examinee engages in improper practices during an examination and is subsequently discovered by a university observer through close-circuit cameras, disciplinary measures will be taken. improper practices may include cheating, attempting to copy from unauthorized materials, or any other actions that violate the examination guidelines. the use of close-circuit cameras is a means to monitor and maintain the integrity of the examination process, and any breaches will be dealt with according to the university's policies and procedures. 5. copying from another examinee or facilitating cheating by allowing someone to copy from one's answer book or passing on exam-related material to another examinee in the exam hall is a serious violation of academic integrity. 6. attempting to destroy evidence, such as chewing on a chit, found in possession during an examination, is a serious violation. consequences may include academic penalties or disciplinary actions as per the institution's policies. 7. an examinee displaying non-cooperative behavior, including unfair means or misbehavior with supervisors or observers, may face disciplinary consequences. this includes failure to follow instructions, obstruction, threats, or verbal assault. *punishment handled for the ufm : *the examinee's result will stand cancelled/failed in all courses of that semester examination. *detention rules:* the university allows students three attempts to clear courses offered in the current semester: the regular examination, supplementary examination 1, and supplementary examination 2. if a student fails to pass the course within these three attempts, they will not be promoted to the next academic year. promotion to the next academic year is contingent upon successfully clearing all the courses in the current year of study. *know your answer book (kya) :* - after the declaration of the university examination result, if a student is not satisfied with the result, he / she gets options of *know your answer - book (kya).* the student has to apply within three working days after the notification of the result for the same. *steps to be followed by students to apply for kya* 1) login in e-governance 2) go to "e-governance" module 3) click on "students" menu 4) click on "kya application form" 5) select exam(s) and subject(s) 6) click "submit" to apply for kya 7) pay fees to the account section *(kya application will be considered only if the fees are paid on or before the last date of application.)* *this is for your kind information and adherence. * *we have scheduled an interaction with all of you; tomorrow at 10:00 am @ room no. 329. you are hereby informed to remain present for the same. *

congratulations on your new career with teachnook! *greetings to charusat student,* are you looking to kick off your journey? as we come close to the end of the year, it's the perfect time to think about your career path for the next year. whether you're figuring out your next move or just want to learn something new, it's time to grow your career & to success in 2023? if yes, then here is some really exciting news from us! we are pleased to share with you that our company, teachnook, is collaborating with wissenaire (iit bhubaneswar) to offer a unique 2-month training + internship program. this advanced program will provide you with the missing practical skills that you need to enhance your career. teachnook has been awarded *linked-in top start-up 2023* because of the value of the essentials that we provide to our students who register with us. v firstly, fill the google form if you are shortlisted you will be getting a call from our hr team: * < v secondly, join our whatsapp group for more details: * < - *first month & second month ( 6 weeks )* the combination of theoretical training sessions and practical projects is an effective way to ensure that students not only understand the concepts they are learning but also know how to apply them in real-world situations. it's great to hear that the program offers 10+ practical projects, as this will provide ample opportunities for students to gain hands-on experience and develop their skills. congratulations on successfully completing the 6 weeks of the program. now it's time to tackle the second month of your coursework. - *second month ( 7 th & 8th week )* you must be looking forward to the second month, where, apart from virtual and real-world learning tools, you can also participate in the capstone project. this project will involve solving a real-world, industry issue for a genuine company â€“ giving you the opportunity to gain invaluable industry experience and create a distinct project to showcase on your resume. and also you'll be having a mentor from the same mnc , he'll be guiding you in each and every moment of your internship period - access to our growth community for further internship opportunities. - *certifications:-* 1. internship completion certificate from mnc collaboration with teachnook. 2. course completion certificate from iit bhubaneswar.(wissenaire) 3. course completion certificate from ultimate gurus. - *benefits * 1. lms portal access ( 6 months ) 2. resume building 3. interview preparation and be job ready 4. placement opportunity (200+ mnc's+top startups) 5. live case study explanation 6. career counselling *mentors & their linkedin profile as follows :* - *samrat tomar* - car design mentor ( deputy manager at jcb india ltd. - *meghana gowda* - data analytics/business analytics mentor( data analyst at flipkart. - *pranjul gupta* - machine learning ( software development engineer ii at disney + hotstar. - *aditya bhattar* - data science mentor ( data scientist at rapido. - *vignesh kamath* - investment banking mentor ( goldman sachs, jp morgan, axis capital, iim alumnus. - *ankit raj bachchan* - social media marketing and marketing management ( mycaptain, tvf, wittyfeed. - application for fresher internship at ibm & mcf *dear * *students,* *teachnook in collaboration with ibm *is organizing a *2 month training + internship program *designed by ibm. we are enrolling only limited students for the program. *interested students fill out the form, if you get shortlisted you will get a call from our hr team;* * < *find the below attachments for reference:* *first month: *ibm training has been designed in the form of live lectures along with live mentorship from industry professionals which is conducted in the ibm portal. ( login credentials will be provided to students after registration ) *second month:* internship with live mentorship for projects from professionals. the live industry project will give students an experience in solving real-world problems. *project 1 minor project**: *it's an individual project assigned to each intern which they have to work on their own. *project 2 major project:* it's a group project assigned to a group of 15 interns. for each intern particular work will be assigned to them, and they have to work on it. (essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by the company side itself ) *after completion of program, the student shall receive a :* âœ… *program completion certificate issued by ibm.âœ… co-branded internship certificate.* *âœ… letter of recommendation* *âœ… access to a growth community. * get join our official whatsapp group for more information [image: image.gif] < bipin shah key account manager,teachnook 8310144082 | teachnook.com | bipin@teachnook.com 592, 3rd block, koramangala 1a block, koramangala 3 block, koramangala, bengaluru, karnataka 560068 < [image: mailtrack] < sender notified by mailtrack < 11/14/23, 08:30:42 pm

subject - aws academy (charusat) registration for cloud foundation course (december 2023 onwards) dear teachers/students, greetings!!! it is a matter of pleasure that 7 (4cp+3sa) batches of aws academy have completed with more than 600+ (667 trained - 100+ certified) students aws certified who benefited in terms of good internship and job opportunities. as said by brain tracy: "continuous learning is the minimum requirement for > success in any field." so *we would highly encourage the students to take > part in aws academy * [image: 33bd050e-fea5-45a1-8ded-ca3fc79e2ea1.jpg] *learning outcomes:* - efficient design and deployment of the aws system - cost-evaluation and cost-control mechanisms - elastic load balancing on multiple ec2 instances - data ingress and egress on aws - identifying relevant and suitable uses of aws architecture - lift and shift mechanism of aws on-premises applications - finding the right solutions based on computational, database, and security needs - and of course, be aws certified ready! as we have become an aws academy member institute, we can start providing training to the students which help them to uplift their career as it professionals. *following are a few glimpses about aws certification:* aws certifications demonstrate the skills to design and manage software solutions on amazon's ultra-popular cloud platform. simply put, cloud computing is the on-demand, pay-as-you-go distribution of it resources over the internet. amazon web services (aws) is the worldâ€™s leading cloud platform and provider of these resources. as more and more businesses move traditionally in-house services to the cloud - to reap benefits like reduced costs and increased efficiency - those with skills and certifications in the latest cloud computing solutions - especially those from aws - will enjoy a wide range of job opportunities and top-tier salaries. *benefits of aws certification* there are numerous advantages to becoming aws certified. amazon web services certificationsâ€¦ - validate your skills and knowledge in the preeminent cloud computing platform. - are consistently listed among the top-paying info-tech certifications worldwide. - garner more interviews for aspiring cloud specialists and higher wages once hired. - are recognized industry-wide as reliable and well-designed tech credentials. - demonstrate credibility and dedication to your cloud computing career path. - provide access to a network of like-minded peers and aws thought-leaders. - require recertification which ensures that your aws skills remain current. interested students are requested to register themselves using the following link: > *registration for cloud foundation: *click here!! > < note: the batch registration will be closed on 30th november 2023 and this batch will start from 16th december 2023. *for any query contact: * dr. minal patel (depstar-ce) [m - 9998574188] minalpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in prof. sanket suthar (cspit-it) sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in <sandippatel.it@charusat.ac.in> dr. parth shah (hod, it, cspit) parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in ---------------------------------------- *dr. minal patel **[**àª¡à«‹. àª®à«€àª¨àª¾àª² àªªàªŸà«‡àª² **]* (ph.d. - dharmsinh desai university (ddu)) assistant professor, department of computer engineering, devang patel institute of advance technology and research(depstar), charotar university of science and technology (charusat), at. & post changa-388421, ta: petlad, dist:anand, (gujarat) india. --

f.y. university practical exam schedule :a.y.2023-24 dear students, greetings!! kindly find the attached *university practical exam schedule*. *all of you are required to: * - follow the seating arrangements allocated to your slot/examination (for the practical exam/viva and waiting areas) ,would be shared by the subject coordinator on google classroom. . - *not* to roam in the lobby area. - bring your id card without fail. - carry hall ticket. - be in formal attire. - carry practical files | journals | any other required documents | stationery items as per the course requirements.

fwd: request to participate in "wah!" campaign by energy swaraj foundation -regarding regards, radhika h. patel, assistant professor, department of information technology, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charusat, changa ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> date: fri, 3 nov 2023, 5:49 pm subject: fwd: request to participate in "wah!" campaign by energy swaraj foundation -regarding to: depstar <depstar@charusat.ac.in> ---------- forwarded message --------- from: all india council for technical education(no-reply) < admin@aicte-india.org> date: fri, 3 nov, 2023, 2:54 pm subject: request to participate in "wah!" campaign by energy swaraj foundation -regarding to: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> dear madam/sir, greetings from aicte! we are happy to inform you that the energy swaraj foundation is organising a *campaign "wah! - wrinkles - achhe hai"* to promote environmental consciousness among the rnasses from october 23, 2023. the primary goal of the "wah!" campaign is to inspire 1 crore people to *wear non-ironed clothes every monday*, thereby reducing carbon emissions. the campaign's motto is *"every monday - wrinkle day - green today."* by participating, we aim to raise awareness and encourage organizations and individuals to embrace climate corrective action. by joining the "wah!" campaign, you can be a vital part of this environmental movement, and together, we can make a significant impact on creating a cleaner, greener, and more sustainable environment. to participate and register for this challenge, you may visit- < participating in this challenge will not only support a more sustainable and environmentally friendly future but also offer the members of your organization a distinctive chance to address climate change through straightforward yet impactful changes in behavior. we look forward to your positive response and the opportunity to work together in harmony with india's mission life. *pfa:- < * *pfa:- < * *pfa:- < * *with

charusat cycling club *dear students and staff members,* we are excited to announce the launch of the charusat cycling club (ccc), a fantastic opportunity for both boys and girls, as well as staff members, to indulge in the world of cycling. if you're passionate about cycling or looking to explore this exhilarating activity, we invite you to join our club! to register your nomination and become a part of the charusat cycling club, please click on the following link: * < by joining the club, you'll have access to: *group rides:* connect with fellow cyclists for group rides and explore the scenic routes in and around our university campus. *workshops and training:* enhance your cycling skills with workshops and training sessions conducted by experienced riders. *community and support:* join a community of like-minded individuals who share your passion for cycling. *health and fitness*: enjoy the numerous health and fitness benefits that cycling provides. don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to be a part of our cycling community. register now, and let's embark on this cycling journey together! if you have any questions or need further information, please feel free to reach out to *prof. punit patel* or write an email to* punitpatel.me@charusat.ac.in <punitpatel.me@charusat.ac.in> * let's pedal towards a healthier and more active lifestyle! happy cycling! *prof. punit patel * *asst. professor * *mechanical engineering department, * *cspit, charusat* -- university sports officer charusat physical education and sports section (a constituent of charusat) *accredited with "grade a+" by naac,goi* *accredited with centre of excellence by gog* landline no : 02697-265036 mobile : 95582 95583 -- 97142 96999 --

fwd: regarding mysy scholarship certificate issuance update ---------- forwarded message --------- from: registrar charusat <registrar@charusat.ac.in> date: thu, nov 2, 2023 at 1:50 pm subject: regarding mysy scholarship certificate issuance update to: dear all, this is to inform you that certificate-related processes for the following scholarships will exclusively take place through the e-governance system. 1) mukhymantri yuva swavalamban yojana (mysy) 2) hon. chief minister scholarship scheme (cmss) 3) digital gujarat scholarship 4) national scholarship this means that students, who are eligible for the above-mentioned scholarships must apply for and obtain his/her certificates via the e-governance system. manual certificate issuance by institutes will no longer be an option. thank you for your cooperation and support in implementing this important initiative. with

fwd: charusat - fms - iiim - invitation @ prabandhan 2023 (exhibition cum sale) - inaugural ceremony regards, radhika h. patel, assistant professor, department of information technology, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charusat, changa ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal iiim charusat <principal.iiim@charusat.ac.in> date: thu, 2 nov 2023, 1:52 pm subject: charusat - fms - iiim - invitation @ prabandhan 2023 (exhibition cum sale) - inaugural ceremony to: charusat family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in> dear all, greetings! we are thrilled to inform you all that indukaka ipcowala institute of management (iiim) is organising *prabandhan â€“ 2023 *during november 03-06, 2023 (10:00 am to 09:00 pm). prabandhan is a student-driven event wherein the students work in close collaboration with the industries, entrepreneurs, gruh udhyog, and smes to understand the product, devise marketing strategies, learn financial management, negotiation skills, and ultimately sell the product. all faculty and staff members are invited to visit the exhibition and motivate the student participants. the inaugural ceremony details are as follows: *chief guest: dr. r v upadhyay (provost, charusat)* *place: sardar patel banquet hall, anand (opp. d z patel high school, 80 feet road, anand)* *date: november 03, 2023 (friday)* *timing: 10:00 am* *please find the attached invitation and product poster herewith this mail.* *hoping to see you all at prabandhan 2023.* *

admin@aicte-india.org> date: mon, 23 oct, 2023, 2:50 pm subject: request your students to register for yuva sangam phase-3 to: <principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in> *the principal/dean/director* aicte approved institutions *gentle reminder! * greetings from aicte ! as you are already aware that yuva sangam is yuva sangam is a flagship program of the ek bharat shreshtha bharat (ebsb) initiative, launched by the hon'ble prime minister of india. this initiative focuses on conducting exposure tours of the youths comprising mainly students studying in higher educational institutions (heis) & some off-campus youths from one state to other states & vice versa. it provides an immersive experience of various facets of life, development landmarks, recent achievements and a youth connect in the host state. the program aims to promote national integration and understanding by connecting youth from different parts of the country through educational and cultural exchanges. in addition to the cultural exchange, yuva sangam also includes a number of other activities that are designed to help students develop their leadership, sports and soft skills. for example, students may get an opportunity not only to participate in workshops on leadership, communication, and teamwork but also sports events that may be organised by sai. they will also have the opportunity to meet and interact with vvips, celebrities or important personalities of the host state. the success of yuva sangam phase 1 and 2 is a testament to the importance of investing in youth and building bridges between different communities. the program has had a positive impact on the lives of thousands of youth and has helped to build a more united and inclusive india. i request your support in motivating students of your institution to register for *yuva sangam phase-3*, a student exchange program under *ebsb.* all interested students can register online at * < the registration process has started on *18-10-2023 *and the last date is *28-10-2023.* please find attached a concept note containing a brief about yuva sangam phase 1 and 2, eligibility criteria and also a document on how to inspire students to register for yuva sangam. *pfa:- < * *pfa:- < * *pfa:-* *thank you* *(ravindra k. soni)adviser, aicte * --

training and internship program for charusat student dear *charusat* student, ğŸ“*teachnook *in collaboration with* iit bhubaneswar (wissenaire)*, we are delivering a 2, 6, and 8-month online training and internship program designed and mentored by industry experts from top mncs to b-tech and management students. we have collaborated with over 100+ companies that are willing to hire from us. we are also the authorized certification partner for *microsoft, ibm, adobe, autodesk, and quickbooks!!* ğŸ“štraining: students will attend theoretical training sessions led by industry leaders throughout the program. but that's not all; *after each theoretical session, students will work in a live session on a practical experience project with a specific mentor.* this hands-on approach allows students to apply what they've learned in the classroom to real-world problems while receiving live advice and feedback from industry professionals. *interested students fill out the form, if you get shortlisted you will get a call from our hr team;* click here to apply. < âš™ï¸practical experience: during this period students will work on a capstone project for a real organization, gaining significant industry experience and a project to show future employers. students will receive mentorship and assistance throughout this time to help them learn more effectively. ğŸ‰ *students would receive 3 certifications post-completion of the program:* 1) completion certificate in collaboration with iit-b ( wissenaire). 2) internship certificate from a co-branded company. 3) mock interviews, resume preparation, and career advice will be provided to students for their future profession. get join our official whatsapp group for more information *vipul* *key account manager* *9019030952* *vipul.taliyan@teachnook.com <vipul.taliyan@teachnook.com>* [image: mailtrack] < sender notified by mailtrack < 10/21/23, 10:28:47 pm

fwd: chandrayaan-3 maha quiz celebrations at your institution on 20th october, 2023 -regarding ---------- forwarded message --------- from: all india council for technical education(no-reply) < admin@aicte-india.org> date: wed, 18 oct, 2023, 5:12 pm subject: chandrayaan-3 maha quiz celebrations at your institution on 20th october, 2023 -regarding dear madam/sir, greetings from all india council for technical education (aicte)! this has reference to our previous communications dated 25th september and 13th october,2023 where it was informed that the hon'ble pm, during his address to isro scientists on 23rd august, declared the launch of the chandrayaan-3 maha quiz on the mygov platform starting from september 1st, 2023. the quiz is designed to engage and educate students about india's lunar mission, and we highly encourage participation. to participate, candidates must create an individual account on mygov visiting < all participants will receive a downloadable participation certificate, while winners will be awarded cash prizes (details attached). as higher education institutions (heis) play a vital role in knowledge creation and dissemination, we request you to encourage faculty members, researchers, students, and other stakeholders to actively participate in the chandrayaan-3 maha quiz at the mygov platform by organizing a mega event for chandrayaan-3 maha quiz celebrations at your institution on 20th october, 2023 in such a manner that every category of stakeholders gets opportunity in separate slots (eg. ug/pg semester wise etc., each slot comprising 30 minutes). you are also requested to submit the report after the successful chandrayaan-3 maha quiz celebrations on 20th october, 2023 in the google form at the following link: *google form link* : < we appreciate your support in spreading awareness about this exciting opportunity. *with

fwd: request your students to register for yuva sangam phase-3 -regarding ---------- forwarded message --------- from: principal depstar date: wed, 18 oct 2023, 6:55 pm subject: fwd: request your students to register for yuva sangam phase-3 -regarding to: *the principal/dean/director* aicte approved institutions greetings from aicte ! as you are already aware that yuva sangam is yuva sangam is a flagship program of the ek bharat shreshtha bharat (ebsb) initiative, launched by the hon'ble prime minister of india. this initiative focuses on conducting exposure tours of the youths comprising mainly students studying in higher educational institutions (heis) & some off-campus youths from one state to other states & vice versa. it provides an immersive experience of various facets of life, development landmarks, recent achievements and a youth connect in the host state. the program aims to promote national integration and understanding by connecting youth from different parts of the country through educational and cultural exchanges. in addition to the cultural exchange, yuva sangam also includes a number of other activities that are designed to help students develop their leadership, sports and soft skills. for example, students may get an opportunity not only to participate in workshops on leadership, communication, and teamwork but also sports events that may be organised by sai. they will also have the opportunity to meet and interact with vvips, celebrities or important personalities of the host state. the success of yuva sangam phase 1 and 2 is a testament to the importance of investing in youth and building bridges between different communities. the program has had a positive impact on the lives of thousands of youth and has helped to build a more united and inclusive india. i request your support in motivating students of your institution to register for *yuva sangam phase-3*, a student exchange program under *ebsb.* all interested students can register online at * < the registration process has started on *18-10-2023 *and the last date is *28-10-2023.* please find attached a concept note containing a brief about yuva sangam phase 1 and 2, eligibility criteria and also a document on how to inspire students to register for yuva sangam. *thank you* *(ravindra k. soni)* *adviser, aicte * --

go to * < - select your region (*iiec for gujarat, rajasthan and madhya pradesh*) - click on the iiecâ€™s link on the website and fill out the form. *the benefits:* - shortlisted teams will be guided by boeing and startup experts to help refine ideas to be identified as potential business offerings - winning teams in the national finals stage will receive a cash prize worth *inr 10,00,000/-*. *apply today < feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. best regards, team iiec [image: sample 2.png] -- *nilesh kumar dubey**(phd)* assistant professor, computer science and engineering, institutional coordinator of *iqac*, *csic,* *uiic, ipr* devang patel institute of advanced technology & research charotar university of science and technology (charusat), changa-388421, gujarat, india. --

join our cognizance '23 website development team! dear all, i hope this message finds you well. we are excited to announce the formation of our cognizance '23 website development team, and we are looking for enthusiastic and talented individuals like you to join us in creating an exceptional website for this year's event. cognizance '23 is just around the corner, and our website will be the virtual gateway to all the information, updates, and features that make this event special. we are seeking dedicated team members who are passionate about web development and who want to contribute their skills and creativity to make this website a success. if you are interested in being part of our website development team, please click on the following link to access the application form: registration link < application deadline: *22nd october 2023* whether you have experience in web development or are just starting, we welcome all levels of expertise. what matters most is your enthusiasm, dedication, and commitment to creating an outstanding online experience for our cognizance '23 participants. here are some of the roles you can apply for: 1. *front-end developer* 2. *back-end developer* 3. *ui/ux designer* 4. *fullstack developer* feel free to apply for multiple roles if you possess the skills and interest in them. please take the time to fill out the application form with your information and indicate your preferred role(s). our team will review all applications carefully, and we will contact you with further details regarding the selection process. if you have any questions or need more information, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at 21cs042@charusat.edu.in . we are excited about the opportunity to work together and create an amazing website for cognizance '23. join us in making this year's event unforgettable through your contributions to the website development team. thank you for considering joining us on this exciting journey! best
