research insight week- 10 *research insight* â€œcaring is the essence of nursing.â€ â€”jean watson *enhancing nursing simulation education: a case for extended reality innovation* *abstract*â€” this concept paper explores the use of extended reality (xr) technology in nursing education, with a focus on three case studies developed at one regional university in australia. tertiary education institutions that deliver nursing curricula are facing challenges around the provision of simulated learning experiences that prepare students for the demands of real-world professional practice. to overcome these barriers, xr technology, which includes augmented, mixed, and virtual reality (ar, mr, vr), offers a diverse media platform for the creation of immersive, hands-on learning experiences, situated within virtual environments that can reflect some of the dynamic aspects of real-world healthcare environments. this document analysis explores the use of xr technology in nursing education, through the narrative and discussion of three applied-use cases. the collaboration and co-design between nursing educators and xr technology experts allows for the creation of synchronous and asynchronous learning experiences beyond traditional nursing simulation media, better preparing students for the demands of real-world professional practice. *publisher: * mdpi *for more detail*: find attachment --------- thanks &

fwd: build your startup with b v jagadeesh; october 28-november 1, 2023@ iiec iit gandhinagar ---------- forwarded message --------- from: iiec iit gandhinagar <iiec@iitgn.ac.in> date: thu, 5 oct, 2023, 4:51 pm subject: build your startup with b v jagadeesh; october 28-november 1, 2023@ iiec iit gandhinagar to: dear friends, greetings from *iit gandhinagar innovation and entrepreneurship center.* we are happy to announce an excellent opportunity for budding entrepreneurs, students and early-stage startups to build a strong foundation for their startup journey by participating in our flagship program for founders- *"build your startup with b v jagadeesh*". *the program will be conducted in person at iiec, iit gandhinagar, from october 28-november 1, 2023.* this is the fifth edition of the highly effective and in-depth program to help founders understand the fundamentals of the entrepreneurial journey- whether it's developing a product or achieving product-market-fit, sales, marketing, and fundraising. the program will look at the pitfalls, lessons to be learned, team-building techniques at different stages of growth, early market identification, product definition, pricing issues, etc., through case studies and real-life examples. the participants will also go through the mechanics of valuation and funding at various stages in the start-up life cycle. the program facilitator, *mr* *bv jagadeesh*, a highly regarded serial entrepreneur, mentor, and angel investor, has designed a unique curriculum, synthesising his three decades of experience in building and scaling startups and drawing from others' successes and failures in the silicon valley and other parts of the world. the deadline for submitting the applications is *october 10, 2023.* please refer to the attached information brochure for more details about the program. *registration for the program can be done here < please share the information with anyone who may be interested in attending.* please feel free to get in touch if you have any questions or clarification about the program. best

fwd: nptel local chapter : spread the word: carbon zero challenge 4.0 regards, radhika h. patel, assistant professor, department of information technology, devang patel institute of advance technology and research (depstar), charusat, changa ---------- forwarded message --------- from: nilesh dubey <nileshdubey.ce@charusat.ac.in> date: wed, 4 oct 2023, 8:35 pm subject: fwd: nptel local chapter : spread the word: carbon zero challenge 4.0 to: dear sir/madam, greetings from iit madras! iit-madras - inviting applications from eco-innovators working on zero-carbon, sustainable and circular economy solutions we are glad to inform you that the fourth edition of carbon zero challenge (4.0), an all india eco-innovation and entrepreneurship contest has been launched. owing to the success of czc 3.0, this is even bigger and better. applicants get access to a lot of opportunities, resources and much more. czc 4.0 aims to accelerate the lab-to-market transition of eco-innovations in india by funding innovations from proof-of-concept, lab-scale solutions to working prototypes or pilots. czc 4.0 would focus on fostering innovative solutions incorporating circularity and sustainability for managing and conserving the following resources - air, water, soil, materials, and energy. who can apply? teams working on eco-innovations that are sustainable and provides circular economy solutions with a validated proof of concept theme for czc 4.0: crc or â€œcircularity in resources conservationâ€ domains: air, water, soil, materials, and energy. czc 4.0 offers - award upto rs.5 lakhs for prototype development - mentorship and entrepreneurship training - startup seed grant of upto rs.10 lakhs - chance to get incubated at iitm - visibility and networking opportunities if your team has an eco-innovation with a validated proof of concept in any of the above domains and interested in implementing your technology in the field through entrepreneurship, we strongly encourage you and your team to apply for czc 4.0. for more information visit, we will be shortlisting about 100 teams, of which 15 teams will be given prototype funding up to rs 5 lakhs per team. the teams will be trained on customer discovery, business model and sustainability metrics by experts. the top 15 teams will be provided with funds for prototype development and will be monitored for a period of 6 months. at the end of 6 months, teams will be given an opportunity to showcase their prototype at iit madras and will be evaluated by subject matter experts. the top 5 teams will be shortlisted for receiving the start seed grant of upto 10 lakhs and continued support, including access to the iitm incubation ecosystem. please visit for more details and apply at we look forward to your participation and please spread this information across your network. if you have any questions about the competition, please write to us at carbonzerochallenge@gmail.com, or call us at 044-22575328/+91-9566092982 between 9.30 am - 5.30 pm from monday to saturday. thank you. warm regards, *divya d* local chapter team nptel ic & sr, 3rd floor, iit madras -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "nptel local chapter" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to noc-spoc+unsubscribe@nptel.iitm.ac.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < . --

india hackathon-2023 (5th edition) to: dear sir/madam the government of gujarat's education department has embarked on a comprehensive journey of fostering innovation within its network of affiliated colleges and universities. their strategic approach involves crafting and nurturing an ecosystem conducive to innovation. to streamline and give a formal structure to these diverse initiatives and the support mechanisms accompanying them, the student startup and innovation policy (ssip 2.0) has been conceptualized and is currently in the process of implementation. in continuation of its commitment to advancing the legacy of innovation, the education department has planned 5th edition of the "new india hackathon 2023" within the framework of ssip 2.0. this upcoming program is envisioned as a platform for addressing challenges faced by state government departments and municipal corporations. however, its scope extends beyond that, with a broader objective of fostering innovative hardware and software solutions that can tackle a wide array of challenges. the program features more than 150 problem statements from various governmental entities, providing students with ample opportunities to engage in solution-oriented projects. moreover, winning teams will not only receive cash prizes but also invaluable mentorship, further encouraging their pursuit of innovation and excellence. *all students from your school/institute/university to actively participate in 5th edition of the "new india hackathon 2023." this event presents a fantastic opportunity for students to showcase their problem-solving skills and innovative thinking. to get involved, student teams can register for the hackathon by visiting the registration page at < registered, they can explore a range of available problem statements at < and select one that aligns with their interests and expertise. the solutions need to be original, and innovative with the proper understanding of problem statements. it's important to note that the last date for team registration and the deadline for synopsis submission is october 31, 2023. the registration process for selecting problem statements is currently open, so we encourage all students and faculty members to participate in this exciting event. for any questions or clarifications, please feel free to reach out to us at ssipgujarat@gmail.com <ssipgujarat@gmail.com>. your active engagement in this endeavor is highly encouraged and appreciated.* --

fwd: request to participate in national entrepreneurship challenge (nec).| e-cell, iit bombay ---------- forwarded message --------- from: all india council for technical education(no-reply) < admin@aicte-india.org> date: fri, 15 sept, 2023, 6:27 pm subject: request to participate in national entrepreneurship challenge (nec).| e-cell, iit bombay to: greetings from aicte.. we hope this mail finds you well, we are happy to share that with a legacy spanning 25 years, asiaâ€™s largest student-run startup promoting body, e-cell iit bombay, having received patronages from unesco, make in india, startup india, and digital india, has just launched its latest initiative of the year, the *n*ational *e*ntrepreneurship *c*hallenge *(nec)*. nec is more than just a competition; it's a transformative journey designed to instill an entrepreneurial mindset in the younger generation. over a span of 6 months, participating students will build and establish an entrepreneurship cell (e-cell) in their college through a series of guided tasks tailored to their unique growth prospects. by becoming a part of nec, it opens the door to a multitude of advantages: 1. participants will get certified by e-cell, iit bombay, and prize money worth inr 6 lakhs. 2. get a chance to visit the iit bombay campus for e-summit 2024. 3. receive mentorship and build a network with like-minded. 4. compete with top e-cells, get a chance to represent your e-cell at a national level, and earn social media recognition for your e-cell. to cater to diverse needs, nec offers two distinct tracks: *basic track: *"sowing the seeds of entrepreneurship" for colleges seeking to establish an entrepreneurship cell from the ground up, fostering an entrepreneurial culture within their institution. *advanced track: *"take your e-cell to newer heights" for institutions with an active e-cell that can conduct workshops, events, and sessions, aiming to elevate their operations and broaden their reach. additionally, nec extends a warm invitation to experienced members of the entrepreneurship community in your college to join nec as nec mentors. mentors play a pivotal role in guiding e-cells, sharing their valuable insights, and helping them navigate the journey toward setting up a sustainable e-cell. the top mentors stand a chance to win prizes worth inr 56k. to seize this opportunity, please register via the following links: advance and basic track registration: nec mentor registration: the registration deadline is 18th september. for any queries or further information, please feel free to reach out to: akshat agarwal: +91 90733 31493 poojita mishra: +91 94078 11024 pfa:- *with

fwd: request for assistance in communicating new certificate course information to students dear students are you ready to take your career to the next level? agace academy, charusat is excited to announce our new certificate course in â€˜*essential skills for career success: preparing for campus placements*â€™. this course is designed to help you develop the skills you need to succeed in your job search and career. the course covers a wide range of topics, including: - resume building - group discussion - interview preparation - effective professional communication - personal branding - soft skills - professional etiquette the course will be taught by experienced professionals with a proven track record of helping students succeed. they will share their knowledge and expertise with you, and help you develop the skills you need to succeed. the course is limited to 25 students, so i encourage you to register early. classes start on september 18, 2023, from 4:30 to 6:00 pm (4 days/week). to register, please contact dr. kaushik trivedi at 9265620055 or dr. vijay makwana at 9998380041 by september 16, 2023. i look forward to seeing you in class! team agace charusat --

*samvardhan*, a cultural club of cmpica, charusat is organizing a university-level competition for preparation of *â€œeco-friendly shri ganesha idol makingâ€* to sculpt their own â€œ*ganpati* bappa *idol**â€*. herewith, all the interested students can register themselves to participate in this competition and are requested to fill out the following form by 15/09/2023, wednesday on or before 16.30 hrs. date of competition 16/09/2023, saturday time of competition 10.00 am to 12.00 pm venue of competition cmpica central square *rules of competition* - team size: max:02 students - idol will be prepared on the spot and height should not be more than 2fts. - all participants will get a participation certificate. - duration will not be more than 2 hours. - all participants will be responsible for bringing clay or natural substances. - idol must not be painted with oil paints or harsh chemicals. - use biodegradable items like paper, fruits, or flowers for decoration, and avoid the use of plastic. - no multiple entries are allowed with the same email id and student id - cash prize to winner of â‚¹ 1500/-, to runners up of â‚¹ 1000/-. regards, -- dr. sanskruti patel associate professor smt. chandaben mohanbhai patel institute of computer applications faculty of computer science and applications charotar university of science and technology changa. -- you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups "depstar_cse" group. to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. to view this discussion on the web visit < . --
